title: BESS & EMS Lead Software Developer at Volvo Energy
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**We shape the world we want to live in!**
------------------------------------------


Volvo Energy is our newest business area with the overarching purpose of supporting the Volvo Group’s transformation ambitions within electrification, sustainability, circularity, complete service offer, profitable growth and resilience.

 **The team - Volvo Energy Digital & IT**  

Our team builds market leading platforms and digital products with unsurpassed safety and reliability. Through these, we enable the shift to fossil-free transport operations and a fossil-free world.  

We are comprised of different nationalities spread across the globe, united by our interest in technology and purpose of enabling green energy usage with our digital solutions.

**So - what are we looking for in this specific role?**
-------------------------------------------------------


In your role, you will focus on our Energy Management Systems (EMS) that support the complex needs of our Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) products in the rapidly evolving energy markets.

  

You will support in establishing connectivity between the BESS units and its connected services, including local & cloud EMS functionality, and BESS digital twin that is the base for our evolving data-driven tools and decision engines. You’ll build the environment in and around our IoT Edge devices, incl. connected vehicle chargers, sustainable energy generation and other devices enabling smart and connected energy management.

  

You’ll work with market interoperability between energy systems, encompassing standards like IEC 60870-5, 61850 and DNP-3 and make sure the IoT Edge solutions are designed to communicate accordingly. You will ensure reliable and cyber secure connectivity between edge components and the Volvo Energy EMS solution via MQTT/OPC-UA as defined by the Volvo Energy target architecture.

**Working at Volvo Energy is different**
----------------------------------------


Welcome to a close-knit team! We see ourselves as a fast-paced company within the Volvo Group, supported by our many great colleagues, we have the best of both worlds! We believe that work should be fun, stimulating, challenging and rewarding, but also have a meaning and a purpose to the individual. Trust and Results are two guiding principles for how we work together, and we are here to make a difference!

 **Qualifications likely required to be successful**  

* Knowledge in the areas of:

 Energy management systems (EMS)  

Supervision and Control systems (e.g. SCADA)  

Protocols like Modbus, MQTT and OPC-UA

* Solid understanding of cyber security, data management and modern integration technologies
* Experience developing embedded systems like connectivity modules or SCADA systems related to energy management, electric grids or real estate site control.
* Experience from Agile development and DevOps practices.
* Strong technology interest and a curiosity to always learn more.
* Ability to work closely with colleagues in a diverse environment with several different development teams, both inside Volvo and with other players in the Digital Ecosystem.
* University education relevant to the position: electrical engineering, industrial engineering, computer science, Data, Informatics or equivalent.
* Fluency in English, written and spoken.
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


re you excited to bring your skills and disruptive ideas to the table? We can’t wait to hear from you. Apply today!

  

Are you curious to hear more about the job? Feel free to contact me:  

Axel Kullander, Head of Digital Products – Battery Technology  

axel.kullander@volvo.com  

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/axelkullander/

  

Last application date: 2025-05-14

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Volvo Energy** lives and leads the change in accelerating Volvo Group’s electrification journey and driving circularity for a better tomorrow. We bring together people with who will work in a highly diverse, equal and inclusive global context with an entrepreneurial spirit where everyone is key and directly contributes to achieving our ambitions for wanted position: better for people – better for planet – better for business. Together – from individual success to collective significance!

title: Developer with Rails and Ember.js experience
description:
*Teamtailor is changing the way companies work with employer branding and recruiting online. Working at Teamtailor means working with smart people that are passionate about their work in a fast-growing, profitable scale-up with a proven product-market fit.*

Our product has over 10,000 customers worldwide and more than 150,000 candidates apply for jobs through it **every day**! Do you want to improve recruiting processes worldwide and help people find their dream jobs?


Now we’re looking for more experienced developers who can join our Product team and take our Applicant Tracking System to the next level.

**What we are looking for…**

* An **experienced** full stack developer with at least 3 years experience with both Ruby on Rails and Ember.js
* A Product-Minded Software Engineer with experience working in fast-moving companies.
* A self-motivated “manager of one” who enjoys being in the driver’s seat and seeing the impact of their work directly. A true doer who values pragmatism.
* A team player that has excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English.
* 

**What you will get to do…**


The Product team consists of 50 highly passionate designers and developers, working closely together in small teams using Shape Up as our foundation. We are open-minded, provide feedback to each other, and we believe that all team members take their responsibility and ship awesome features with great user experience together as a team.


As a developer in a small cycle team you will get end-to-end responsibility for shipping projects every cycle that will have a direct impact on improving the hiring process for millions of candidates and hundreds of thousands users.

* Make **product-conscious decisions**, considering user needs and business goals, and being mindful of edge cases and real-world usage.
* Break projects down into scopes according to the Shape Up method, and take ownership of **driving them forward**, making thoughtful trade-offs along the way to ensure projects ship on time.
* ️ Find simple and elegant solutions to complex problems, and write maintainable, scalable, and well-tested code in **Ruby on Rails and Ember.js**.
* Prioritize effectively to avoid unnecessary work and **focus on what really matters**, completing tasks on time and with minimal supervision.

**What we offer you…**

* Work from our office in central Södermalm in Stockholm
* Full Equipment (MacBook Pro, iPhone Pro, Monitor)
* ‍‍ Budget for work-away trips with the team
* Company trip every year

title: Diagnostic Function Developer

We at Electromobility are taking the heritage of best-in-class conventional products and turn that into environmentally friendly and sustainable top-notch electrical products. The Electromobility department combines the benefits of a large international company with the feeling of working at a small company. There is close collaboration between different parts of the organization from sales and purchasing to workshops and labs all located in the modern, inspiring facility CampX. title: Fullstack Developer .NET
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging the status quo in the property management industry. We're committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our cloud-based platform is unique, and we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player in a brief time. Our global product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a skilled and experienced Fullstack Developer to join our team. In this role, you’ll be involved in the design, development, and maintenance of sophisticated software applications. You’ll play a key role in advancing our Financial Crime application services for clients in the UK market.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities Will Include**
* Design, develop, and maintain web applications using modern front-end and back-end technologies.
* Collaborate with designers, product owners, and other developers to ensure that the application meets business requirements and is user-friendly.
* Write clean, modular, and well-documented code that is easy to maintain and scale.
* Conduct code reviews to ensure code quality and consistency.
* Work in a multicultural team to troubleshoot and resolve software defects and issues.
* Debug and fix issues as they arise and continuously improve the performance and reliability of the application.
* Stay up to date with new technologies, frameworks, and industry trends to ensure that our applications are built with the latest best practices.


**Who You Are**
 You have excellent communication and collaboration skills, allowing you to work effectively within a team and contribute to the success of projects. You thrive in an environment where you can embrace new challenges, collaborate closely with team members, and deliver high-quality software solutions. You believe open-mindedness and a willingness to learn from others are essential for personal and team growth. You are a Swedish citizen with fluency in English.
   

  

**Experience**
* 2+ years of software development experience, focusing on full-stack development.
* Strong experience with programming in C#, .Net Core and Azure functions
* Experience in MySQL and Azure storage accounts
* Experience in modern front-end frameworks, preferably in Blazor with Mudblazor.
* Experience in agile development methodologies.


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


**Location**
 Our office is on the top floor in the newly built Sthlm 04, which offers stunning views over Stockholm.
   

  

**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**ComeOn Group in short** 




 Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group offers 15 brands across multiple markets on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 550 talented employees across 7 main locations. 
 



  

 As a Frontend developer you will work on UI components that deal with new brand creation, analytics, SEO and some compliance related features. It also involves high level of collaboration with the rest of the cross functional team. for example brainstorming, define technical structure and implement the product and its technical solutions.
   





  

  

  




**Requirements**
* Be a role model towards other developers in the team
* Keeping yourself up-to-date with latest and greatest in the JS ecosystem
* Encouraging to new ideas
* Being a good communicator also requires you to work on your listening skills and ability to understand others.
* Well organized - be more autonomous in your work, you'll be asked to help others, as well as to review or attend meetings; you also have to monitor multiple projects at the same time.
* Supporting the team to boost their skills to create a stimulating work environment.
* Be an engine to improve the product and boost team productivity



**About You** 




 In depth knowledge of JavaScript (preferably 5+ years)
 



 Previous experience with large scale React/SPA applications and good experience in React and its ecosystem such as Redux, React-router.
 



 Good experience with CSS, Sass and libraries like styled-components.
 



 Strong fundamentals of web development and good debugging skills.
 



 Good experience working with component based architecture.
 



 Know your way around GIT .
 



 Experience with web performance and tools like lighthouse.
 



 Understanding of frontend tooling - for ex - web pack
 



 Good knowledge of W3 standard, Web APIs
 



 Take end-to-end ownership of the products, from design to release.
 



 Good understanding of UI/UX - we love super-cool animations
 



 Having full stack experience is a plus, especially full stack within Java.It is a plus but not mandatory to have domain knowledge (igaming)
   

  




**Benefits**

**So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?** 



+ A competitive remuneration package including a company bonus scheme! 💰
+ Fantastic quarterly team events and weekly company events 😎
+ A one-time bonus to help you set up a comfortable workstation at home (we're truly Hybrid!)
+ On top of our Hybrid work arrangement, up to 40 days a year to work fully remote from anywhere 🌎
+ Wellbeing allowance



 At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.
 



 At ComeOn Group we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assess candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are. 
 



 Want to know more about us just visit our website www.comeon-group.com or any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture!

title: Software Engineer/Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a key member of our team, you'll design, develop, and maintain backend solutions for our Stores. Working in an agile environment, you'll collaborate with product managers, business and frontend engineers to deliver high-quality, scalable software. The ideal candidate is passionate about backend development, proficient in C# and .Net, and stays updated with Microsoft Development best practices.
   

  

**In addition to the above, your role will involve:** 
  

  

* API Design: Collaborating on the design and implementation of APIs that facilitate seamless communication between the Mobile Application and backend, ensuring an efficient flow of data in the headless ecommerce environment.
* Databases (SQL/ NoSQL): Contributing to data modelling and database design, optimizing storage and retrieval mechanisms to align with the requirements of a headless ecommerce architecture.
* Azure Cloud: Leveraging your expertise in Azure Cloud services to enhance the scalability, reliability, and performance of our backend systems, ensuring a seamless integration with our headless ecommerce applications.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 At Store Lens, we work closely with Portfolio Brands and H&M Brand to design and provide technical solutions. We contribute to product development at every stage, from setting requirements to rollout and testing. From day one, we focus on improving by listening, building, and refining as we go. Even as we define requirements, we are already thinking ahead, using early designs, first developments, and new learnings to continuously make the product better.
   

  

 We are curious, active listeners and hands-on doers.
   

  

 Beyond your work with Store Lens, you will also be part of our Engineering/QA community, where you will have access to a network of experts, resources, and opportunities to grow.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience), and at least 5-8 years of experience as a Software Engineer with backend focus.
* Proficiency in C# and .NET.
* Proficiency in Azure concepts and native development using Azure functions.
* Experience in concept as Always up and message queuing.
* Experience of CI/ CD pipelines using Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions.
* Experience of containerization technologies like Kubernetes and Docker.
* Experience in Database (e.g. Cosmos Db).
* Experience in POS, Payment and Checkout area is a plus.
* Experience in SignalR is a plus.


*And people who have:*
* Continuous learning mindset to stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in backend testing.
* Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts clearly.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Experience conducting code reviews, identifying areas of improvement, and provide constructive feedback to maintain code quality and consistency.
* Familiarity in backend testing with a focus on ensuring the reliability and performance of backend systems.
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development methodologies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Node.js Developer
description:
Metodika is a growing Medtech company, and their software is the core system running private clinics and hospitals in 9 countries, but mainly in the Nordic region. They constantly develop new functionalities for their clients, driven by their demands to stay ahead in the increasingly tech-dependent healthcare sector. They are a small team working closely with large and demanding clients. Metodika is part of the Carasent Group, a listed company.
 




  





**What you’ll do** 





 As a senior developer, you will work across diverse domains within healthcare, contributing to more efficient and patient-centred care. Your responsibilities may include integrating new healthcare applications, enhancing platforms, developing new connections with national systems, and exploring emerging business areas. Your tasks will range from architecture and design to hands-on programming, all while collaborating with clients to understand their system requirements.
 




  





**Who are you?** 





 You are an independent programmer with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make well-informed decisions. You will be interested in creating solutions that will improve processes and increase patient satisfaction. We also believe you are comfortable with prioritising their client’s needs and ensuring that they meet their requirements and deadlines.
 




  






 We believe you have several years of experience in software development. However, we are confident that a strong willingness to learn can compensate for experience, and we will therefore focus on your personal qualities for this position.
 




  





**Qualifications** 



* Experience with writing clean, scalable, and testable code.
* Knowledge of software development principles and best practices.
* Experience in relational database design and SQL.
* Confident with Javascript (browser or backend Node.js).
* Knowledge of object-oriented programming.
* Fluent English
* The right to work in Sweden.



  





**Nice to Have** 



* Previous experience from Medtech or Healthcare
* Swedish/Scandinavian language skills
* Experience with 4D and Typescript
* Experience with containers and working CI/CD



  





**Benefits** 



* Competitive compensation and good benefits.
* 2 wellness hours/week & wellness allowance.
* 6 weeks of vacation.
* Flexible working hours and a hybrid workplace.
* Private Healthcare Insurance.
* “Green bonus compensation” for not taking your car to work.
* Fantastic new spacy office just by Medborgarplatsen, Stockholm.
* Working for a company certified as “Excellent Employer 2023” (top 10% of companies named by Nyckeltalsinstitutet)



  






 As part of our recruitment process, they do background checks from SRI.
 




  






 If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact 
 
 zoe.lepluart@ninox-limited.com
 
 . 
 




  






 Sound like a good fit? Please send in your application today. We will review the applications continuously, but answers may be delayed 
 




  





***About Carasent***




*Anchored in the vision of enabling future care, Carasent provides healthcare organisations with a seamless ecosystem of integrated solutions that significantly reduce administrative burdens and improve patient engagement and healthcare delivery.* 




  





*Through its broad portfolio of products and services, such as cloud-based electronic health record systems, tools for electronic patient communication and virtual visits, business intelligence solutions, and numerous existing partner integrations, Carasent offers the most flexible clinical business support available in the Nordic market today.* 




  





*Carasent has offices in Sweden and Norway with customers ranging from primary and secondary care to occupational health and rehabilitation, primarily in the private sector.*

title: Frontend Developer (React)

description:

**Please note: this role is based in a Swedish-speaking office and the interview process is in Swedish. You must be fluent in Swedish to be considered for this role.**

 They provide a white-label casino platform for clients globally - a fantastic product which covers iGaming, Sportsbook and Poker, as well as offering a wide range of payment solutions. They are well-established and very profitable, and are looking to grow their development team in all areas to add capacity to help build more features and develop their casino platform further.
 



  





**About you:** 




 A Senior or Mid-Level Developer with 5+ years experience, you'll have the hunger and drive to relish a new challenge. The iGaming industry is evolving fast, as is this fantastic casino platform. You'll feel passionate about being a part of that.
 



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Senior or Mid-level Developer (5+ years commercial experience)
* Strong in JavaScript/Typescript
* Strong experience of React.js
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* A good communicator



  





**The Offer** 



* 4 day weeks during the summer
* Hybrid working - 3 days in office / 2 days at home
* A quality Stockholm office space
* Private healthcare
* Healthcare budget
* A generous profit-share bonus scheme - last year this was €40k bonus per person!



  





 The base salary level is approx between SEK 55k - SEK 65k pm.
 



  





 If you're an experienced Frontend Developer comfortable with React and based in Stockholm, please apply now!

title: Software Engineer - AI Team | Stockholm
description:
*Are you a skilled Software Developer with expertise in .NET, SQL, and Python? Do you have a passion for building low-latency applications and a knack for A/B testing, end-to-end testing, and monitoring? Are you excited about bridging AI and real-world applications to solve meaningful problems? Join Apotea’s Data and AI team and help us transform e-commerce and digital healthcare through innovative AI and ML solutions!*
**AI + Apotea =**
 Apotea is Sweden’s leading online pharmacy, committed to making healthcare accessible and efficient for everyone. Our Data and AI team is at the heart of innovation, building AI and ML applications that enhance customer experience, streamline operations, and create a foundation for future innovations. By following industry best practices, we develop modern data and AI architectures that deliver value to both the business and our customers.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Software Developer in the Data and AI team, you will but not limited to:
   

  

* Design, develop, and maintain high-performance, low-latency applications using .NET, SQL, and Python.
* Conduct A/B testing and end-to-end testing to ensure system reliability and optimize performance.
* Implement and optimize data collection mechanisms on the website to ensure accurate and efficient data capture.
* Implement robust monitoring solutions to proactively detect and resolve issues.
* Collaborate with data engineers, ML engineers, and cross-functional teams to build AI-driven solutions that solve real-world problems.
* Contribute to the development of modern data and AI architectures, ensuring scalability and alignment with industry best practices.
* Play a key role in improving customer experience and operational efficiency through innovative technology.


**Who You Are**
 We think you are a problem-solver with a focus on delivering high-quality, impactful solutions. You are an collaborative team player who can also work independently and have a passionate about learning more about data, AI, and ML, and eager to work closely with experts in these fields and you also have:
   

  

* Proficient in .NET, SQL, and Python, with a strong understanding of software development principles.
* Experienced in A/B testing, end-to-end testing, and monitoring.
* Skilled in building low-latency, high-performance applications.
* Experienced in implementing data collection mechanisms on websites (e.g., tracking user interactions, event logging, and data pipelines).
* Skilled in data modeling, with the ability to design and maintain structured, efficient, and scalable data models.
* Familiar with software architecture principles and capable of making critical tradeoffs in design and implementation.
* Experienced or interested in working with recommendation and search systems (a plus).


**Bonus Points If You Have**
* Experience with cloud platforms like Azure or AWS.
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
* Familiarity with frontend technologies.
* Experience in e-commerce, logistics, or healthcare systems.


**What Apotea Offer You**
* The chance to work on cutting-edge AI and ML projects that impact millions of customers.
* Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy
* Drive sustainability through eco-friendly packaging and logistics
* Opportunities for career growth through training, mentorship, and industry conferences.
* Collaborate in a cross-functional, transparent environment
* Own projects from concept to deployment
* A stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission to improve healthcare accessibility.


**About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and nearly 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Lidingö, and Morgongåva.
   

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**The process**
* Apply
* Interview 1: Culture fit
* Interview 2: Technical skills
* Background check: As a pharmacy, we always conduct a background check.
* Potential job offer


**Join Us and Make a Difference -** 
**We hope you want to be a part of our team!**
 Submit your application today—interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled immediately. Start date by agreement.
   

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health and creates magic!*
 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Game developer
description:
We are now looking for the best game developer to join us! You have the chance to be a part of creating the best casino games in the online slot industry!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and maintain Casino Games for both desktop and mobile browsers
* The technologies you primarily will work with are HTML5, WebGL, Typescript, Pixi, GSAP and Javascript.
* In a team environment that consists of product management, graphic artistry, sound creation, server development and game mechanics, you will contribute to deliver the best casino games in the market today.
* Your main responsibilities are to make the game graphics come alive with spectacular animations, game flow, game mechanics and sounds according to a result delivered by our game servers.


 Who you are
   

  

* You are a Master Google Searcher that have Stackoverflow as your absolute favourite web site.
* You have practical experience of working with OOP in some language and you have a pragmatic approach to software development.
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in.
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you.
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and take ownership of changes from editor to production system.


 Beneficial skills
   

  

* Working experience of mobile browsers and knowledge about their limitations and how they work in different ways is a big plus.


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Backend Developer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 to our
 **User Platform Team** 
 for our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Backend Developer at Viaplay, you will have the opportunity to build the most sought-after streaming service in the Nordics. You will be at the forefront of digital media and develop the platform for our continuously growing user base. Your engagement will shape the future of our service as you will be involved in defining the future for video on demand and live streaming. You will be part of growing the platform, enhance our user experience, and create the next generation of streaming services.
   

  

 We thrive in using the latest technology, always keeping up to date and constantly develop our ways of working. We work with Node.js and Rust in a micro-services architecture that runs in AWS. Also, we build our whole product here in-house.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
 We are looking for a team player that wants to join us building strong and high performing solutions. We take care of our services mainly for the user authentication journey that are built primarily in Node.js using both instances and serverless using an event driven architecture that are deployed in AWS. Our ways of working emphasizes a shared ownership approach where we learn from each other.
   

  

**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience with frontend development


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Frontend Developer with focus on UX/UI
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we're building cutting-edge gaming products that redefine how players experience online entertainment. As we continue to grow, we're looking for a Frontend Developer with a strong UX/UI focus, or a UX/UI Designer with frontend development chops, to join one of our expanding engineering teams.
   

  

 You'll play a key role in shaping the look, feel, and interactivity of products that reach a global audience—contributing not only to how things work but also how they feel. At Evolution, design and development are not siloed; you'll be an essential part of product decisions from day one, working in highly collaborative, autonomous teams.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Design and build intuitive, responsive, and beautiful interfaces with React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Bring UX and UI designs to life—from wireframes to pixel-perfect implementation.
* Collaborate closely with product owners and engineers to craft seamless user experiences.
* Own the frontend from concept to production, including performance optimization, accessibility, and maintainability.
* Contribute to our design system and help shape a consistent visual language across products.
* Continuously experiment, iterate, and improve based on real user feedback and data.
* Be part of a team that values learning through iteration, experimentation, and shared responsibility.


 You Might Be a Great Fit If You
   

  

* Have solid experience with React, TypeScript, and modern CSS techniques.
* Possess a keen eye for design details, and care deeply about creating delightful user experiences.
* Enjoy bridging the gap between design and development.
* Are comfortable building advanced components.
* Believe in clean, maintainable code and smooth user flows.
* Have good communication skills in English and love working in a collaborative environment.


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Understanding of accessibility and web performance best practices.
* Familiarity with UI/UX testing tools or user research methods.
* An interest in gaming or digital entertainment interfaces.


 Technologies You'll Touch
   

  

* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)


 Who we are
   

  

 We care more about your potential than checking every box. If you're excited about building exceptional interfaces and love working in small, empowered teams, we want to hear from you.
   

  

 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing tech companies and help us craft experiences that players around the world love.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Fullstack AI Developer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 Do you want to work on developing the future of content automation in a tight-knit team? We are seeking a Fullstack AI Developer to join our AI Automation Team and contribute to the development of our internal AI tools and automation capabilities. In this role, you will be responsible for designing and building AI-driven applications that enhance operational efficiency, streamline workflows, and drive innovation across our 7 markets and 15 e-commerce platforms.
   

  

 You will work closely with a dedicated, fast-paced team consisting of two passionate Full Stack AI Developers, a Product Owner, and a Product Specialist. Together, you’ll develop intelligent systems that directly support and enhance business-critical operations—leveraging technologies such as MongoDB, Next.js, .NET, Python, and Azure.
   

  

 We offer a dynamic and collaborative environment where your voice truly matters. As a member of our team, you'll have significant influence over decisions ranging from architecture to tooling and coding practices. We value open dialogue and critical thinking—you're encouraged to challenge ideas, and you can expect your own ideas to be constructively challenged in return. You’ll work across the full stack, with exposure to both frontend and backend development, and take part in deploying solutions to production using Azure and modern CI/CD pipelines. This is a place where experimentation is encouraged, innovation is shared, and great ideas—regardless of where they come from—are always welcome.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, test, and deploy full stack applications enhanced with AI capabilities to streamline business processes and improve operational efficiency.
* Build robust, user-friendly solutions that automate repetitive and time-consuming tasks using the latest AI advancements.
* Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines to ensure smooth and reliable deployment workflows.
* Partner with the Marketing team to understand business needs and translate them into effective, automated solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of AI applications with existing systems and platforms.
* Participate in architectural and tooling decisions within a close-knit, highly collaborative development team.
* Drive innovation by contributing to greenfield projects using modern technologies such as .NET, AI frameworks, MongoDB, and Next.js.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in AI and full stack development, continuously improving our solutions and development approach.


**What We Want From You**
 At our core, we believe that finding the right interpersonal fit is just as important as identifying the right skills and experience. We’re looking for someone who not only brings technical expertise but also thrives in a collaborative, high-trust environment.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer with strong proficiency across the stack, including the delivery of scalable, containerized solutions.
* Familiarity with NoSQL databases, particularly MongoDB.
* Strong command of statically typed languages such as C# or Java; proficiency in Python is a strong advantage.
* Solid experience with React and TypeScript for modern front-end development.
* Experience working with Docker and container orchestration tools such as Kubernetes or Azure Container Apps.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a hands-on approach to the full software development lifecycle—from design and development to deployment and maintenance.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* A proactive mindset and a willingness to contribute ideas and challenge the status quo to continuously improve our solutions.


**Bonus qualifications that make you stand out from the rest:**
* Experience with enterprise-grade AI applications


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *No Douchebags* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Viktoria Sobolewski at viktoria.sobolewski@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 950 000 consumers.

title: Software Developer 2
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a performance engineer to develop and maintain performance infrastructure used in creating future versions of Java SE. In this role, you will help improve the performance analysis and monitoring infrastructure and tools, evaluate the performance of features in the Java programming language and runtime environment, and analyze performance issues reported by customers or detected by regression testing.
   

  

* This position's duties and responsibilities include designing and deploying infrastructure to support performance testing of Java releases, identifying and resolving performance regressions and deficiencies in the Java runtime and libraries, and developing and deploying new benchmarks
* Working with Oracle's product development, quality, and sustaining engineering teams, external partners, and the OpenJDK community is an essential part of the job
* Additionally, engineers in this position will have to improve and modernize an important Java EE application used to track the performance of Oracle's Java SE product releases. This application drives a complex performance measurement system that helps us identify regressions and validate performance optimizations, ensuring that the Java platform continues to perform well.


 This position provides opportunities for growth and the chance to work with world-class engineers, creating and delivering new Java language features and runtimes. It requires strong software development skills and curiosity, desire, and problem-solving ability. Good communication skills are necessary to collaborate with colleagues, present findings, and work effectively with various engineering teams to positively influence Java performance.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Detailed Job Requirements:**
* Strong technical background
* Knowledge of system and processor architectures
* Excellent knowledge of Java, Python, or JavaScript/TypeScript
* Experience/Knowledge of web technologies
+ React
+ Spring/Helidon/Jakarta/JAX-RS
+ CSS
+ Knowledge of Ansible/Database administration


**Preferred Skills And Knowledge**
* Familiarity with continuous integration systems i.e. Jenkins
* Design, develop, troubleshoot, and debug software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks, etc.
* Experience in working with and managing the cloud infrastructure
* Experience in working in distributed teams


**Qualifications**
 Career Level - IC2
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s challenges. We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 We know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. That’s why we’re committed to growing an inclusive workforce that promotes opportunities for all.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing accommodation-request\_mb@oracle.com or by calling +1 888 404 2494 in the United States.
   

  

 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: Business Developer AI - Graduate
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Joining HPE in a graduate role is an excellent opportunity for a self-motivated, proactive individual to grow with us and help us drive our continued success globally.
   

  

 We are seeking a junior
 **Business Developer** 
 passionate about AI to join our team. In this role, you will focus on AI business development, providing sales support, building strategic partnerships, and gaining a deep understanding of HPE AI products. If you have a keen interest in the AI market development and are excited to contribute to the evolving needs for enterprise companies, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**Program start date**

**What You'll Do**

* You will, together with Product Category Managers, define and perform activities to drive AI business growth

* You will compile and analyse data that will be utilized to make business decisions

 Accountability, Accountability, Action Planning, Active Learning (Inactive), Active Listening, Bias, Business, Calendar Management, Coaching, Computer Literacy, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Design Thinking, Empathy, Follow-Through, Group Problem Solving, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity, Office Administration, Policy and procedures, Recordkeeping, Risk Assessment, Software Development {+ 5 more}
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**

 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
   

  

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

Our goal is to be one global team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. **Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**
 HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

title: Senior Software Engineer (TypeScript)
description:
Senior Full-Stack Engineer (
 **TypeScript** 
 / Node.js / React / React Native)
 



  





 📍 Stockholm-based (
 **NOT full remote** 
 ; hybrid)
 



 🕒 Full-time
 



 📬 erik.engervall@venga.app
 



  





 Venga is building a new kind of social platform—think Spotify, but for your real-life plans.
 



  





 We're a Stockholm-based team on a mission to make it ridiculously easy and fun to bring people together. Whether it’s a dinner, party, or weekend trip, Venga helps people plan, invite, and celebrate—without the group chat chaos or outdated tools.
 



  





 We’re backed by top Nordic VCs, and our team brings experience from companies like Budbee (Instabee), Spotify, Klarna, and Qasa. The foundation is in place: a beautiful product, a growing user base, and momentum. Now we’re ready to scale—and we’re looking for an engineer who wants to build something big from the inside.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Work across the stack with TypeScript, Node.js, React, and React Native
* Build and maintain our core platform across Web, iOS, and Android
* Collaborate closely with design, growth, product and our CTO to ship meaningful features fast
* Shape architecture, scalability, and tooling as we grow
* Help us build a truly delightful, high-performance app



  





**What we’re looking for** 



* 5+ years experience with full-stack JavaScript/TypeScript development
* Strong grasp of backend systems (Node.js, REST APIs, postgres, event driven architecture)
* Solid frontend skills (React/React Native, CSS, UI/UX sensibility)
* Experience working in early-stage or fast-moving product teams
* A builder’s mindset—you care about product, not just code <3



  





**What we offer** 



* Real ownership with highly valuable equity options
* Work side by side with our CTO
* Flat, fast-paced and creative culture (we move fast and love it)
* Work with a fun, ambitious team who love what they do
* Hybrid flexibility, but with our home base in central Stockholm



  





**Compensation** 



* Monthly salary 40,000 - 70,000 SEK depending on experience
* Up to 1% in KPO (kvalificerade personaloptioner)



  





 This is a rare opportunity to be part of shaping what a social platform can be—built in Europe, with people and integrity at the core.

title: Fullstack-utvecklare
description:
Är du en erfaren Fullstack-utvecklare som är redo för nya utmaningar? Vi letar efter dig som är redo att kliva ombord på vår tillväxtresa i ett nytt bolag inom mjukvara, Embedded-system och IT. Välkommen till ett företag där vi bygger framtidens lösningar.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi är inte som alla andra. Vi är Sigma Industry East North – en del av en prisbelönt koncern med hjärtat på rätt ställe och siktet inställt på både roligheter och kvalitet. Nu har vi startat ett helt nytt bolag med säte i Liljeholmen, där fokus är mjukvara och Embedded-system. Med oss får du möjligheten att vara med och bygga upp ett nytt företag från grunden, med allt vad det innebär av spännande utmaningar och möjligheter.
   

  

 GRUNDLÄGGANDE KVALIFIKATIONER
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har en bakgrund inom mjukvaruutveckling och har en stark vilja att utveckla både dig själv och andra, men framför allt leverera inom ditt gebit. Du är van vid att arbeta i agila projektmiljöer och har erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera digitala lösningar i olika branscher. Du är kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och trivs i en roll där du får kombinera djup teknisk kompetens med praktiskt ingenjörsarbete.
   

  

 MERITERANDE FÄRDIGHETER, EGENSKAPER OCH ERFARENHETER
   

  

**Kompetenskrav:** 
  

  

  

* Minst 5-8 års erfarenhet av Fullstack-programmering. :
+ Back-end i språk som Java, C# .Net, Python eller Node.js
+ Front-End i språk som Javascript, Typescript, CSS, och HTML

* Erfarenhet av olika ramverk som t ex React, Angular, Vue, SpringBoot etc.
* Erfarenhet av agila metoder (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe)
* Hänger bekvämt i databaser (SQL, Oracle, Mongo DB) och i molnet (AWS, Azure, GCP)
* Erfarenhet av Deployment och DevOps (exempelvis Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Terraform)
* Smidig i att balansera smart teknik med användarvänliga gränssnitt
* Behärskar svenska och engelska obehindrat både i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande:**
* Tidigare konsulterfarenhet och varit i flera branscher
* Andra programmeringsspråk som t ex PHP och Go
* Relevanta utbildningar och/eller certifieringar inom området
* Erfarenhet av mjukvarutestning och testautomatisering


 VI ERBJUDER
   

  

 Här får du vara med och bygga upp något från grunden i en arbetsmiljö med högt i tak, mycket skratt och ständig utveckling. Vi erbjuder även ett gäng fantastiska kollegor som är lika taggade som du, korta beslutsvägar, och spännande projekt som sträcker sig över flera olika branscher – från Fordon, Försvar och Tillverkning till Energi, Medtech, Telekom, Retail och IT.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och fritid och erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga löner och förmåner, friskvårdsbidrag, samt möjligheter till personlig utveckling för att både kropp och knopp ska må bra.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag
   

  

 2025-06-30
   

  

 MER INFORMATION
   

  

 För mer information kontakta:
   

  

 Ulrika Wergens
   

  

 Sektionschef
   

  

 Sigma Industry Spark, Stockholm
   

  

 Mjukvaruutveckling
   

  

 072-522 71 05
   

  

 ulrika.wergens@sigma.se
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 072-522 71 05
   

  

 ulrika.wergens@sigma.se
