 Välkommen med din ansökan. Urval sker löpande så ansök så snart som möjligt. Om du undrar något avseende tjänsten, maila allan.dahl@postnord.com. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 För fackliga kontaktpersoner se Facklig kontakt | PostNord.

title: Senior Webb- och Apputvecklare
description:
Är du en erfaren utvecklare med passion för både frontend, backend och moln? Nu har du chansen att kliva in i en strategisk roll där du får vara med och forma Riksbyggens digitala framtid – i ett team som står inför en spännande utvecklingsfas.
 



  





 Riksbyggen är kanske inte det första bolaget man tänker på när man hör ordet “IT” – men det borde vara det. Som en av Sveriges största samhällsbyggare kombinerar Riksbyggen över 80 års erfarenhet av fastighetsutveckling med ett starkt tech-fokus. Här byggs inte bara hus och boenden – här byggs också moderna, smarta IT-lösningar som stöttar hundratusentals människor i deras vardag.
 



  





 IT-utvecklingen sker nära verksamheten och med fokus på lösningar som faktiskt gör skillnad. Det finns en tydlig ambition att ligga i framkant tekniskt – att bygga nytt, inte bara integrera färdiga lösningar, hållbarhet är också ett viktigt ledord för våra verksamheter. Miljön präglas av stabilitet, långsiktighet och innovation i praktiken.
 



  





 Som arbetsgivare erbjuder Riksbyggen en plats där du kan växa, påverka och bidra – både tekniskt och samhällsmässigt. Det är en arbetsplats för dig som vill göra skillnad, och samtidigt ha tryggheten i ryggen.
 



  





**Hos oss gör du skillnad** 




 På uppdrag av Riksbyggen rekryterar vi nu en senior webb- och applikationsutvecklare som vill vara med och bygga upp ett nytt digitalt team – med tydligt mandat och höga ambitioner. Du kliver in i ett etablerat internt IT-team med hög kompetens – en Scrum Master och sju utvecklare, i nära samverkan i kanal och produktägare.
 



 Det här är en spännande möjlighet för dig som trivs i en bred utvecklarroll där du får ta både tekniskt ansvar och bidra med din erfarenhet i uppbyggnaden av moderna, molnbaserade lösningar. Du kommer arbeta med såväl webblösningar som appar i en miljö som befinner sig i ett tydligt teknikskifte – från on-prem till moln – där du får vara med och forma såväl arkitektur som arbetssätt. Fokus ligger på att skapa användarvänliga, skalbara och långsiktiga tjänster och produkter som ger nytta för både verksamheten och slutkund.
 



  





**Du bidrar med din kompetens och ditt engagemang** 




 Vi söker dig som vill ta plats, påverka och bidra – och samtidigt ha tryggheten i en stabil organisation med starkt samhällsuppdrag. Här får du en roll där din kompetens märks, behövs och uppskattas.
 



  





 Exempel på vad du kommer att arbeta med:
 


* Utveckla moderna webb- och appbaserade lösningar i Microsoftmiljö
* Vara med och forma arkitektur och tekniska vägval i en molnbaserad miljö (Azure)
* Delta i hela produktlivscykeln – från idé till implementation och vidareutveckling
* Samverka tvärfunktionellt med andra team
* Arbeta enligt agila principer och bidra till förbättrade utvecklingsflöden och processer
* Dokumentera lösningar på ett strukturerat och hållbart sätt



  





 Vi söker dig som
 


* Har minst 3 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i Microsoftmiljö (t.ex. .NET, C#, Blazor)
* Har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom systemutveckling, datavetenskap eller liknande område.
* Har erfarenhet av modern webbutveckling och/eller apputveckling
* Har grundläggande kunskap eller erfarenhet av molnplattformar, gärna Azure
* Är van att arbeta nära verksamheten och driva lösningar framåt
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska



  





 Du som person
 


* Är trygg i din roll, självgående och van att ta tekniskt ansvar
* Har god kommunikativ förmåga och trivs i samarbete med andra



  





**Förmåner som gör skillnad** 




 Hos Riksbyggen får du trygga och generösa villkor. Du har 30 dagars semester och en extra ledig dag där du väljer att vara ledig dagen före julafton eller vid Kristi himmelsfärd. Inför röda dagar arbetar vi halvdag. Du omfattas dessutom av väldigt bra pensionsvillkor.
 



 Du erbjuds friskvårdsbidrag, ersättning för läkarbesök samt möjlighet att ta del av Rikskort – ett förmånskort som kan användas i butiker och på restauranger. Vid goda resultat delas även en personalpremie ut som uppskattning för det gemensamma arbetet.
 



  





 Du kommer att ha din arbetsplats i Riksbyggens moderna och ljusa kontor på Kungsbron i centrala Stockholm – med utsikt över takåsarna och med direkt närhet till alla kommunikationsvägar, bara ett stenkast från T-centralen. Det finns även möjlighet att arbeta i en hybridlösning, med viss flexibilitet att jobba hemifrån.
 



  





 Riksbyggen ser mångfald som en styrka och strävar efter att skapa en inkluderande arbetsmiljö. Riksbyggen tillämpar provanställning.
 



  





**Kontakt och ansökan** 




 Din ansökan skickar du till oss via www.riksbyggen.se under Jobba hos oss/Lediga jobb senast
 **2025-06-30** 
 . Vi arbetar löpande urval och intervjuer och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, så ansök redan idag!
 




  





 I rekryteringen arbetar vi tillsammans med Ed:Za Group. Har du några frågor eller funderingar relaterade till tjänsten och processen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta charlotte.hoffstrom@edzagroup.se eller tyra.nguyen@edzagroup.se

title: Microsoft Dynamics 365-utvecklare
description:
Kan du läsa mellan raderna, förstå verksamhetens behov och omsätta dem till robust kod? Riksbyggen söker en CRM-utvecklare som behärskar både tekniken och dialogen med verksamheten. Du blir en nyckelspelare i deras digitala utveckling och en del av ett företag som bygger för både människor och framtiden.
 



  





 Riksbyggen är kanske inte det första bolaget man tänker på när man hör ordet “IT” – men det borde vara det. Som en av Sveriges största samhällsbyggare kombinerar Riksbyggen över 80 års erfarenhet av fastighetsutveckling med ett starkt tech-fokus. Här byggs inte bara hus och boenden – här byggs också moderna, smarta IT-lösningar som stöttar hundratusentals människor i deras vardag.
 



  





 IT-utvecklingen sker nära verksamheten och med fokus på lösningar som faktiskt gör skillnad. Det finns en tydlig ambition att ligga i framkant tekniskt – att bygga nytt, inte bara integrera färdiga lösningar,hållbarhet är också ett viktigt ledord för våra verksamheter. Miljön präglas av stabilitet, långsiktighet och innovation i praktiken.
 



  





 Som arbetsgivare erbjuder Riksbyggen en plats där du kan växa, påverka och bidra – både tekniskt och samhällsmässigt. Det är en arbetsplats för dig som vill göra skillnad, och samtidigt ha tryggheten i ryggen.
 



  





**Hos oss gör du skillnad** 




 Som CRM-utvecklare blir du en viktig del av Riksbyggens fortsatta digitala resa. Du kommer att arbeta nära verksamheten med att utveckla, anpassa och förvalta företagets CRM-lösningar i Microsoft Dynamics 365. Rollen kräver både teknisk skicklighet och god förståelse för affärsprocesser.
 



 IT-teamet består i dag av både interna resurser och konsulter. För den här rollen söker vi därför dig som är självgående, ansvarstagande och trygg i att ta egna initiativ.
 



  





 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter
 


* Design, utveckla och implementation av CRM-lösningar i Dynamics 365
* Säkerställ ett sömlöst informationsflöde genom att anpassa och integrera IT-system med andra affärssystem
* Kravanalys och lösningsdesign tillsammans med verksamheten
* Systemförvaltning och dokumentation
* Deltagande i utvecklingsprojekt och överlämning till förvaltning
* Arbeta enligt agilt arbetssätt (SAFe)



  





**Du bidrar med din kompetens och ditt engagemang** 




 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande – eller har byggt upp motsvarande kompetens genom yrkeserfarenhet
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Microsoft Dynamics 365
* Kunskaper i C#, .NET, JavaScript och SQL
* Erfarenhet av Power Platform, plugins, arbetsflöden och Power Automate
* Vana vid att arbeta med API:er, Azure DevOps pipelines och systemintegration
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska



  





**Meriterande om du har:** 



* Erfarenhet från bygg- och fastighetsbranschen är meriterande
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i större, komplexa IT-miljöer



  





**Vi ser att:** 



* Du har en stark kommunikativ förmåga och trivs i dialogen med både IT och verksamhet.
* Du är analytisk, strukturerad och gillar att lösa problem som gör skillnad.



  





**Förmåner som gör skillnad** 




 Hos Riksbyggen får du trygga och generösa villkor. Du har 30 dagars semester och en extra ledig dag där du väljer att vara ledig dagen före julafton eller vid Kristi himmelsfärd. Inför röda dagar arbetar vi halvdag. Du omfattas dessutom av väldigt bra pensionsvillkor.
 



 Du erbjuds friskvårdsbidrag, ersättning för läkarbesök samt möjlighet att ta del av Rikskort – ett förmånskort som kan användas i butiker och på restauranger. Vid goda resultat delas även en personalpremie ut som uppskattning för det gemensamma arbetet.
 



  





 Du kommer att ha din arbetsplats i Riksbyggens moderna och ljusa kontor på Kungsbron i centrala Stockholm – med utsikt över takåsarna och med direkt närhet till alla kommunikationsvägar, bara ett stenkast från T-centralen. Det finns även möjlighet att arbeta i en hybridlösning.
 



  





 Riksbyggen ser mångfald som en styrka och strävar efter att skapa en inkluderande arbetsmiljö. Riksbyggen tillämpar provanställning.
 



  





**Kontakt och ansökan** 




 Din ansökan skickar du till oss via www.riksbyggen.se under Jobba hos oss/Lediga jobb senast
 **2025-06-30** 
 . Vi arbetar löpande urval och intervjuer och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, så ansök redan idag!
 




  





 I rekryteringen arbetar vi tillsammans med Ed:Za Group. Har du några frågor eller funderingar relaterade till tjänsten och processen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta charlotte.hoffstrom@edzagroup.se eller tyra.nguyen@edzagroup.se

title: Team Lead till utvecklingsteamet för TakeCare
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
Är du en erfaren ledare med bakgrund inom mjukvaruutveckling som brinner för att skapa innovativa och tekniskt hållbara lösningar? Har du förmågan att motivera och inspirera ditt team till att nå gemensamma mål? Då kan du vara den vi söker som Team Lead till utvecklingsteamet för TakeCare!
 



  





**Om TakeCare:** 




 TakeCare är ett ledande journal- och vårdinformationssystem som anpassats för den svenska hälso- och sjukvårdens behov. Med över 60 000 användare och fler än 4,3 miljoner journaler är TakeCare en av de största vårdinformationsinstallationerna i världen. Systemet är skapat för att ge en sammanhängande bild av patientens status och vårdhistorik, stödja patientsäkerhet, användarvänlighet, och flexibilitet, samt underlätta vårdprofessionens arbete genom att frigöra tid för patientnära vårdarbete.
 



  





 Som Team Lead kommer du att ansvara för ett team om ca 25 medarbetare. Du rapporterar till VP Development.
 



  





 På CGM:s utvecklingsavdelning möts hjälpsamhet och nyfikenhet med problemlösning och nytänkande. Vi är ett team som värdesätter olika perspektiv och tror att våra olikheter berikar vårt arbete. I detta team huserar vi utvecklare, testare, tekniska skribenter och arkitekter som tar ansvar, som är prestigelösa och som finner glädjen i att skapa den bästa vården genom våra system.
 



  





**Ansvarsområden:** 




 Som Team Lead kommer du att:
 



  





 • Leda och utveckla vårt mjukvaruteknikteam, inklusive personalansvar och arbetsmiljöansvar.
 



 • Ansvara för framtagning av tekniska lösningar och se till att produktfunktionalitet uppfyller kravspecifikationer.
 



 • Driva utveckling och ständiga förbättringar i linje med företagets kvalitets- och miljöarbete.
 



 • Planera och övervaka utvecklings- och testprocesser för att säkerställa att utvecklingen följer fastlagda tidsramar och budgetar.
 



 • Utföra regelbundna avdelningsmöten och utvecklingssamtal för att främja kompetensutveckling och skapa en positiv arbetsmiljö.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 




 Vi söker dig som har:
 



  





 • Kandidatexamen eller högre inom datavetenskap, informationsteknik, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
 



 • Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling.
 



 • Minst 5 års erfarenhet av ledningsarbete och personalansvar inom IT.
 



 • Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
 



 • Problemlösande attityd, analytisk förmåga med fokus på resultat.
 



  





**Meriterande erfarenheter:** 




 • Erfarenhet av lagar och regleringar inom hälso- och sjukvården, inklusive dataskydd och sekretessfrågor.
 



 • Erfarenhet av agila metoder som Scrum eller Kanban samt kunskap om JIRA.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder dig:** 




 • En dynamisk och innovativ arbetsmiljö
 



 • Arbetsplats i moderna lokaler i Solna
 



 • Hybrid-upplägg med möjlighet till distansarbete två dagar i veckan
 



 • Generöst friskvårdsbidrag och en friskvårdstimme i veckan
 



 • Tillsvidareanställning, heltid
 



 • Kollektivavtal
 



  





**Ansökan:** 




 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse. Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterare Karin Bogren på karin.bogren@partner.cgm.com.
 



  





**Vår rekryteringsprocess:** 




 Första steget är ett kortare videosamtal med vår rekryterare där vi berättar mer om tjänsten och lär känna dig bättre. Därefter följer intervjuer med din framtida chef och kollegor.
 



  





 Om du går vidare till slutskedet av processen kommer vi att be om referenser samt genomföra en bakgrundskontroll innan vi erbjuder dig en anställning.
 



  





 Om du är redo att ta din karriär till nästa nivå och göra verklig skillnad, skicka din ansökan till oss redan idag!
 



  





*CGMs vision ”Synchronizing healthcare” genomsyrar allt vårt arbete. Vi är marknadsledande leverantör av IT-lösningar och kommunikationstjänster inom hälso- och sjukvård, social omsorg, företagshälsovård, barn- och elevhälsovård samt kliniska laboratorium i Sverige. Vår drivkraft är att göra nytta för patienten via våra e-hälsolösningar. Behovet av nya lösningar är under ständig utveckling, vilket ställer höga krav på oss som leverantör. Tillsammans med våra kunder är vi starkt engagerade i att förverkliga Sveriges e-hälsovision om att bli bäst i världen på att använda digitaliseringens och e-hälsans möjligheter.*

title: UX/UI Designer with Frontend Development Skills
description:
**Nolimit City | Stockholm**
----------------------------


At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we create world-class gaming products with bold, uncompromising design and unmatched attention to detail. We're looking for a UX/UI Designer who doesn't just stop at the design phase — you also bring your ideas to life in code.
  

  

You'll join a cross-functional product team with full ownership over the solutions you design, working on innovative and highly interactive user experiences seen by players around the world. You'll collaborate closely with engineers to create products that are both beautiful and usable — and you'll write production-ready code to ensure your vision comes to life exactly as you imagined it.


### **What You'll Do**


* Lead UX and UI design efforts for new and existing products — from user flows and wireframes to high-fidelity mockups.
* Translate your designs into functional, responsive, and accessible frontend components using React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Partner with developers and stakeholders to iterate on solutions, run experiments, and refine interfaces based on user feedback and performance data.
* Build and maintain components in a shared design system, ensuring consistency and scalability across products.
* Advocate for user-centered design throughout the product development process.

### **You Might Be a Great Fit If You**


* Have a strong background in UX/UI design, with a portfolio showcasing thoughtful, elegant interfaces and interaction design.
* Are fluent in modern design tools like Figma, and enjoy prototyping and testing user flows.
* Know how to write clean, maintainable frontend code using React and TypeScript.
* Are comfortable working with developers and understand how design decisions impact performance and implementation.
* Care deeply about usability, accessibility, and the overall user experience.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where experimentation is encouraged.

### **Bonus Points**


* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Familiarity with A/B testing, analytics, and data-driven design decisions.
* An understanding of game or entertainment product design patterns.

### **Technologies You'll Touch**


* Figma (or other tools you prefer) / Design Systems
* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)

### **Who we are**


You don't need to know everything from day one. If you're a designer who loves to get your hands dirty in code, and you're passionate about crafting exceptional user experiences, we'd love to meet you.
  

  

Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and help shape the future of interactive entertainment.


Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
  

  

Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com

title: C#/.NET Software Engineer - [F/M/X]
description:
Who are we?
  
Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.
  
  

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
  
  

**Brief Call:** Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
  
  

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
  
  

**Case study:** Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
  
  

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
  
We look forward to meeting you!
  
  

Job description
  
  

**About the Company:**  

This is a leading tech company specializing in cameras, video surveillance, and access control systems. They have evolved from selling standalone cameras to developing full-scale software solutions, including advanced Video Management Systems (VMS), cloud services, and mobile applications. Their platforms integrate seamlessly with access control systems, smart products, and server infrastructure.
  
  

**Team Structure:**  

The development department consists of two units with a total of 9 (soon 10) cross-functional teams.
  
Each team includes 4 developers and 1 tester.
  
The workflow is based on Kanban, with structured roadmaps, epics, and regular planning sessions.
  
Releases occur every 6 weeks.
  
Teams collaborate closely with product owners, UX designers, and system architects.
  
Profile Requirement
  
  

**Tech Stack:**  

Primarily C# and .NET, with an ongoing transition to .NET 8 and .NET Core.
  
Solutions are currently Windows-based (servers, clients, interfaces via WPF).
  
The company is moving toward platform-agnostic solutions (Linux/Windows), with a 2-year roadmap in place.
  
Deployment on Linux is increasingly relevant – experience here is a strong plus.
  
  

**Work Environment:**  

Onsite presence is required 4–5 days per week.
  
All meetings and demos are held in Swedish, so a good understanding of Swedish is necessary (fluency is not required, but communication skills are important).
  
Strong focus on analytical ability, self-drive, and team collaboration.
  
  

**Who They’re Looking For:**  

A highly skilled C# developer, preferably with hands-on experience in .NET 8.
  
Ideally 3–4 years of experience (exceptional candidates with 2 years may also be considered).
  
Proactive, self-sufficient, and team-oriented.
  
Experience with Linux environments, cross-platform systems, containerization, and security is a plus.
  
  

**Recruitment Process:**  

An extensive coding assignment will be sent as the first step.
  
Expected to be submitted within 24 hours.
  
Code quality and problem-solving approach are reviewed anonymously by developers before proceeding to interviews.
  
  

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.
company_description: Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. It gathers more than 7,500 people across 5 continents and more than 60 countries.

title: Arkitekt till samhällsviktigt Inhouse-projekt
description:
Vill du arbeta med att förbättra patientupplevelsen och underlätta för människor att komma i kontakt med vården? Vill du vara med och utveckla de samhällsviktiga tjänsterna inom 1177? Vill du vara en del av en ny leveransorganisation och bidra till att förbättra sjukvården för alla medborgare? Då är detta rätt tillfälle för dig!


Nexer har nyligen vunnit ett ramavtal med Inera för utveckling och förvaltning av e-tjänster för 1177 och vi söker nu engagerade medarbetare som vill vara med på en spännande resa.


Initiativet involverar flera agila utvecklingsteam som arbetar parallellt från Nexers kontor i Karlskrona, Göteborg, Örebro och Jönköping.

**VEM ÄR DU?**  

Vi sätter stort värde i dina personliga egenskaper. Vi tror att du är engagerad, ödmjuk och kommunikativ samt trivs med att arbeta i ett mindre team där du får stort ansvar. Vi tror dessutom att du som vill jobba med oss...


... är en erfaren systemarkitekt med stark utvecklarbakgrund som kan hjälpa oss att designa och implementera robusta och skalbara lösningar.

  

... har erfarenhet av Backend Java eller Fullstack Java/JavaScript


... har en stark förståelse för Design Patterns och Architecture Patterns.


... har förmåga att kommunicera tekniska koncept på ett tydligt och begripligt sätt.


... har erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila utvecklingsmiljöer.


... behärskar flytande svenska och engelska.  

  

Meriterande är om du även har erfarenhet av Spring/Spring Boot, databashantering och Extreme programming.


**OM ROLLEN**  

Du kommer ingå i vårt utvecklingsteam och ha huvudansvaret för arkitekturen avseende tre olika system som ingår i vår leverans. Du ser till att arkitekturen möter såväl affärskrav som tekniska krav samt implementerar och integrerar systemlösningar. Vidare säkerställer du att systemarkitekturen är skalbar och säker. Du ser till att dokumentera systemdesign och arkitektur för att underlätta framtida underhåll och utveckling.


Projektet löper över en längre tid och du arbetar tillsammans med andra kollegor på vårt Karlskronakontor i ett agilt team. Teamet är multifunktionellt med utvecklare, arkitekter, scrum master, testare och design/UX-specialister. Du kommer även jobba i nära samarbete med övriga team som finns runt om i landet.  

  

**OM NEXER KARLSKRONA**  

Karlskrona är vi ett 30-tal medarbetare som värnar om vår härliga gemenskap! Våra kunder verkar inom flera olika branscher - allt från energi, försvar, fastigheter, bank/finans, försäkringar till offentlig sektor och myndigheter så vill du prova på andra kunder/projekt finns stora möjligheter till det. För att utveckla din kompetens har vi bland annat en mängd utbildningar via Nexer Academy, Udemy och learning lunches. Allt för att du ska känna att du går framåt i din utveckling hos oss!  

  

**OM NEXER GROUP**  

*Nexer är ett globalt teknikföretag med rötter i svensk entreprenörsanda och innovationskraft. I en digital värld ser vi till att våra kunder ligger steget före. Med en stark värderingsgrund och fokus på mångfald och inkludering är Nexer Group en attraktiv arbetsplats, och vi blev utsedda till årets Karriärföretag 2024 av Karriärföretagens expertpanel.*

*Några av världens största och mest krävande bolag förlitar sig på vårt engagemang och expertis inom digital transformation, artificiell intelligens, IT och FoU. Vi säkrar deras fortsatta utveckling genom att utforska banbrytande teknik, utmana oss själva att tänka i nya banor och dela med oss av vår kompetens inom strategi, teknik och kommunikation.*  

  

*Nexer har drygt 2 500 experter i 15 länder. Företaget är en del av Danir-gruppen, ett svenskt privatägt företag med över 10 000 medarbetare i 18 länder. Före 2021 hette vi Sigma IT.*  



*#LI-MJ1*

title: Team Lead & Senior Fullstack Engineer @ Caspeco
description:
We at Caspeco are proud to be serving a community of passionate people and privileged to solve problems that we can all relate to - eating, drinking and having fun! Our internal culture reflects the best from all the fun that comes from the restaurant and experience industry, and many of us have a background in the industry. Our products help thousands of passionate people to facilitate table bookings, payment solutions, staffing management and analysis and optimizations tools to increase profit. The company today consists of around 150 employees serving 2500 customers in an organization where decision paths are short, every employee makes a difference, and new ideas and initiatives are rewarded.

**About the role**


We are looking for an experienced senior engineer and Team Leader to join the team that owns our app, used by over 20,000 people weekly to check their schedule, payments, tip and much more. The team also builds products that help managers to provide optimal schedules, staffing and internal communication. The team has full ownership for our time and scheduling solutions, all the way from UX to the backend and storage. We’re looking for someone who is not afraid of making decisions, challenging the status quo and implementing new ways of working to boost efficiency and customer outcomes. The team consists of a Product Manager, UX Designer and several engineers with front end, back end and full stack profiles. You will play a key role in driving the delivery of the product and participate regularly in discovery activities together with the Product Manager and UX Designer. To be successful in the role you need to have worked several years as a full stack engineer coupled with strong leadership and coaching skills.

**How You Will Make an Impact**

* Foster a culture of continuous improvement and building a high-performance team.
* Develop and maintain high-performance systems with a focus on our apps
* Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and UX designers to create cohesive, impactful solutions.
* Design and improve the observability of our system and services.
* Maintain high standards for code quality, system reliability, and security.
* Present plans and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

**What We’re Looking For**

* 8+ years of experience in development with expertise in C# and .NET Core
* 5+ years of experience with Typescript, React or similar
* 5+ years of experience with Azure Cloud
* Experience as a Team Leader, Scrum Master or similar
* Experience of launching, developing and maintaining iOS apps or Android apps
* Solid understanding of system design principles and distributed architecture, enabling you to build scalable and reliable services
* An interest in AI is mandatory, and a proven experience within AI is a bonus
* Experience in .NET Maui or Xamarin is a bonus
* Excellent in verbal and written English

**Our Offer**


We offer a broad and developing role where you get to work with exciting and innovative products. You will become part of a forward-leaning company with ambitious goals and visions for the future, characterized by short decision paths and an open atmosphere, where we share experiences and collaborate closely with each other. Your skills and expertise are crucial for us to continue growing and reaching our goals, and we provide great freedom under responsibility in your role. At Caspeco, every individual is an important part of our success. We have collective agreements and offer market competitive compensation.

**Other Information**

* **Start:** Immediately, considering notice period
* **Scope:** Full-time
* **Location:** Uppsala, Hybrid


Does this role sound like a fit for you? Feel free to submit your application today. Selection is ongoing.


If you have any questions about the role please reach out to alexander.tolfmans.martas@caspeco.se


Union representative  

Unionen - Mikael Pettersson **mikael.pettersson@caspeco.se**

title: Frontend Software Architect within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*

  

**The position**  

As a Software Architect, you will have the opportunity to shape the future of software development across the entire Cambio portfolio. We are building a modern, device-agnostic application framework grounded in reusable organisms and declarative programming. You will be responsible for continuing the design of the framework, contributing to its development, incorporating feedback and requirements from multiple teams, and prioritizing feature development to meet Cambio’s business needs.


In this role, you will be expected to lead a team of 6-12 developers and UX designers, providing guidance, coaching and feedback. You will need to balance agile feature development with ongoing maintenance, service delivery, and company outreach. We are transforming our way of working in front-end development, so excellent communication skills are a must.

 **About you**  

We are searching for a passionate frontend focused Software Architect to join our new development team within the eHealth domain.
  

  

**Requirements**


* 10+ years of experience in frontend development with a strong understanding of modern web technologies
* Proven experience in building complex web applications with multiple stakeholders
* Deep expertise in at least one frontend framework with working knowledge of others
* Ability to design, plan, and execute complex systems
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to build an architecture that meets current and future strategic goals
* Communicates fluently in both spoken and written English
* Proficiency in TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, web APIs, and HTML

**It’s a bonus if you have**


* Understanding of UX/UI principles, with experience collaborating with designers on user-centric solutions
* Experience deploying and managing frontend applications in cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud

Communication skills in Swedish  
* 

  

**What we offer**  

A dynamic and stimulating work environment where you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects with a talented team of professionals. You will be part of a company that is committed to excellence and innovation in the eHealth industry.


As a Senior Software Architect, you will have a fundamental influence on the direction of healthcare development in the Nordics. You will have the opportunity to shape the future of eHealth and make a significant difference in the care and wellness of millions.

 **Place of employment**: Linköping, Stockholm, or remote within Sweden


At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.

**Scope**: Full time

**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period


**Other:** We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.


We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in **Sweden.** We will ask for verification during the process.


**We look forward to receiving your application!**


Read more about us **here!**


Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site **here!**

title: C#/.NET Software Engineer - [F/M/X]
description:
**Who are we?**
---------------

**Amaris Consulting** is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.  

  

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
  

  

**Brief Call**: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
  

  

**Interviews** (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
  

  

**Case study**: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
  

  

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
  

We look forward to meeting you!
**Job description**
-------------------

**About the Company:**  

This is a leading tech company specializing in cameras, video surveillance, and access control systems. They have evolved from selling standalone cameras to developing full-scale software solutions, including advanced Video Management Systems (VMS), cloud services, and mobile applications. Their platforms integrate seamlessly with access control systems, smart products, and server infrastructure.

  

**Team Structure:**

  

* The development department consists of two units with a total of 9 (soon 10) cross-functional teams.
* Each team includes 4 developers and 1 tester.
* The workflow is based on Kanban, with structured roadmaps, epics, and regular planning sessions.
* Releases occur every 6 weeks.
* Teams collaborate closely with product owners, UX designers, and system architects.
Profile Requirement
**Tech Stack:**

  

* Primarily **C# and .NET**, with an ongoing transition to **.NET 8 and .NET Core**.
* Solutions are currently Windows-based (servers, clients, interfaces via WPF).
* The company is moving toward platform-agnostic solutions (Linux/Windows), with a 2-year roadmap in place.
* Deployment on Linux is increasingly relevant – experience here is a strong plus.


**Work Environment:**

  

* Onsite presence is required **4–5 days per week**.
* All meetings and demos are held in Swedish, so **a good understanding of Swedish** is necessary (fluency is not required, but communication skills are important).
* Strong focus on analytical ability, self-drive, and team collaboration.


**Who They’re Looking For:**

  

* A **highly skilled C# developer**, preferably with hands-on experience in **.NET 8**.
* Ideally 3–4 years of experience (exceptional candidates with 2 years may also be considered).
* Proactive, self-sufficient, and team-oriented.
* Experience with Linux environments, cross-platform systems, containerization, and security is a plus.


**Recruitment Process:**

  

* An extensive coding assignment will be sent as the first step.
* Expected to be submitted within 24 hours.
* Code quality and problem-solving approach are reviewed anonymously by developers before proceeding to interviews.

  

  

  

*Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.*
company_description: Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. It gathers more than 7,500 people across 5 continents and more than 60 countries.

title: Full-Stack Engineer (React + Java)
description:
**Company Description**  

We are a IT & Tech consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!


We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.  

  

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level. With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking two skilled Full-Stack Engineers with a strong focus on **React frontend development**. While the role is primarily **frontend-heavy (80%)**, candidates must be comfortable handling **backend tasks using Java and Spring Boot (20%)**.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Design, develop, and maintain modern **web applications** using **React**, **TypeScript**, **HTML**, and **CSS**
* Implement and manage **application state** using tools like **Redux**, **XState**, or similar
* Collaborate with backend teams to maintain and update **Java Spring Boot services**
* Ensure high-quality, responsive, and accessible UI/UX aligned with modern design standards
* Contribute to full-stack development efforts when needed
* Participate in code reviews, testing, and documentation

 **Requirements:**

* Proven experience in **React** and **modern frontend development**
* Solid knowledge of **HTML, CSS, and TypeScript**
* Experience with **state management libraries** (e.g., Redux, XState)
* Comfortable maintaining and updating backend services in **Java + Spring Boot**
* Experience releasing and maintaining web applications
* Good understanding of **full-stack development** principles
* Familiarity with modern **product design** patterns
* Strong communication and teamwork skills

 **Nice to Have:**

* Prior experience in a **full-stack engineer** role
* Exposure to CI/CD, testing frameworks, or DevOps practices

 **Work Setup:**

* Stockholm-based candidates are preferred !!!
* Starting is ASAP
* Remote work within Sweden is allowed, provided availability to visit the office once per month

 **Additional Information** **Start:** Immediately  

**Working hours:** 100%  

**Location:** Stockholm, Sweden  

**Form of employment:** Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months of probationary employment

***Relocation to Sweden (from outside CET timezone) is also possible for this role.***

title: Konsultteam för Innovationsledning, UX- och Tjänstedesign
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**  

Vi är ett konsultföretag med ett gäng teknikintresserade och glada människor!


Vi älskar teknik, vi älskar design och vi älskar kvalitet. Vår mångfald gör oss unika och skapar en inkluderande och välkomnande arbetsplats där varje individ är högt värderad.


Hos oss är varje individ sig själv och respekterar andra för den de är. Vi tror att när en fantastisk mix av människor samlas och delar sin kunskap, sina erfarenheter och idéer, kan vi hjälpa våra kunder på en helt annan nivå.


Vi söker dig som kan börja omgående och vill växa med oss!


Hos oss har du stora möjligheter att ta verkliga kliv i din karriär och chansen att ta stort ansvar.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

Vi söker ett kvalificerat **konsultteam om tre personer** för att stärka innovationsförmågan. Uppdraget genomförs inom ramen för kontoret för innovation och utveckling, där ni kommer bidra med expertis inom **innovationsledning, UX-design och tjänstedesign**.

* Tillföra spetskompetens inom innovationsledning, UX-design och tjänstedesign
* Utveckla användarcentrerade digitala lösningar
* Utbilda och coacha interna resurser i design- och innovationsprocesser
* Leda och facilitera workshops
* Designa användarcentrerade digitala lösningar
* Coacha och utbilda i innovations- och designprocesser
* Genomföra intervjuer, tester och visualiseringar
* Arbeta både självständigt och i team

**Kravprofil – Ska-krav (Allmänt):**

* Ett team om **tre (3) konsulter** offereras
* Varje konsult ska ha **minst tre (3) års erfarenhet av liknande uppdrag**
* **CV på svenska** i Word-format ska bifogas för samtliga konsulter
* Konsulterna ska kunna **kommunicera flytande på svenska** i tal och skrift
* En **huvudansvarig konsult** ska anges (kontaktperson under hela uppdraget)
* Referensuppdrag från **minst två olika uppdragsgivare för företaget**
* Minst **ett referensuppdrag per konsult**

 **Kvalifikationer** **1. Innovationsledare**

* Certifiering inom innovationsledning eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Praktisk erfarenhet av:


	+ Innovationsledningssystem
	+ Leda och designa workshops
	+ Innovationsprojekt i samverkan mellan offentlig sektor, akademi och näringsliv
	+ Visualisering av processer och resultat

**2. UX-designer**

* Utbildning inom UX-design eller motsvarande kompetens
* Praktisk erfarenhet av:


	+ Design av digitala tjänster med stark användarfokus
	+ UX-research, prototypframtagning och webbdesign

**3. Tjänstedesigner**

* Utbildning inom tjänstedesign eller motsvarande kompetens
* Praktisk erfarenhet av:


	+ Användardrivna processer i komplexa organisationer
	+ Undersökning, insiktsarbete och idégenerering
	+ Workshopledning, prototypning och implementering
	+ Utbildning och coachning inom design thinking

**Bör-krav (Meriterande):**

* Erfarenhet från större organisationer och offentlig sektor
* UI-kompetens och vana av teamarbete
* Förmåga till visualisering och samarbete
* Ledarskap, flexibilitet och god kommunikativ förmåga
* Struktur, dokumentation och pedagogisk förmåga

 **Ytterligare information** **Omfattning: 50**%  

**Location:** Stockholm

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Job Title
Senior UX Designer
Job Description
Are you a strategic UX Designer who thrives in an environment where collaboration drives business results? We're looking for a Senior UX Designer to join our team at Axis HQ in Lund and shape the future of our web solutions.
Who is your future team?
You'll be part of a growing team of 7 curious and positive UX Designers who work on both external and internal-facing web solutions. Together, we have fun, develop, and deliver experiences that make a significant impact on our customers, business and colleagues alike.
What you'll do here as a Senior UX Designer
As a senior UX Designer, you will design solutions that drive business growth and customer engagement. You'll leverage your strong human-centered design approaches to develop strategic UX design plans for various projects and products. Your focus will be on creating seamless customer experiences across our commercial web solutions, including Axis.com, partner tools, and internal platforms.
You'll work closely with stakeholders, development teams, and other UX Designers to define, describe, and collaborate on web solutions that meet business needs and customer expectations. Your key responsibilities will include:* Developing and implementing UX design strategies that drive business results.
* Conducting customer research and analyzing user behavior to inform design decisions.
* Creating customer journey maps and service blueprints to identify areas for improvement.
* Designing intuitive and user-friendly interfaces that meet business objectives
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure design solutions meet business needs.
* Leading design workshops, brainstorming sessions and other co-creation sessions to bring the UX and product strategies to life.


Who are we looking for?
We're seeking a kind and passionate senior UX Designer with strategic skills, a commercial mindset, and a passion for creating experiences that drive business results. You're a natural leader who dares to ask the hard questions, challenge old truths, and drive change. As a person, you're curious, driven, responsive, and unpretentious. You're an expert in UX design, with a solid understanding of service design and customer journey mapping.
Requirements:* Formal qualifications in a related field (e.g., Bachelor's Degree) or equivalent.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in Product/UX Design or equivalent roles where you've led design activities like research, concepts, prototypes, and usability testing.
* Preferably at least 2 years of experience working in large, complex organizations, connecting design to business performance.
* Strong communication and storytelling skills to engage with end-users, developers, and stakeholders at all levels.
* Proficiency in service design, customer journey mapping, and creating business-oriented design solutions.
* Ability to coach and assist in the development of other UX Designers and share your knowledge of design with the organisation.
* Experience with responsive web applications, marketing, agile development, and B2B context is a plus.


If you're a strategic UX designer with a passion for creating experiences that drive business results, we'd love to hear from you!  

What Axis have to offer  

By joining Axis, you will embark on an exciting journey of personal and professional growth. We will offer you a great introduction to Axis with training. Our team will support you, but also listen to your experiences and give you freedom to explore and realize your ideas. We are a fast-growing company that can offer you great career opportunities and a competitive package of benefits.
In exchange for your dedication, Axis offers you a job in an open, friendly, and professional environment. We work in an innovative and global organization that takes great pride in delivering world-class, high-quality products, services, and solutions to our customers. Working with us gives you an excellent opportunity to develop in an organization promoting professional and individual growth. You will have a role where your operational effort really will be of great impact to the overall success of Axis.  

  

We want you to enjoy working with us, which is why we offer benefits such as flexible working hours, morning “fika” every day, Friday cake, company bonus, wellness allowance, health insurance and your very own Axis bicycle - to name a few.  

We also provide a brand new training facility free for every Axis employee, you can see it here Axis HQ.  

We believe in sustainability, equality and inclusion, read more here.  

  

Axis is an organization that values creativity and promotes teamwork and openness. With us you will grow both personally and professionally. You will be part of a team of great colleagues that enjoy going to work in the morning. Welcome!  

Curious to discover more?  

We have a host of places where you can learn more about Axis, our products, solutions, company culture, and what working at Axis is really like.  

Check out:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis  

Ready to Act?  

Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.  

  

If you have any questions, you are welcome to reach out to recruiting manager Pia Löfving at +46706236585.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-06-03*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Frontend Software Architect within eHealth
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.
  
  

The position As a Software Architect, you will have the opportunity to shape the future of software development across the entire Cambio portfolio. We are building a modern, device-agnostic application framework grounded in reusable organisms and declarative programming. You will be responsible for continuing the design of the framework, contributing to its development, incorporating feedback and requirements from multiple teams, and prioritizing feature development to meet Cambio’s business needs.
  
In this role, you will be expected to lead a team of 6-12 developers and UX designers, providing guidance, coaching and feedback. You will need to balance agile feature development with ongoing maintenance, service delivery, and company outreach. We are transforming our way of working in front-end development, so excellent communication skills are a must.
  
  

About you We are searching for a passionate frontend focused Software Architect to join our new development team within the eHealth domain. Requirements
  
10+ years of experience in frontend development with a strong understanding of modern web technologies
  
Proven experience in building complex web applications with multiple stakeholders
  
Deep expertise in at least one frontend framework with working knowledge of others
  
Ability to design, plan, and execute complex systems
  
Strong analytical skills with the ability to build an architecture that meets current and future strategic goals
  
Communicates fluently in both spoken and written English
  
Proficiency in TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, web APIs, and HTML
  
  

It’s a bonus if you have
  
Understanding of UX/UI principles, with experience collaborating with designers on user-centric solutions
  
Experience deploying and managing frontend applications in cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
  
Communication skills in Swedish
  
  

What we offer A dynamic and stimulating work environment where you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects with a talented team of professionals. You will be part of a company that is committed to excellence and innovation in the eHealth industry.
  
As a Senior Software Architect, you will have a fundamental influence on the direction of healthcare development in the Nordics. You will have the opportunity to shape the future of eHealth and make a significant difference in the care and wellness of millions.
  
  

**Place of employment:** Linköping, Stockholm, or remote within Sweden
  
At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
  
**Scope:** Full time
  
**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
  
**Other:** We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
  
We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work inSweden.We will ask for verification during the process.
  
We look forward to receiving your application!
  
Read more about us here!
  
Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site here!

title: UX/UI Designer Intern
company_industry: Software Development, Manufacturing, and IT System Training and Support
description:
**XR Solutions** 
 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join our team for an Internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in Design, Marketing and XR within a fast-paced and supportive environment.
 



  





**You will among other things be work with:** 




  




* Be involved in all stages of the design process within projects; from research, workshops, idea generation, concepts to prototypes and delivery of design.
* Create marketing content and be a part of taking our product to market.
* Create interaction design through customer journeys, sketches, wireframes and prototypes based on insights.
* Use creative tools like Figma and other suitable design software in the XR space.
* Conducting deep interviews and workshops for user research and product testing.
* Monitor and design the interface for head-mounted XR glasses and how the user should integrate with the software (e.g. Hand movements, eye tracking, etc.)



  





**To succeed in this role, you should have** 




  




* Previous of relevant work experience in UX/UI and
 **XR Design** 
 (
 **Meritorious)**
* An ability to easily communicate and work with others in teams, both with colleagues and customers.
* A self-propelled working method
* An ability to choose the tools and methods that best suit each specific situation.
* A user-focused mindset – a passionate drive for understanding and meeting user needs.
* Experience with Figma
* Open mindset to try new working methods and software tools that just launched on the market.



  





**What we offer** 



* Practical experience of e.g. product development in the AR-Space
* Opportunity to contribute directly to the growth of an exciting Startup
* Remote work and flex Office spaces
* Strategic work and planning
* Be part of a product launch



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in Design and marketing.
 



  





 This is a unpaid internship initially

title: UX/UI Designer with Frontend Development Skills
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we create world-class gaming products with bold, uncompromising design and unmatched attention to detail. We're looking for a UX/UI Designer who doesn't just stop at the design phase — you also bring your ideas to life in code.
   

  

 You'll join a cross-functional product team with full ownership over the solutions you design, working on innovative and highly interactive user experiences seen by players around the world. You'll collaborate closely with engineers to create products that are both beautiful and usable — and you'll write production-ready code to ensure your vision comes to life exactly as you imagined it.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Lead UX and UI design efforts for new and existing products — from user flows and wireframes to high-fidelity mockups.
* Translate your designs into functional, responsive, and accessible frontend components using React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Partner with developers and stakeholders to iterate on solutions, run experiments, and refine interfaces based on user feedback and performance data.
* Build and maintain components in a shared design system, ensuring consistency and scalability across products.
* Advocate for user-centered design throughout the product development process.


 You Might Be a Great Fit If You
   

  

* Have a strong background in UX/UI design, with a portfolio showcasing thoughtful, elegant interfaces and interaction design.
* Are fluent in modern design tools like Figma, and enjoy prototyping and testing user flows.
* Know how to write clean, maintainable frontend code using React and TypeScript.
* Are comfortable working with developers and understand how design decisions impact performance and implementation.
* Care deeply about usability, accessibility, and the overall user experience.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where experimentation is encouraged.


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Familiarity with A/B testing, analytics, and data-driven design decisions.
* An understanding of game or entertainment product design patterns.


 Technologies You'll Touch
   

  

* Figma (or other tools you prefer) / Design Systems
* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)


 Who we are
   

  

 You don't need to know everything from day one. If you're a designer who loves to get your hands dirty in code, and you're passionate about crafting exceptional user experiences, we'd love to meet you.
   

  

 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and help shape the future of interactive entertainment.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Product Director
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 



  




* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than
 **420 million** 
 active users per month.
* Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth
 
 with
 
 high profitability.
* Listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.



  





**As the Product Director, Search at Truecaller** 
 , you will lead the strategy, development, and execution of the product roadmap for the team that powers our core search and identification capabilities. You will be responsible for ensuring Truecaller continues to deliver world-class caller ID, fraud detection, and spam prevention by leveraging cutting-edge AI, data science, and scalable backend services. This role is critical to our mission of making communication safer and more efficient for hundreds of millions of users worldwide. This role demands a deep understanding of data-intensive products, AI-driven insights, and proven experience leading product development for Android apps and high-availability backend services. You will collaborate closely with senior data scientists, backend and Android engineers, UX designers, and other product managers to drive innovation and enhance Truecaller’s core functionalities.
 



 Reporting directly to the VP of Product, you will play a key role in aligning your team’s strategy with Truecaller’s overall product vision and business goals.
 



  





 The Search business unit encompasses multiple teams focused on caller identification, spam and fraud prevention, and data insights. You will oversee product development and ensure seamless alignment with Truecaller’s broader vision.
 



  





**The impact you will create:** 




  




* Define and champion the product strategy for Search, driving long-term growth and success.
* Lead the development of AI-driven innovations to enhance Truecaller’s fraud detection, spam blocking, and caller identification capabilities.
* Ensure that search and caller identification services provide a seamless, fast, and accurate experience for hundreds of millions of users globally.
* Drive roadmap execution in close collaboration with data science, engineering, and design teams.
* Manage key Search KPIs, ensuring continuous improvement in accuracy, performance, and user experience.
* Build, mentor, and scale the team, ensuring we have the right mix of product managers, engineers, and data scientists to achieve our ambitious goals.



  





**What you bring in:** 




  




* 10+ years of experience in product management, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
* Proven experience in AI-driven products, search technologies, or fraud/spam prevention.
* Strong background in data-intensive environments and experience working effectively with senior data scientists.
* Demonstrated success in leading cross-functional teams, including data science, backend engineering, Android development, and UX.
* Ability to define and articulate a compelling product vision while aligning with broader company objectives.
* Exceptional leadership skills with the ability to inspire, mentor, and develop high-performing teams.
* Solid understanding of AI, data pipelines, and backend architecture for high-availability services.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and stakeholder management skills, with experience collaborating across global teams.



  





**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/** 




  





**Sounds like your dream job?** 




  





 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
 



  





**What we offer:** 




  




* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package** 
 : Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and/or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There's something for everyone!



  





**Come as you are:** 




  





 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you**

title: Junior Graphic Designer (Part-Time)
description:
We’re looking for a creative and detail-oriented junior designer ready to grow with us.
 



  





 DRM-LND is a fast-growing fashion brand with retail locations across Europe and the Middle East, and more to come. Since our launch in October 2023, we’ve opened stores in the UK, Kuwait, Sweden, Denmark and Finland and we’re now heading into the USA, Poland, the Baltics and beyond. We’re building something bold, international and personal and now we’re looking for a part-time junior graphic designer to join our creative team in Stockholm.
 



  





**About the role** 




  





 As our new junior designer, you’ll work closely with our Art Director and support day-to-day design production. Your work will touch everything from physical materials to digital visuals, all with the goal of keeping the DRM-LND brand strong, clear and exciting across every market.
 



  





**Your main focus will be:** 



* Print and in-store materials (signage, campaign artwork, POS assets)
* Website visuals (product images, promotional banners, icons)
* Newsletter layouts and email visuals
* Campaign adaptations for site, mail and retail
* Brand templates and design toolkits for our international partners
* Finalizing artwork, creating originals and maintaining consistency



  





 This role does not include social media content or ad creatives. Those are handled by our content and paid teams. You will, however, work with campaign images and brand assets that are used across web, mail and in-store.
 



  





**You probably are…** 



* Recently graduated or in the early stages of your design career
* Highly detail-oriented with a strong eye for layout and typography
* Confident using Figma, Adobe InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop
* Someone who enjoys both structure and creative thinking
* Comfortable taking initiative, but also loves working as part of a team
* Quick, curious and happy to pitch in wherever needed



  





**We offer** 



* A part-time role (approx. 50%) with flexible working hours
* A creative, high-energy environment where your ideas matter
* The chance to grow with a fast-scaling brand and gain hands-on experience
* A central Stockholm office and studio with a passionate team



  





**How to apply** 




 Please send your CV and portfolio (in English) to
 **info@drm-lnd.com** 
 . Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.

title: Designer
description:
Are you ready to impact the future of gaming through design? North Kingdom is looking for an experienced visual designer to join our team in Stockholm.
 



  





 You will be a key-part of our team in shaping, defining and crafting the visual vision of our projects. As a Designer you are passionate about the craft, always curious, and leave no details behind. At North Kingdom, we take pride in always striving to deliver world-class experiences and services for clients such as Google, Supercell, EA, Riot and 10 Chambers.
 



  





 You have a solid understanding of UX, and are able to execute design solutions that not only look good, but also feel alive and great to use.
 



  





 This position is full time and based in Stockholm with a hybrid working model. Make sure to attach a link to your portfolio (Applicants with no portfolio won't be reviewed).
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 In your role you will have a wide range of tasks that will include:
 


* Make sure the entire team understands the visual vision and feels motivated to strive toward the same goal
* Present and pitch to clients
* Take design briefs and create design systems/solutions, protecting the quality and craft of the ideas when they move through to production



  





**Requirements & Skills** 



* Several years of experience within digital design, preferably at a digital production company or agency
* Deep knowledge of applications like Figma, Photoshop, and Illustrator
* Great understanding of the opportunities and limitations of the modern web
* Great aesthetic sensibilities, experience in motion a plus
* Comfortable with and used to speaking and presenting in English
* Exceptional communication skills both in writing and speech
* A relevant degree or education in design (a plus, not a requirement)
* A background in illustration, art or 3D is a plus



  





**Who you are** 



* A team player who can take initiative and develop solutions
* A problem-solver who can align solutions with client needs
* You have the ability to oversee the process of a project and quality control on design polish
* You treat challenges as opportunities and come at them with an optimistic viewpoint



  





**Working at North Kingdom** 




 North Kingdom is the creative arm for Gaming & Entertainment within NoA Ignite.
 



 It's our ambition to be the best workplace in the world. We believe you should use both your passion and mastery in your work, get inspired, feel safe, work hard and have fun. We expect you to be professional, brave, honest and engaged, but most importantly: be You.
 



  





**What you get** 



* Pension contribution
* Private health insurance
* Parental leave top-up
* 5,000 SEK health care allowance
* Flexible work hours



  





 Are we everything you ever looked for in a workplace? Get in touch! We are meeting applicants on an ongoing basis. There is no need for a personal letter or a CV. Just provide a link to your LinkedIn profile and attach your portfolio. That's it! Next up: if your profile matches what we are looking for, we will reach out to you as soon as possible.

title: Junior Graphic Designer
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.* 




  





 We're seeking an enthusiastic and talented
 **Junior Graphic Designer** 
 to join our dynamic Marketing Team in Stockholm, Sweden. In this role, you will play a crucial part in our user acquisition and engagement efforts by creating compelling visual content for our paid advertising, CRM campaigns, and other digital channels. You'll have the opportunity to leverage your design and video-editing skills to attract new users and nurture our existing community.
 



  





**What you will be doing** 




  




* Design engaging and effective visual assets for various digital platforms, including social media ads, display ads, email marketing, landing pages, and website content.
* Create and edit short-form video content for our digital channels to capture attention and communicate key messages.
* Collaborate closely with the Marketing Team, including performance marketers and CRM specialists, to understand campaign objectives and target audiences.
* Ensure all visual materials align with the Natural Cycles brand guidelines and maintain a consistent visual identity.
* Contribute to the development and execution of creative concepts and visual strategies.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest design trends, tools, and best practices in digital marketing.



  





**What skills and experience we think you have** 




  




* You have a strong portfolio showcasing your design skills and a keen eye for visual aesthetics, specifically within the digital realm.
* You possess solid graphic design skills, including proficiency in industry-standard design software (e.g., Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Figma).
* You have experience in video editing (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, or similar tools) and are comfortable creating engaging short-form video content.
* You understand the principles of effective visual communication for digital marketing purposes.
* You are a proactive and self-motivated individual with a strong ability to manage your time and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* You are a team player with excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* You are detail-oriented and have a strong commitment to producing high-quality work.
* Fluency in English is required.



  





**Bonus Points For:** 




  




* Experience working with motion graphics and animation.
* Familiarity with CRM platforms and email marketing design best practices.
* Understanding of performance marketing metrics and how design impacts campaign results.
* Passion for women's health and the Natural Cycles mission.



  





**What we offer** 




  




* Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
* Professional development - you will collaborate with an experienced team, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
* Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
* Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
* Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development



  





  





**Location** 




 We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the Brand and Communications team you will work with is located in Stockholm.
 



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible.
 



 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





**Note:** 
 We are not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies
 



  





  





**How to apply** 




 To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
 



 At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.

title: Konsultteam för Innovationsledning, UX- och Tjänstedesign
description:
Företagsbeskrivning
   

  

 Vi är ett konsultföretag med ett gäng teknikintresserade och glada människor!
   

  

 Vi älskar teknik, vi älskar design och vi älskar kvalitet. Vår mångfald gör oss unika och skapar en inkluderande och välkomnande arbetsplats där varje individ är högt värderad.
   

  

 Hos oss är varje individ sig själv och respekterar andra för den de är. Vi tror att när en fantastisk mix av människor samlas och delar sin kunskap, sina erfarenheter och idéer, kan vi hjälpa våra kunder på en helt annan nivå.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som kan börja omgående och vill växa med oss!
   

  

 Hos oss har du stora möjligheter att ta verkliga kliv i din karriär och chansen att ta stort ansvar.
   

  

 Jobbeskrivning
   

  

 Vi söker ett kvalificerat
 **konsultteam om tre personer** 
 för att stärka innovationsförmågan. Uppdraget genomförs inom ramen för kontoret för innovation och utveckling, där ni kommer bidra med expertis inom
 **innovationsledning, UX-design och tjänstedesign** 
 .
   

  

* Tillföra spetskompetens inom innovationsledning, UX-design och tjänstedesign
