title: Azure Developer
description:
Join Dustin’s integration team and take charge of driving innovation as you work with cutting-edge Azure technologies to shape the future of our cloud solutions. If you're passionate about Azure, integrations, and making an impact through technology, this is the opportunity for you.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Azure Developer unique**
* Drive innovation with the latest Azure technologies in a key role shaping Dustin’s cloud-first transformation.
* Take the lead and inspire others by coaching and sharing your expertise within integrations and modern cloud architecture.
* Unleash your creativity in a tech-driven team where your ideas and initiatives truly make an impact.
* The hiring manager for the role is Sara Wennerström, Director of Application Management. She believes that successful work is built on initiative, engagement, and a solid understanding of business processes and system support. As a leader, she is open, attentive, and committed to setting goals together with the team to achieve collective success.


 The integration development team is close-knit, where members consistently support one another, balancing focused work time from home with two fixed office days each week, dedicated to collaboration and enjoying early lunches together.
   

  

****Read more about Dustin here****
**Your role & influence as Azure Developer**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for integration development in Azure, including designing solution architectures for new requirements and driving process improvements as an informal leader within the team.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of integration development between standard applications, build APIs for external customers, and continuously maintain and improve the team’s solutions. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with other developers across Technology and a wide range of internal and external stakeholders around Dustin.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Develop and implement integration solutions using Azure technologies like Logic Apps, Azure Functions, and Service Bus.
* Design solution architectures for new integration requirements and recommend the best technical approaches.
* Collaborate with the team to maintain and improve existing BizTalk solutions, while coaching and sharing knowledge with colleagues in the Azure and integration space.


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

**You can find more on our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual passionate about cutting-edge technology, eager to lead and mentor, and skilled at driving innovative solutions. We expect that you bring solid senior experience in Azure Functions, Logic Apps, Service Bus, and Cosmos DB, with a strong background in leading teams, implementing new processes, and solution architecture.
   

  

**Additionally, It'll Be Nice If You Bring**
* A bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* Experience with APIM, Biztalk
* Proficiency in Swedish.


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu.
* First interview with the Hiring Manager, Sara Wennerström.
* Technical (Second) interview with three future colleagues from the team.
* Professional References.


**About**
**Read more about how to become a** 
**Dustineer**
 For questions about the position, please contact the Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu via e-mail: karishma.sindhu@dustin.com
 **.**

title: Erfaren logistiker - Trollhättan
description:
Har du vad som krävs för att lyckas i IT-konsultvärlden? VIPAS AB söker nya talanger för spännande projekt inom telekom, automotive, retail och bank!
   

  

**Om VIPAS:**
 Föreställ dig en värld där din affärsteknik är sömlöst anpassad till dina mål – effektiv, skalbar och innovativ. På VIPAS AB är detta vår vision och drivkraft. Vi är mer än ett IT-konsultföretag – vi är din strategiska partner för att utveckla skräddarsydda lösningar med den senaste tekniken, såsom Java och Python. Med djup expertis inom mjukvaruutveckling, DevOps och ingenjörskonst säkerställer vårt erfarna team att du navigerar den moderna teknikens landskap med trygghet, innovation och långsiktig framgång.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning:**
 Är du en skicklig logistiker med helhetsperspektiv och erfarenhet från tillverkande industri? Vill du vara med och forma framtidens materialflöden hos ett ledande företag i
 **Trollhättan** 
 ? Du blir en del av ett engagerat team med andra logistiker och lean-experter, där det finns gott om möjlighet att utvecklas i en verksamhet med stort fokus på kvalitet, effektivitet och hållbarhet.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**
 I rollen får du ett brett ansvar för att utveckla och driva arbetet med planering, samordning och optimering av materialflöden i nära samarbete med andra funktioner som produktion, inköp och lager. Uppdraget sker på plats i Trollhättan
   

  

* Säkerställa rätt material på rätt plats i rätt tid – från inköp till produktion
* Skapa och följa upp produktionsplaner och kapacitetsutnyttjande
* Optimera lagerhållning och kassaflöde utifrån rådande affärsvillkor
* Planera och följa upp transporter och distribution
* Utföra dataanalyser och förbättringsarbete inom hela logistikkedjan
* Säkerställa rätt inställningar och användning av SAP/ERP-system
* Delta i och driva förändringsarbete med hållbarhet och kostnadsfokus


**Kravprofil:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet från tillverkande industri, gärna inom logistik, produktion eller supply chain
* God förmåga att se helheten och förstå logistikens påverkan på kostnad, intäkt och kapital
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att driva förändringsarbete i praktiken
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga och vana att samarbeta med olika delar av organisationen
* God vana av SAP eller liknande ERP-system
* Ett prestigelöst förhållningssätt och ett stort engagemang


**Varför jobba hos oss?**
 VIPAS AB erbjuder attraktiva anställningspaket för IT-konsulter, i enlighet med Teknikföretagens (Almega) kollektivavtal. Att arbeta med oss innebär möjligheter inom olika branscher, vilket ger dig flexibilitet och möjligheter till utveckling. Om du är drivande och redo att anta nya utmaningar, är VIPAS familjen för dig!
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av ett innovativt team som driver framtiden inom telekom, fordon, detaljhandel och bank. Om du är redo att ta dig an utmanande projekt och växa i en banbrytande miljö, är detta möjligheten för dig! Ansök nu
   

  

 Tveka inte att kontakta oss på shivangi@vipas.se.
   

  

 Observera: Ansök gärna om du har permanent uppehållstillstånd, svenskt medborgarskap eller ett giltigt arbetstillstånd för Sverige.
   

  

 Hur ansöker du:
   

  

 Intresserade kandidater uppmanas att skicka in sitt CV och personliga brev. Gå med oss och driv innovation på VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Observera att vi rekryterar löpande, vilket innebär att uppdraget kan stängas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Om du är intresserad rekommenderar vi att du ansöker omedelbart!

title: Application & Change Manager to Filmstaden and Odeon Cinemas Group
description:
Do you want to be part of shaping the future cinema experience through smart and innovative IT solutions? Filmstaden and Odeon Cinemas Group are now looking for an
 **Application & Change Manager** 
 to join our dynamic and forward-thinking IT team! In this role, you'll have the opportunity to work hands-on with our system management, contributing to both strategic initiatives and the day-to-day improvement of our systems and digital platforms!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an Application & Change Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring that IT solutions related to loyalty, integrations, and supporting systems are developed, maintained, and continuously improved. You will have ownership of the technical requirements in these areas and act as a key link between IT and various parts of the organization. A central part of your role will be to drive ongoing improvements, manage smaller projects and initiatives, and ensure that our solutions are future-proof, efficient, and designed with our guest experience in mind.
   

  

 You will act as the Delivery Lead for two smaller developer teams focused on Loyalty and Integrations. Over time, your scope as Delivery Lead could also expand to digital channels (web, app). In this role, you are responsible for planning and prioritizing the teams’ work.
   

  

**Key Accountabilities And Responsibilities**
* Responsible for ensuring that loyalty, integrations, and select supporting systems meet expected standards both now and in the future. You will secure operational stability, efficient architecture, and excellent user experience.
* Work closely with several business units to understand, capture, and analyze needs and demands. You will prepare decision material in consultation with business stakeholders and be responsible for the subsequent delivery and follow-up.
* Lead releases within your scope. Plan and prioritize the developer teams’ work to ensure effective delivery and high-quality results that enhance the cinema experience
* Act as a project manager for larger initiatives, ensuring high quality, traceability, and alignment throughout the entire process from requirements gathering to final delivery
* Manage and develop agreements with third-party suppliers, including negotiation and following up on service-level agreements (SLAs) as well as ensuring that compliance and security requirements are met


 You will join ODEON Cinemas Group Northern Europe, which includes some of the most well-known cinema brands in the Nordics: Finnkino (Finland), Filmstaden (Sweden), and Odeon Kino (Norway). You will be part of our IT department and join the Application & Change team alongside three other colleagues. In this role, you will work closely with the broader IT organization as well as various departments across the company. You will report directly to the Head of Application & Change.
   

  

 You will be based at our Support Office in Gamla Råsunda, Stockholm, with the possibility to partially work from home through our hybrid working model. The position is a permanent employment with a six-month probationary period, and the start date is by agreement, but as soon as possible after the summer.
   

  

**Qualifications, Skills And Experience**
* 3 – 5 to years of experience of working in a similar roll with or within an IT organization
* Relevant academic education within IT, business administration, or a related field
* Proven ability to gather and handle requirements from cross-functional business units, preferably within an international environment
* Experience as a Delivery Lead and/or Project manager is preferred
* Strong knowledge of systems and tools such as DevOps platforms, Slack and loyalty related systems including CRM platforms and marketing automation tools (e.g. Braze) is valued
* ITIL4 certification is valued
* Proficient written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English is a requirement


**Personal Qualities and Characteristics:**
 We are looking for someone who is structured and organized in their ways of working, with the ability to navigate various projects and tasks with clarity and precision. Taking a methodical approach, you work systematically through each phase to ensure nothing is overlooked. With a solution-oriented mindset, you actively seek ways to overcome challenges and drive progress forward.
   

  

 To thrive in this role, strong communication and interpersonal skills are essential, along with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams. Taking full ownership of your responsibilities comes naturally to you, as a self-driven and motivated individual. You also excel at creating clear and concise decision-making material for stakeholders, with a talent for breaking down complex tasks into simple, easily understandable steps.
   

  

 We highly value personal suitability and seek someone who embodies our core values: Fun & Passion, Quality & Service, Trust & Respect, Cooperation & Accountability. Last but not least, you have a great interest and passion for movies and the cinema experience! If you bring these competencies and align with our values, we invite you to consider this opportunity!
   

  

**What We Offer**
* An exciting and dynamic work environment in an entertainment industry that is constantly evolving and changing.
* The opportunity to make an impact and contribute to the continued development of the cinema experience.
* A Nordic role with the chance to work with an engaged and passionate customer base.
* Free movie visits and discounts on popcorn, soft drinks, and candy.
* A wellness allowance and free access to our Employee Assistance Program – an online platform offering advice and support on topics such as finances, health, and mental well-being.


**Does this sound like a role for you?**
 If so, we encourage you to submit your application to us by no later than the 31 of May 2025. We review applications continuously, so please send in your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to contact Emilia Kottorp, Talent Acquisition Partner, at emilia.kottorp@filmstaden.se. Please note that we do not accept applications via email due to GDPR.
 **Welcome with your application!**
*At ODEON Cinemas Group, everyone is welcome. We make movies better by bringing all our incredible differences and our different ways of thinking together with our passion for cinema, to deliver inspiring entertainment experiences for our guests. We are all individuals, and we recognize that everyone brings something special to our team. Starting from the moment you apply, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are embedded into all parts of the colleague journey, and we welcome individuals from all backgrounds. We select colleagues based on merit and the passion they show for their role.*

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
**Join Simployer as a Senior Fullstack Engineer (backend focus)**



Simployer is transforming HR tech, and we are on the lookout for an experienced Senior Fullstack Engineer to help us build a world-class platform. As part of the growing team, you will work with cutting-edge technologies to create innovative features that will be used by organizations across Europe. Join us in shaping the future of HR technology as we continue to revolutionize the industry with AI-powered solutions, seamless HR systems, and exceptional user experiences.


**What We Offer**


* **Collaborative Culture** – Join a supportive, dynamic team dedicated to learning and growth.
* **Professional Development** – Access opportunities to expand your skills and grow within the organization.
* **Competitive Compensation** – Enjoy a market-aligned salary and benefits package.
* **Real Impact** – Make a significant impact on our products, clients, and business.


**About the Role**


  
Skills & Requirements


**What You Will Do:**


* Drive the development of key features across the full stack, with a strong focus on designing and implementing robust and scalable backend solutions.
* Build new features from scratch, improve existing code, and ensure it remains clean, scalable, and efficient.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the product meets both business and user needs.
* Take ownership of your work and contribute autonomously while driving product development forward.
* Contribute to system architecture design, ensuring stability and scalability as the product evolves.


**What You Will Bring to the Team:**


* Strong proficiency in **Node.js** and **TypeScript**.
* Advanced understanding with **NestJS** framework and **MongoDB**.
* Solid experience in **REST,** **GraphQL APIs, unit and integration tests using Jest.**
* Experience with **Redis**, **RabbitMQ**, and/or other similar technologies in the stack.
* Experience working with **React** frontend.
* Experience developing production-grade applications, with a strong understanding of **API design** (server-to-server, server-to-client).
* Expertise in **data modeling**, and working with **cloud platforms** such as **GCP**, **AWS**, or **Azure**. Experience in **Kubernetes** and **microservice architecture** are also favourable.
* Ability to maintain high coding standards and contribute to a collaborative, agile development environment.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
* A passion for building innovative software and contributing to a thriving development culture.

**What We See as a Plus:**


* Experience working with AI/ML technologies in a backend context.
* Experience in the **HR** **Tech** or **SaaS** industries.
* Knowledge of **Integration Testing** and **TDD** practices.


**Our Tech Stack:**


* Node.js, TypeScript, NestJS, MongoDB/Mongoose, GraphQL, REST, Redis, RabbitMQ, Jest, Kubernetes, microservices, GCP


**Message from the Hiring Manager:**

*“Hi! I'm Herman, the Engineering Manager for the HR Core team. In this role you will be working closely with myself and a team of talented, passionate individuals dedicated to delivering high-quality products for our customers.*


*At Simployer, I was welcomed into a culture of innovation and creative freedom, a work environment that encourages our team members to question the status quo and learn from their mistakes. So now I would like to extend this forward to yourself as well.*


*I look forward to learning more about you, and how you can contribute to our success."*


**Why Join Simployer?**



By joining Simployer, you’ll be part of a dynamic, inclusive, and innovative workplace. You’ll have access to unlimited resources and extensive industry experience while working with a variety of exciting products. We’re building something big — join us and be part of a culture that values your growth and success. Together, we’ll change the HR tech game!


**Our Hiring Process:**



* **Introduction meeting:** A brief chat with our recruiter for us to understand your background better, and for you to learn more about us and the role (approx. 30 minutes).


* **Personality & Logic Test:** A short assessment to help us understand your problem-solving abilities and cognitive strengths via Alva Labs


* **Technical Screening:** Meet with Herman, our Engineering Manager, for a technical discussion to assess your experience and skills (approx. 45 minutes).


* **Technical Interview:** A deeper dive into your technical expertise with Herman, our Engineering Manager, and other tech leaders, and for you to get a feel for our team (approx. 60 minutes).


* **Informal HR Interview**: Before making an offer, we’ll have a final informal chat to answer any last questions and ensure everything feels right on both sides (approx. 30 minutes).



**We can’t wait to meet you!**



At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to achieve their best. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas can truly make a difference.


  
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------


Hybrid and flexible work model


Modern offices


Pension and health care


Laughs, develops, and celebrates together


HR tech company


Career opportunities


  
Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?  



  

**Our Values**
**Learn, Lead and Deliver**
With every new piece of information we acquire, and every new skill we develop, we become stronger, wiser, and more capable of delivering good products and meaningful experiences. We will never stop seeking knowledge, for it is the key that unlocks the door to our greatest potential.
We are open to new ideas and perspectives, eager to make the next move. We are curious about way of working and stay ahead of the curve. We lead by example and dare to fail fast. We're on a fun journey, as a team and together with our customer.
We put passion and dedication into our work, because we know that every delivery is an opportunity to make a difference. We approach each task with our hearts and a drive to exceed expectations. We don't just deliver, we do it with a passion for both our customer and Simployees.
We embrace what makes us human, take time to play and have fun together.

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
At Cision, we believe in empowering every individual to make an impact. Here, your voice is heard, your ideas are valued, and your unique perspective fuels our collective success. As part of our global team, you'll thrive in an environment that champions curiosity, collaboration, and innovation, all while making meaningful contributions to the brands we accelerate.


Join us in shaping the future of communication and building authentic connections that matter. Whether you're solving complex problems or driving bold innovations, your growth is our success, and together, we’ll create the conversations of tomorrow.


**Empower your impact at Cision. Be seen, be understood, be you.**


As a Customer Support Specialist, reporting into Support Management, you are working within the boundaries of 1st Tier Support, while in close collaboration with Technical Product Specialists, Customer Experience and our fantastic R&D team.

  

**What you'll do:**


* Reply to customer inquiries via supported communication channels
* Identify, replicate, and report validated product issues to the R&D team
* Identify and log feature requests
* Follow-up on customer inquiries upon issue resolution/feedback from R&D
* Provide outstanding service to our customers via prompt and value-adding interactions over  

phone, email and chat
* Take ownership of support tickets and be responsible for funneling them through all process  

stages until a resolution has been reached
* Maintain an overview of submitted cases to R&D, and flag internal SLA breaches
* Escalate support cases based on severity levels and associated business risk assessments
* Be an expert on the Brandwatch product suite and its features as they are launched and engage  

in feature tests
* Update internal knowledge base with new relevant insights to enhance knowledge sharing  

across all support team members
* Participate and contribute to roundtables, calibration and training sessions within support and  

cross-functional departments

  

  

**What you have:**


* Excellent English language skills, written and verbal.
* Highly customer focused; shows a real passion for the customer experience and  

customer support industry.
* Driven, self-starter, enthusiastic and with an “ownership” mentality.
* Adaptable and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment.
* Able to prioritize workload in line with customer demand.
* Proven experience in a customer-interacting role.
* Ability to collaborate with internal and external partners whilst coordinating key  

customer deliverables, ensuring world class customer experience.
* Advanced listening and verbal communication skills to understand customer's needs,  

and ability to respond clearly and concisely both verbally and written.
* Enthusiast; strong work ethic with a positive mindset, and can-do attitude.
* Influencing and negotiation skills.
* Team player that appreciates working together for a common goal.
* Working knowledge of MS Office Suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint is required.


As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire, a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. Cision has offices in 24 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA and APAC. For more information about Cision's award-winning solutions, including its next-gen Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow @Cision on Twitter.


Cision is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and perform at their best. We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion is vital to driving our culture, sparking innovation and achieving long-term success. Cision is proud to have joined more than 600 companies in signing the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion™ pledge and named a “Top Diversity Employer” for 2021 by DiversityJobs.com.


Cision is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected statuses.


Cision is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Cision will take the steps to assure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact hr.support@cision.com


Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Cision’s commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.

title: Sales Executive (Swedish speaker) - Nordic New Business Team
description:
At Cision, we believe in empowering every individual to make an impact. Here, your voice is heard, your ideas are valued, and your unique perspective fuels our collective success. As part of our global team, you'll thrive in an environment that champions curiosity, collaboration, and innovation, all while making meaningful contributions to the brands we accelerate.


Join us in shaping the future of communication and building authentic connections that matter. Whether you're solving complex problems or driving bold innovations, your growth is our success, and together, we’ll create the conversations of tomorrow.


**Empower your impact at Cision. Be seen, be understood, be you.**





The Nordic New Business team at Cision is made up of 8-10 Sales Executives focused on bringing new clients to Cision and, to a lesser extent, expanding our existing client portfolio.



As a Sales Executive, your role will be integral in driving new business and strengthening relationships with key decision-makers in the market.


**Main Tasks and Responsibilities:**



As a Sales Executive at Cision, you will work within an advanced and consultative SaaS sales environment. You will be responsible for managing the entire sales process from beginning to end:


* **Prospecting:** Identifying and reaching out to potential clients.
  
* **First Contact:** Initiating discussions with potential leads.
  
* **Presentations:** Conducting tailored presentations that map out client needs.
  
* **Needs Assessment:** Uncovering the needs, pain points, and challenges of prospects.
  
* **Quotes & Negotiation:** Handling quotes, agreements, and negotiations with potential clients.
  
* **Closing:** Successfully closing deals and finalizing agreements.
  
* **Client Management:** Acting as the main point of contact for your prospects, nurturing long-term relationships.

Your main contacts will typically include PR & Communications Managers, Marketing Managers, CFOs, and CEOs.

**Experience:**


* Proven track record in SaaS sales or similar consultative sales roles.

* Highly driven and business-oriented.
  
* Genuine interest in PR, IR, communications, and digital marketing.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****4-6 months**
  
We are looking for a ML Engineer to our client.


**Start:** 26th of May

**Length:** 5 months with possible extension

**Location:** Stockholm on-site 2-3 days per week (fully remote not possible)


The primary tasks will be to:

* Develop AI/ML software products including but not limited to explore large data set, try out new algorithms, feature engineering, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out to the comprehensive fashion network of the company
* Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.
* Leverage on understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code.
* Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, A/B test, etc.
* Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem within the company.

  

Required skills and experiences:

* Have a BSc or MSc degree in computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* Have 4+ years’ professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a Machine Learning Engineer.
* A hands-on person who loves coding, and like applying software engineering practices to machine learning projects.
* Have experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production.
* Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 3+ years.
* Have great experience with cloud technologies for ML development, preferably Google Cloud and Vertex AI.
* Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, and deploying ML applications to production.
* Have a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
* Have experience handling high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream) and a solid understanding of data structures, databases, and data storage technologies.
* Familiar with agile ways of working, team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation.

 **Required cloud certification: Yes, GCP, Azure or AWS**


  
Boris Batljan

title: Senior Account Executive, FSI
description:
:  

**Senior Account Executive, FSI - Hybrid** **Nice to meet you!**  

We’re a leader in data and AI. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence - and questions into answers.  

We’re also a debt-free multi-billion-dollar organization on our path to IPO-readiness. If you're looking for a dynamic, fulfilling career coupled with flexibility and world-class employee experience, you'll find it here. **About the job**


We’re looking for a Sr Account Executive to join our Sales organization in Sweden. By joining us on this role, you will take ownership of accounts within the Financial Services industry (Banking, Insurance). You will be responsible to drive new business development within the assigned territory while orchestrating teams supporting clients on several topics like AI, Analytics, Risk and Fraud Management.

  

We’re looking for an Account Executive who is customer-obsessed and ready to walk into a room backed by 40 years of analytics excellence and innovation. We need someone who is passionate about building authentic relationships with our customers, wants to help solve our customers’ problems and is ready to drive sales of our world-class software products, solutions and services.

 **As a Senior Account Executive FSI, you will**

* Be responsible for achievement of total software revenue target and management business objectives.
* Manage and keep on growing an existing set of accounts within the FSI industry.
* Develop plans to identify areas that have the potential for further development and execute them.
* Generate new business through strategic-based selling and managing relationships with customers.
* Sell software, solutions and services to current and prospective customers; work with other sales/pre-sales/domain/personnel to position and leverage sales opportunities.
* Direct complex sales opportunities including implementation plans, which include the coordination of internal and/or external services.
* Prepare standard quotations and proposal information as needed; work with other departments to create and finalize contracts and set time schedules for delivery services.
* Follow up with customers to track satisfaction levels and to discover additional revenue opportunities.

**Required qualifications**

* Experience in selling complex software solutions and services to both business owners and IT stakeholders.
* Experience in identifying and solving business challenges along the whole FSI value chain.
* Demonstrated experience in account mapping and in navigating in complex ecosystem.
* Ability to analyze and evaluate territory dynamics and develop a sales plan; ability to communicate technical and business concepts and relate them to SAS applications and user needs; ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.
* Knowledge of analytics solutions and/or Cloud and services preferred, but it is not essential.
* You’re curious, passionate, authentic and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do.

 **Diverse and Inclusive**
At SAS, it’s not about fitting into our culture – it’s about adding to it. We believe our people make the difference. Our diverse workforce brings together unique talents and inspires teams to create amazing software that reflects the diversity of our users and customers. Our commitment to diversity is a priority to our leadership, all the way up to the top; and it’s essential to who we are. To put it plainly: you are welcome here. **Additional Information:**
SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

  

S*AS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. If you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, or on behalf of SAS, please contact* *Recruitingsupport@sas.com.*

title: Cloud Migration Specialist
description:
**Role:**  

Your main focus will be to accelerate the migration from traditional network home directories to OneDrive for Business as the modern standard for personal storage. You will act as a key technical resource, ensuring the migration runs smoothly and remains closely aligned with project goals and timelines. Working collaboratively with other Product team engineers, you will contribute to planning, execution, and minimizing user impact throughout the transformation.


To succeed in this role, you bring a high level of technical confidence and previous experience from large-scale migrations in enterprise environments. A background in Digital Workplace – where you've worked with endpoint management, hardware policies, and user environments – is considered highly valuable.

**Essential requirements:**

  

* Expertise in Intune and Group Policy Objects (GPOs) for device and user management
* Strong knowledge of networking, including bandwidth and file access performance
* Deep understanding of NTFS permissions and their application in OneDrive and SharePoint Online
* Hands-on experience with Microsoft Migration Manager and similar migration tools
* Proficiency in PowerShell scripting for automation and troubleshooting

  

**Meritorious:**  

* Experience in Digital Workplace, with responsibility for hardware, device management, and policies.

Quartr is a software company serving the world of finance. The Quartr ecosystem gives millions of professional investors and corporate professionals worldwide easy access to first-party information from public companies through a variety of services – including a web app, a mobile app, and an API solution.


Our Data Tooling team is dedicated to developing and enhancing the tools crucial for our in-house data sourcing operations. We are looking for a talented individual to join this dynamic team.

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att du får en arbetsplats där du kan #GetTheFutureYouWant. Här blir du en del av en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över. Inom Cloud and Custom Applications (C&CA) på Capgemini arbetar du med de senaste teknologierna inom Cloud, Integration, AI och mjukvaruutveckling. Vi utvecklar skräddarsydda applikationer och hanterar komplexa integrationer för att maximera teknikens potential – med målet att skapa en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid. Följ med oss och samarbeta med världens ledande organisationer för att realisera teknikens fulla värde genom innovativa lösningar och molntransformation.  



  

**Om rollen**  

Som Test Automation Engineer kommer du att arbeta tillsammans med kunder i spännande och betydelsefulla projekt som formar framtidens digitala transformation.
  

  

*I denna position kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:*  



* Designa och implementera testautomationslösningar för att säkerställa mjukvarukvalitet och tillförlitlighet
* Fungera som en betrodd rådgivare och vägleda kunder om testautomationsstrategier och bästa praxis
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att utveckla effektiva och skalbara lösningar
Utveckla användarcentrerade testautomationslösningar som förbättrar slutanvändarens upplevelse och säkerställer tillförlitlighet, användbarhet och effektivitet i automatiserade tester  
* 

  

**Din profil**

* 4+ års erfarenhet i en relevant roll (t.ex. Test Automation, QA-Engineer eller Software Engineer med testautomationsansvar)
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Praktisk erfarenhet av testautomationsverktyg och ramverk (t.ex. Selenium, JUnit, TestNG, Cypress, Playwright). Kunskap om testhanterings- och felhanteringsverktyg (Jira, HP ALM)
Färdighet i skript- och programmeringsspråk (t.ex. Java, Python, C#, Javascript)  
* 

  

**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**

* På Capgemini är arbete mer än bara ett jobb – det är en plats att trivas, växa och göra verklig skillnad. Med starkt fokus på balans mellan arbete och privatliv, välbefinnande och inkludering, kommer du att vara en del av en global gemenskap av 340 000 kollegor.
* Här är du i förarsätet för din karriär – #GetTheFutureYouWant är vårt åtagande att ge dig möjlighet att forma din framtid. Från AI och moln till digital ingenjörskonst, kommer du att arbeta med banbrytande projekt som transformerar företag och skapar en mer hållbar och inkluderande värld.
Livet på Capgemini är givande, spännande och fyllt med möjligheter att lära, utmana dig själv och samarbeta med briljanta sinnen. Redo att #GetTheFutureYouWant? Välkommen! Låt oss göra det tillsammans.  
* 

  

**Ansökan**  

Redo att starta ett nytt kapitel i din karriär? Vi kan knappt vänta på att höra från dig! Ansök idag – vi hanterar ansökningar löpande. Under processen får du chansen att besöka vårt kontor, prata med rekryterande chef och självklart ställa alla dina nyfikna frågor till vår rekryterare. Vi lovar att göra din resa mot jobbet så smidig och givande som möjligt. Är du den vi söker? Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!  



  

*Observera att identitets- och bakgrundskontroller kan genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.*  

  

#LI-JK1


**Om Capgemini**  

Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.  



  

**Get The Future You Want** | www.capgemini.com

title: Senior Electrical Engineer- Research
description:

Full Time
Sweden

We are hiring **Senior Electrical Engineer- Research** for the position based in **Sweden.**


**Educational Qualification:** Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent, with specialization in Power Electronics.


**Job Summary:**



We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated **Senior Electrical Engineer- Research.** This role offers a unique opportunity to drive the future of AI datacenter infrastructure by developing advanced DC/DC conversion technologies and power electronics. You will be part of a dedicated research team shaping innovative solutions for hyper-scalers and global cloud infrastructure. This position is ideal for professionals who are passionate about power systems and eager to work on cutting-edge technologies.


**Required Experience/Competences:**


* **8+ years** of proven experience in **electrical development** within **power electronics systems.**
* In-depth knowledge of various power conversion topologies including resonant and hard-switched designs.
* Experience in **HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) system design.**
* Competency in circuit simulation tools and modeling techniques.
* Working knowledge of **magnetic field theory**, particularly for **transformer and inductor design**.
* Familiarity with **PMBus and I2C protocols**.
* Basic understanding of **embedded software/firmware development** and integration.
* Experience in conceptual product development from idea to prototype.

**Soft Skills:**


* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Proactive, self-driven, and passionate about research and innovation.
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
* Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively across interdisciplinary teams.
* Ability to manage priorities in a fast-paced and evolving research environment.

title: Commercial Advisor
description:
**Job Description** **WHAT YOU’LL DO**

We are looking for a Commercial Advisor to join our Business Tech organization. In this role, you will provide expert commercial support, delivering significant business value throughout the product lifecycle. Your experience in tech sourcing and procurement will be crucial as you develop business cases, execute high-quality deals, and optimize relationships with external partners.


As a Commercial Advisor, you will leverage your leadership skills and commitment to a collaborative, transparent, and trust-based culture. Your focus will be on creating value, driving growth, and achieving exceptional customer and business results.


Key Responsibilities:

* Define and implement commercial and partner strategies in collaboration with leaders.
* Negotiate favourable terms with external partners.
* Evaluate potential new partners and collaborations, particularly in tech.
* Set strategic parameters for partner portfolios to ensure optimal long-term management.
* Manage collaboration and performance within established frameworks, assessing risks versus expected outcomes.
* Oversee risk management for partner and vendor contracts.
* Challenge existing commercial models and propose new strategies for tech partnerships.
* Develop tailored negotiation strategies and processes for each deal.
* Design potential deals to meet objectives, balancing risk aversion and optionality.
* Manage dealmaking processes, including RFPs, tendering, and time planning.
* Ensure compliance with H&M Group Purchasing and Consultant Policy.
* Execute deals in line with initial objectives.
* Continuously update knowledge of relevant technologies and business needs through supplier and market analyses.
* Monitor and act on spend analyses.
* Facilitate collaboration and governance between product stakeholders, partners, and vendors.
* Manage contract life cycles, including extensions, renegotiations, terminations, and call offs.

**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**

You will collaborate closely with leaders and stakeholders within the Business Tech organization, as well as external partners and vendors. Your role will involve significant coordination to ensure the successful execution of commercial strategies and partnerships.

**WHO YOU ARE**

* 8+ years of experience in managing people, vendors, and technology in a global environment.
* Skilled negotiator with expertise in managing relationships with technology manufacturers and service providers.
* Relevant educational background is required.
* Excellent organizational and structuring skills for complex matters.
* Preference for experience with cloud companies.
* Strong foundation in procurement and supplier management best practices.
* Ability to develop, establish, and train processes.
* Bottom-line thinker with a deep understanding of tech-related business cases.
* Strong analytical skills, including KPI development and business case construction.
* Methodical thinker capable of connecting business case objectives to necessary actions.
* Effective critical thinking skills and a pragmatic approach.
* Ability to influence and persuade others.
* Excellent communication skills, including the ability to provide constructive challenges.

 **ADDITIONAL INFORMATION**


This is a full-time permanent position based at our head office in Stockholm. Ready to take the leap? Apply now with your application latest by **19 May 2025**. We are excited to welcome you to our team and start this incredible journey together!

**Benefits**  

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.


In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.

**Inclusion & Diversity**  

H&M Brand is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.


We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.

**Company Description**  

H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M Here.
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
Trintech is a multi-award winning cloud-based Fintech provider and we're seeking a Customer Success Manager to join our dynamic EMEA team! As a CSM you will be responsible for driving adoption, satisfaction, and retention across a portfolio of customers using our Adra solutions. You will leverage both high-touch and digital engagement strategies to manage a broad book of business efficiently, while partnering cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Support, and Professional Services to deliver value at scale.

This is a hybrid role, requiring 3 days per week in our Stockholm office.

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**

* Own the customer relationship for a large portfolio of Adra users across Norway and the Nordics.
* Serve as the primary point of contact throughout the post-sale customer lifecycle, ensuring successful onboarding, adoption, renewal, and expansion.  

Develop and execute Digital Touch engagement strategies for scalable support and value delivery.
* Act as a trusted advisor by understanding each customer’s business goals, challenges, and how Adra solutions support their financial operations.
* Monitor customer health metrics and proactively mitigate risk while identifying upsell or cross-sell opportunities.
* Collaborate with Product, Support, Sales, and Professional Services teams to improve the customer experience and advocate for customer needs internally.  

Deliver virtual or in-person training, product walk-throughs, and success planning sessions.
* Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, feedback, and activity in CRM systems.
* Contribute to customer education content and playbooks to support the broader customer base.


**WHO YOU ARE**


* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
* 2 years of experience as a Customer Success Manager or similar customer-facing role in a SaaS business.
* Experience managing a large volume of customers using Digital Touch or tech-touch success strategies.
* Strong communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
* Proven ability to work cross-functionally in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
* Tech-savvy and quick to learn new software platforms; experience with CRM and CS tools a plus (e.g. Salesforce or Gainsight).
  


**Bonus points for:**


* Experience supporting or working with accounting and finance professionals; ideally with a background in accounting (degree or practical experience as an accountant)


At our core, Trintechers stand committed to fostering a culture rooted in our core values – Humble, Empowered, Reliable, and Open. Together, these values guide our actions, define our identity, and inspire us to continuously strive for excellence in everything we do.


*Should you require (or need) accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please provide your requirements to* *recruiting@trintech.com* *and we will work with you to accommodate your needs.*


*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.*

title: Network Technician NSXT
description:
Har du goda kunskaper inom nätverksvirtualisering från Cisco och VMware? Vill du använda din kompetens för att göra skillnad för framtidens nätverksinfrastruktur?


Jag heter Greg Szuh och jag ansvarar för grupperingen Managed Network. Här har vi samlat tekniska specialister, arkitekter och tjänsteägare för området nätverk och vi är navet av Telia Cygates driftaffär för nätverk. Just nu söker vi en medarbetare inom Nätverk med inriktning Datacenter som har vilja och engagemang att utvecklas tillsammans med oss.  



  

**Din nästa utmaning?**

Du kommer att arbeta som Nätverkstekniker för en central grupp som jobbar med utgångspunkt från våra Datacenter-tjänster inom Managed Services.


I din roll kommer du arbeta operativt med lösningar med fokus på våra datacenter innefattande uppgifter såsom drift och förvaltning, samt projekt såsom on och offboarding av kunder och tjänster. Arbetsmoment såsom konfiguration, uppsättning och felsökning av underlay/overlay-tekniker (samt tillhörande säkerhetslösningar) tillhör vardagen.


Du arbetar både på egen hand och i team, och fungerar som en central kontaktpunkt inom nätverksgrupperingen mot andra avdelningar. När vi arbetar med kund spänner leveransen ofta över flera områden, såsom säkerhet, Cloud, automation, virtualisering och compute/storage. Om du på sikt vill certifiera dig inom ett eller flera områden så är det något vi stödjer.


**Vem är du?**

Som person motiveras du av att leverera kvalitet till våra slutkunder och kommer särskilt till din rätt när du får utmana med nya tankar och idéer. Du involverar och håller kunder som kollegor informerade genom att kommunicera på ett tydligt och enkelt sätt, och söker aktivt feedback för att förbättra ditt arbete och vår leverans.


**Din erfarenhet:**

* troligtvis 5 år eller mer arbetslivserfarenhet inom nätverk/säkerhet.
* troligtvis Cisco-certifiering på Professional-nivå eller har motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Mycket goda kunskaper och förståelse för multitenant-lösningar inom nät- och serverdrift
* Mycket goda kunskaper virtualisering inom VMware (NSX-T) och vCloud Director.
* Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska
* Arbetat enligt ITIL-ramverk

**Extra meriterande är om arbetat med något av nedanstående:**

* God kunskap kring VXLAN
* God kunskap kring Fortinet brandväggar
* Erfarenhet med automation via Ansible mfl.

**Home of Experts**  

Telia Cygate har länge varit kända som en IT-partner som har nätverk och säkerhet i sitt DNA. Sedan 2006 är vi en del av Telia Company, vilket ger oss en stabil grund att stå på för att hjälpa våra kunder att utforska möjligheterna med digitalisering och molntjänster på ett tryggt sätt.


Men det handlar inte bara om vad vi gör, utan minst lika mycket om hur vi gör det: Med ett leende och alltid med kundens bästa för ögonen. Vi tar med oss kompetens och glädje till alla möten, för vi vet att det är idéerna och mångfalden som bidrar till de mest hållbara lösningarna. Tillsammans gör vi det enkelt och roligt att vara människa i teknikens värld.


**Intresserad?**  

Vi lovar att du kommer att börja en spännande resa hos oss samtidigt som du har mycket roligt på vägen. Placeringsort är flexibelt. Om du har några frågor så får du gärna kontakta mig Greg Szuh på 072–7266534 eller gergely.szuh@cygate.se eller på Linkedin.


Bakgrundskontroller är en del av vår rekryteringsprocess.


Du behöver ha svenskt medborgarskap.
  

  

**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of your next big opportunity!**
company_addresses:
Telia Company
Mall of Scandinavia
Solna
Stockholm
Sverige

title: Doktorand i cyberfysiska system
description:
*Luleå tekniska universitet är i stark tillväxt med världsledande kompetens inom flera forskningsområden. Vi formar framtiden genom nydanande utbildningar och banbrytande forskningsresultat, och med utgångspunkt i den arktiska regionen skapar vi global samhällsnytta. Vår vetenskapliga som konstnärliga forskning och utbildning bedrivs i nära samarbete med internationella, nationella och regionala företag, offentliga aktörer och ledande universitet. Luleå tekniska universitet omsätter totalt närmare 2,1 miljarder kronor per år. Vi är idag 1 900 anställda och har 18 700 studenter.*  

  

*De kommande åren investeras mångmiljardbelopp i Norrbotten och Västerbotten i stora projekt som syftar till ett mer hållbart samhälle nationellt så väl som globalt. Luleå tekniska universitet är involverat i flera av dessa högaktuella forskningsprojekt och den samhällsomvandling som följer. Vi har ett brett utbud av utbildningar för att matcha den kompetens som efterfrågas. Vi hoppas att du vill hjälpa oss att bygga framtidens hållbara företag och samhällen.*


Avdelningen EISLAB vid Institutionen för datavetenskap, elektroteknik och rymdteknik bedriver forskning inom cyber-fysiska system, sakernas internet, automatisering av system av system, maskininlärning, djupinlärning, data science, elektroniksystemdesign och sensorsystem.  

Cyber-fysiska system (CPS) fokuserar på integrerade programvaru- och applikationsarkitekturer med implementationer av massivt distribuerade inbyggda system som samverkar med varandra och sina omgivningar för att möjliggöra säkra, målmedvetna, autonoma och utvecklingsbara lösningar. Det inkluderar mjukvarudefinierade system av system för automatisering och digitalisering inom produktionsindustrier. Vår forskning bedrivs i nära samarbete med företag som Bosch, Ericsson, Volvo, Infineon, Boliden, LKAB, SKF och ledande internationella universitet. Ett stort resultat är Eclipse Arrowhead, ett öppet källkodsramverk för industriell automation som stöds av europeisk industri.  

  

**Ämnesbeskrivning**  

Cyberfysiska system omfattar integrerad mjukvara, elektronikhårdvara och applikationsarkitektur inom uppkopplade enheter och distribuerade system. Forskningen syftar till att skapa säkra, autonoma och utvecklingsbara lösningar som interagerar med varandra och sin omgivning, från kant till moln.  

  

**Projektbeskrivning**  

Du kommer initialt att arbeta som en del av ett team av forskare inom det europeiska projektet. Du kommer att arbeta inom några av följande områden:
  

* Cybersäkerhet och arkitekturdesign.
* Industriell SoS-säkerhet, inklusive säkerhetsriskanalys.
* Testning för säkerhet samt analys och implementering av säkerhetsåtgärder.

-Åtkomst- och användningskontroll för säker datadelning i industriella ekosystem.
  

* Virtualization i cloud-to-edge-continuumet för flexibla och anpassningsbara distribuerade system.


  

Projektet syftar till att ytterligare digitalisera den europeiska industrin där EISLAB kommer att ansvara för CPS-intelligens, IoT och SoS-automatiseringsarkitektur samt användningen av AI och maskininlärning (ML). Målet är att producera vetenskapliga artiklar och bidrag med öppen källkod för Eclipse Arrowhead.  

Projekten innebär vanligtvis samarbete med både akademiska och industriella partners i Europa. Därför är samarbete med programvaru- och automationsindustrin - både som framtida produktägare och användare - en nyckelfaktor för framgången för dessa projekt. I detta kommer du att arbeta nära andra forskare och doktorander vid Luleå tekniska universitet.  

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**  

Som doktorand arbetar du mot en doktorsexamen som det slutliga målet. Arbetet kommer att ta upp målen enligt högskoleförordningen. Största delen av din tid kommer att ägnas åt att arbeta med forskningsprojekt där du kommer att utveckla proof-of-concept för att experimentellt utvärdera och utforska aspekter av industriella mjukvarusystem och komponenter. Du kommer att presentera dina resultat på internationella konferenser och i vetenskapliga tidskrifter.  

För att stödja ditt avhandlingsarbete kommer du att ta kurser som en del av doktorandstudierna, generiska kurser för LTU:s doktorandprogram, särskilt utformade kurser osv. Din forskning och dina kurser kommer att planeras och dokumenteras i din individuella studieplan under hela din studietid. Dessutom bedrivs undervisning och annan institutionstjänstgöring vid avdelningen eller institutionen av doktorander.  

  

**Kvalifikationer**  

Vi söker dig - en talangfull, analytisk och motiverad kollega som både ensam och i samarbete med andra kan utföra avancerad forskning i vår forskningsgrupp. Den nödvändiga bakgrunden för sökande är en masterexamen i datavetenskap eller motsvarande. Även examen i elektroteknik, teknisk fysik eller liknande kommer att beaktas.  

Sökanden måste vara kunnig inom datavetenskap. Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med SOA, IoT, SysML, ML, CPS och/eller SoS är värdefullt men inte ett krav. Sökanden måste också ha goda programmeringskunskaper, inklusive mjukvarudesign, grundläggande programmeringskoncept samt erfarenhet av Java-programmering eller liknande. Flytande kunskaper i muntlig och skriftlig kommunikation på engelska är ett krav.  

  

För ytterligare information om specifik doktorandutbildning se  

studieplaner för forskarutbildning inom teknisk fakultet  

  

**Information**  

Anställning som doktorand är begränsad till 4 år, med möjlighet till förlängning om högst ett år för undervisning och annan institutionstjänstgöring. Plats: Luleå. Start: Hösten 2025.  

  

För ytterligare information om tjänsten, kontakta Dr. Shailesh Singh Chouhan, 0920-49 2165 shailesh.chouhan@ltu.se  

  

Fackliga företrädare:  

SACO-S Diana Chroneer 0920-49 2037 diana.chroneer@ltu.se  

OFR-S Marika Vesterberg, 0920-49 1721 marika.vesterberg@ltu.se  

  

**Ansökan**  

Vi föredrar att du ansöker om denna position genom att klicka på ansökningsknappen nedan. Ansökan bör inkludera CV, personligt brev och kopior av verifierade examensbevis från gymnasiet och universitetet. Märk din ansökan med referensnumret ovan. Din ansökan, inklusive examensbevis, måste vara skriven på engelska eller svenska.  

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 15 juni 2025  

**Referensnummer:** 2126-2025

title: Senior Systems Engineer/System Architect
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Do you have a passion for wireless communication?



Would you prefer a world where everything was connected?



Do you want to take the Internet of Things from a buzzword to reality?



You now have the chance to work at a Swedish IoT specialist with some



of the most interesting IoT and wireless projects around.



We are looking to strengthen our Systems Engineering team with a senior person that brings experience, energy and drive. You will be part of our systems engineering team where we develop complete system designs for our customer projects. Our work focuses on gathering/documenting systems requirements and the development of a system architecture that meets those requirements.



We set the system topology and functional split between system nodes (e.g., device/gate way/cloud) and we define the HW and SW architecture of the various system nodes. Our work involves wired and wireless connectivity, ACPU/MCU selection, sensors, power management, Cameras and image processing and Audio systems and more. We develop systems with edge AI as well as ML in the back end.



A typical project can be anything from a connected wearable device with sensors to large drones flying at the speed of Mach 1.



As Sigma Connectivity WSI is a design house, we work mostly with projects that are developed in-house. In other words, most of the work is undertaken in our office in Kista where you have access to labs and the full knowledge of the team. We also have access to the competence and labs in our Lund office.



Some examples of work would be:


* Together with the customer set the System Requirements for the product/system.
* Develop system architecture to meet those system requirements
* Define performance requirements on AI-accelerators, CPU/DSP etc,
* Select key components (MCU/CPU, Radio transceivers, AI-accelerator, sensors etc.
* Define requirements for components to be selected during the development (Camera modules, microphones, Speakers, actuators etc).
* Calculate power budget and select suitable battery capacity and technology for the application.
* More…


We are a team of system architects, continuously advancing our skills and knowledge. We learn from each other, but we also constantly educate ourselves from training, media, literature, vendors and of course from our customers. We are curious and eager to learn more about more.



**About Sigma Connectivity WSI**



Sigma Connectivity WSI – supports companies in developing and industrializing their products within Internet of Things and advanced radio.



Since 2002 we have been making things Wireless by WSI™.



The team has long experience of delivering complex projects and mobile products. We provide a flexible resource that takes a product from idea to volume production. Our experienced in-house team ensures quality every step of the way. Since autumn 2020, we are owned by and a part of the Sigma Connectivity Group, a global tech house with its headquarters in Lund, Sweden.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



**Must have:**



* Master of Science degree or equivalent experience
* At least 5 years’ experience from working in the tech business.
* Experience in doing system design
* An understanding of system partitioning and how to judge what function to place where.
* Solid understanding of MCUs/CPUs and other processing devices such as co-processors
* Good understanding of various RF-protocols such as BT/BLE, WLAN, Thread and an understanding of different topologies (Point-to-Point, Point-to-multi-point, mech…).
* Experience from HW and/or SW development.
* An understanding of Cyber Security and how to mitigate various risks.
* You are verbal and like to meet customers.
* You are a team player, but you can also work independently with support from the team.
* You need to be curious!


**Good to have:**



Experience in the following areas:


* Experience in cellular connectivity such as LTE and 5G.
* Experience in Computer Vision and AI based Audio processing.
* Cameras and Vision systems
* Audio systems
* Thermal simulation
* Regulatory compliance

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



This is you


You are curious about different technologies and are always striving to learn more.



You think in “systems” rather than of “devices”.



You can take ownership and work independently and at the same time being a team member, coach, and grow people around you.



As a systems architect you set the direction for the rest of the development team.



You are flexible and can change direction in case new requirements appear or requirements are changed.



You are fluent in English, written and spoken.



You have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in engineering. Alternatively, you have gained



similar knowledge from work experience, in the fields of embedded systems,



electronics, or systems design.



We put great emphasis on your attitude and eagerness to learn!


### **WE OFFER**


* An international working environment
* Opportunity to develop cutting edge technology for market leaders and some of the most demanding customers
* Extensive hardware and software knowledge and all the equipment to build and test complete products and solutions
* Working on a project basis, promoting competence development
* Being part of a wonderful and experienced team where you will never work alone.
* The Sigma Connectivity company culture.


Sigma Connectivity WSI is a unique consultant company offering:


* Focus on connectivity, and the possibility to work for some of the most demanding connectivity customers available with highly motivated and skilled developers and testers in the team.
* Access to cutting-edge technology through our close cooperation with component vendors, platform vendors and 3rd party companies.
* A culture based on sharing experiences and knowledge. We will encourage you to develop and grow your competence and skills with new challenges.
* Many great colleagues, passionate about all the cool devices we build, all being inventors committed to having fun while getting things done.
* An environment with systems, hardware and software knowledge as well as all the equipment to build and test complete products in-house.
* Team activities with WSI colleagues,
* An including culture, where we support each other. By joining the Sigma Connectivity WSI family you will indeed never be alone!

We work both with a tech-house service executing the customers’ assignments in-house, as well as an engineering service where our work resides in the customer's location. Our experienced team ensures quality every step of the way.



This position concerns the tech-house, where we work mostly with projects that are developed in-house. In other words, work is undertaken in our office in Kista where you have access to the full knowledge of the team.


### **MORE INFORMATION**



For more information please contact



Lars Wattsgård,

title: Project / Production Manager
description:
**PROJEKT- / PRODUKTIONSLEDARE** 

Är du redo för en dynamisk roll där kreativitet möter struktur – där varje dag bjuder på nya utmaningar, möjligheter och framgångar?

Hos Adentity kommer du att arbeta med utmanande och spännande internationella kunder och globala varumärken i en kreativ och inspirerande arbetsmiljö. Tillsammans med Account Manager planerar och implementerar du projekt – från strategi och koncept till produktion av element i olika medier – med kreativitet och flexibilitet.

Du har en stark passion för marknadsföring, kommunikation och reklam med en naturlig talang för att driva projekt och få alla detaljer att fungera, från planering och produktion till leverans. Du är lösningsorienterad och älskar nya utmaningar. Du är van att ha externa kontakter, även internationella och behärskar engelska såväl som svenska skriftligt och muntligt. Du håller alltid en hög servicenivå samtidigt som du levererar hög kvalitet inom givna deadlines. Du är strukturerad, arbetar systematiskt och gillar att följa upp och utvärdera dina projekt. Du har stort intresse för teknik och förståelse för de digitala kanalerna. Du tycker om att arbeta i team, är prestigelös och är intresserad av trender, nätverkande och social media. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av att göra research och skriva content på engelska är det mycket meriterande då tjänsten även innebär att skapa inspirerande texter på ett enkelt och begripligt sätt.

I ditt dagliga arbete kommer du att ägna dig åt tidsplanering, offerera, fakturering, kundkontakter, kontakt samt förhandling med leverantörer och andra administrativa uppgifter inkl. kontorsansvarig. Du kommer också att planera och prioritera interna och externa produktionsresurser, skapa briefer, ansvara för kampanjer samt säkerställa korrekturprocesser och språkhantering. Du kommer även att arbeta med affärsutveckling tillsammans med Account Manager och skapa skriftligt content för olika kunder och element, både online och offline.

**Erfarenhet:**

* Universitetsexamen inom produktionsledning, ekonomi, media & kommunikation, samhällsvetenskap eller liknande
* 1-2 års arbetslivserfarenhet (marknadsavdelning, reklambyrå eller liknande)

**Önskvärda egenskaper**

* Erfarenhet av produktionsledning – både digitala medier och traditionellt tryck
* Content skrivande på engelska
* God social och kommunikativ förmåga
* Bra processledningskompetens och drivande personlighet
* Noggrann med ett öga för detaljer
* Kvalitetsmedveten
* God förmåga att arbeta i team
* Stresstålig och inga problem att arbeta med tighta deadlines
* Kunskap om digitala kanaler och social media
* Ett internationellt fokus, studerat eller bott utomlands samt meriterande med erfarenhet av internationella storbolag
* Hög standard gällande kvalitetsstyrning i den kreativa produktionen
* Kunskaper i Microsoft Office samt gärna Adobe Creative Cloud
* Ekonomisk och administrativ kompetens
* Flytande i tal och skrift gällande svenska och engelska.
* Körkort

**Skicka in ett personligt brev och ditt CV till apply@adentity.se senast den 20 Maj 2025. Vi kommer att ha ett löpande urval.**

**För mer information om tjänsten kontakta Märta Söderberg på 040-608 25 30 eller marta.soderberg@adentity.se**

Förväntad arbetstid: 30 per vecka
