* Set and execute the technical vision, aligning with business goals.
* Lead platform development, architecture, and integrations.
* Build and mentor a high-performing engineering team.
* Drive innovation in automation, scalability, and user experience.

 Should you find this opportunity compelling and believe your qualifications align with the position, we invite you to kindly forward your resume. Alternatively, you may choose to establish contact with me through LinkedIn or by email at amber.jones@select-tech.co.uk

title: Physical Security Architect
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Construction
description:
**About the company** 




  





 Our client’s company operates in the data center industry, providing a range of services across the Nordics region, particularly in the construction and management of data centers. They specialize in delivering tailored solutions, including infrastructure development, engineering, and operational support, to meet the growing demands of the data center market in Northern Europe.
 



 We are looking for a full-time, experienced Physical Security Architect for one of their group companies, which specializes in developing a new product—an innovative security system for data centers. This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



 This individual will play a key role from pre-sales engagements to solution design, system installation, and technical support throughout the lifecycle of our physical security systems.
 



 The ideal candidates will have a strong background in designing and implementing advanced security systems, with experience in technical sales, solution design, and hands-on installation. Their involvement will begin at the concept phase, working closely with the client, internal teams, and external partners to ensure fully integrated and robust solutions.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 




  




* Design and plan comprehensive physical security systems, including access control, surveillance, perimeter protection, and biometric identification.
* Work with stakeholders to develop technical architecture, ensuring alignment with industry standards and client requirements.
* Engage in technical sales support by understanding client needs and translating them into tailored security solutions.
* Prepare and deliver system schematics, layouts, and designs using CAD software or similar tools.
* Lead or support installation and commissioning of systems, ensuring functionality and client satisfaction.
* Collaborate across sales, engineering, and project teams from initial bid to project delivery.
* Stay up to date with emerging technologies and provide insights on how innovations (e.g., AI, drones, Lidar) can enhance our security ecosystem.



  





**Job requirements** 




  




* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in one of the following fields (or equivalent experience): Electrical Engineering, Security Technology, Systems Engineering, Computer Science, Telecommunications, Engineering Technology with a focus on Security Systems
* Proven hands-on experience in the design and installation of physical security systems
* Familiarity with one or more of the following: Milestone, Lenel, Axis, Bosch, Dormakaba, Morpho, Biometric Systems, Lidar, AI-based surveillance, Drones
* Experience configuring systems is a plus, but design and implementation experience is essential
* Proficiency with CAD tools or similar design software for security layouts and system architecture.
* Strong client-facing and communication skills with the ability to support sales and business development.



  





**Offer** 




  




* A competitive salary, pension plan
* A good remuneration package
* Opportunities for professional development within the fast-growing datacenter industry
* The opportunity to work with Europe’s largest datacenters construction, setting new industry benchmarks

title: Security Engineer
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the team** 




 As part of fulfilling the objective of becoming the leading global online banking payments provider, we are strengthening our capability in the information and cyber security area. Currently, we are restructuring our internal setup within the security area allowing us to scale and grow our teams.
 



  





 To get us going we are now looking for additional Security Engineers to join the Security and Compliance team focusing on our product security in Europe.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As a Security Engineer at Trustly, you will be part of a team of security professionals ensuring security lies in the core of everything we build and operate. We combine our expertise in providing security services to the organization with automating security controls wherever and whenever possible.
 



  





 As our team is undergoing an expansive phase, you will have the opportunity to shape our direction and methodologies. Your contributions will be important in refining our interactions with merchants, allowing you to leave a large impact on our operational security framework.
 




  




**What you’ll do** 
* Ensure our vulnerability management program maintains coverage of all applicable assets, by building automation that makes sure our tools are up to date and supports our teams to keep our software secure
* Perform security assessments and provide security guidance of the product we build through design reviews, code reviews as well as performing dynamic testing, working closely with the development teams
* Research and implement security controls on top of the CI/CD pipeline
* Design and execute internal penetration testing activities
* Compromise our hosts and data with exploitation of vulnerabilities to assess actual risks involved and understand what controls that failed to protect
* Proactively gather threat intelligence and build tools that enable us to identify and act on external threats efficiently and intelligently



  




**Who you are** 
* You have spent a few years in the area of cyber security doing hands-on technical security work
* Detailed technical knowledge of techniques, standards and state-of-the art capabilities for authentication and authorisation, applied cryptography, security vulnerabilities and remediation
* DNS, TLS, X.509, CVEs and SOAR/SIEM systems are no strangers to you
* Experience from hands-on technical security assessments such as penetration tests, web application tests, code reviews etc
* Passionate about working with application developers in "shifting left", introducing security controls early on in the development process
* Any security certification (e.g. OSCP, OSWE or similar)
* Bachelor/Masters/PhD degree in Computer Science or Cybersecurity is considered a plus






  




  


**Our Fantastic Benefits**




 🌴
 **20 to 30 days of holiday** 
 (depending on location) to support a healthy work-life balance
 



 🥳
 **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
 



 👶
 **Parental leave top-up** 
 additional support for new parents
 



 🥐
 **Daily breakfast and on-site perks** 
 to make your workday smoother
 



 💚
 **Well being support** 
 our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best
 



**PLUS** 
 additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!
 



  





**Shape Your Role and Make an Impact**




 Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.
 



 If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!
 **Apply now and submit your CV in English.**

title: Data Engineer
description:

 Yes

 If you are interested and matching your CV, Kindly apply asap.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
Trintech is a multi-award winning cloud-based Fintech provider and we're seeking a Customer Success Manager to join our dynamic EMEA team! As a CSM you will be responsible for driving adoption, satisfaction, and retention across a portfolio of customers using our Adra solutions. You will leverage both high-touch and digital engagement strategies to manage a broad book of business efficiently, while partnering cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Support, and Professional Services to deliver value at scale.
   

  

 This is a hybrid role, requiring 3 days per week in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Own the customer relationship for a large portfolio of Adra users across Norway and the Nordics.
* Serve as the primary point of contact throughout the post-sale customer lifecycle, ensuring successful onboarding, adoption, renewal, and expansion. Develop and execute Digital Touch engagement strategies for scalable support and value delivery.
* Act as a trusted advisor by understanding each customer’s business goals, challenges, and how Adra solutions support their financial operations.
* Monitor customer health metrics and proactively mitigate risk while identifying upsell or cross-sell opportunities.
* Collaborate with Product, Support, Sales, and Professional Services teams to improve the customer experience and advocate for customer needs internally. Deliver virtual or in-person training, product walk-throughs, and success planning sessions.
* Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, feedback, and activity in CRM systems.
* Contribute to customer education content and playbooks to support the broader customer base.


**Who You Are**
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
* 2 years of experience as a Customer Success Manager or similar customer-facing role in a SaaS business.
* Experience managing a large volume of customers using Digital Touch or tech-touch success strategies.
* Strong communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
* Proven ability to work cross-functionally in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
* Tech-savvy and quick to learn new software platforms; experience with CRM and CS tools a plus (e.g. Salesforce or Gainsight).


**Bonus points for:**
* Experience supporting or working with accounting and finance professionals; ideally with a background in accounting (degree or practical experience as an accountant)


 At our core, Trintechers stand committed to fostering a culture rooted in our core values – Humble, Empowered, Reliable, and Open. Together, these values guide our actions, define our identity, and inspire us to continuously strive for excellence in everything we do.
   

  

*Should you require (or need) accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please provide your requirements to recruiting@trintech.com and we will work with you to accommodate your needs.*
*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.*

title: Global Solutions Architect
description:
**Description**
 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for experienced and motivated technologists who possess a unique balance of technical depth and strong interpersonal skills. You will partner some of the worlds largest Automotive and Manufacturing companies, to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient cloud architectures that address customer business problems and accelerate the adoption of AWS services. In collaboration with account managers, you will assist in driving growth across a set of global customers in your defined country. As a trusted customer advocate, the solutions architect will help organizations understand best practices around advanced cloud-based solutions, and how to migrate existing workloads to the cloud. You will have the opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build mind share and broad use of AWS within enterprise customers. The ability to connect technology with measurable business value is critical to a solutions architect. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges.
   

  

**Here Are Some Other Qualities We Are Looking For**
 Be great fun to work with.
   

  

 At AWS, we have a credo of “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. In this role, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge and make a big impact.
   

  

 Enjoy working with large, global customers. You will have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building cloud solutions for a diverse and challenging set of enterprise customers.
   

  

 Have a strong understanding of large scale computing solutions. The ideal candidate will have past experience working as a systems or support engineer. You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones, so you can make strong contributions to deep architecture discussions. You will regularly take part in deep-dive education and design exercises to create world-class solutions built on AWS.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an AWS Solutions Architect, you will have ownership of the technical relationship with customers, making recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability, operational efficiency and best-practice architectures.
   

  

 Internally, you will be an advocate acting on behalf of the customer to help drive continual improvements to the AWS platform, sharing their needs and wants to inform the roadmap of AWS features and services. You will also help shape the future of the Solutions Architecture organisation by helping to hire, coach and mentor others.
   

  

 In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to define or invent cloud-native reference architectures with the worldwide AWS Solutions Architect community. You will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelise and educate about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
   

  

 If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while inspiring the impossible, come build the future with us.
   

  

**About The Team**
 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics).
* Experience in design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures
* Experience in IT development or implementation/consulting in the software or Internet industries


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience working within software development or Internet-related industries
* Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud
* Experience working with AWS technologies from a dev/ops perspective
* Experience with Automotive software development
* Experience in technology/software sales, pre-sales, or consulting
* Excellent command of the Swedish language in both written and verbal forms is highly desired


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Director of Strategic Accounts
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As the
 **Director of Strategic Accounts** 
 , you will be responsible for driving the success, growth, and retention of our largest and most strategic clients within the EMEA as well as Globally. Your role will be pivotal in shaping client strategies, deepening relationships, and maximizing account potential. By leading cross-functional efforts and aligning internal teams with client needs, you will ensure long-term partnerships that fuel both client success and Mentimeter’s growth.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Strategic Account Management**
* Develop and execute tailored account strategies to drive growth, retention, and customer success across key accounts in the EMEA region.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for strategic accounts, ensuring a seamless client experience and addressing high-level needs.


**Client Growth & Retention**
* Drive our customer engagement models to ensure deep customer value and success.
* Identify opportunities for expansion within existing accounts, driving cross-selling and upselling initiatives.
* Foster deep client relationships to ensure long-term partnerships and maintain high customer satisfaction.


**Team Leadership & Collaboration**
* Leading Leaders in terms of our Sales Managers
* Lead our retention & growth teams (Relationship Managers, CSMs & Growth Executives) providing guidance, mentorship, and support to ensure high performance and client focus.
* Collaborate closely with Sales, Product, and Marketing teams to align on client strategies, product roadmaps, and feedback loops.


**Performance & Metrics Management**
* Monitor account performance and client success metrics, using data-driven insights to refine strategies and drive results.
* Provide regular reports and updates to senior leadership on account health, growth opportunities, and potential risks.


**Market Analysis & Strategic Input**
* Analyze market trends, customer needs, and competitive positioning in the EMEA region to identify growth opportunities.
* Serve as a thought leader by representing Mentimeter at key industry events, conferences, and client engagements.


**Contract Management & Negotiation**
* Lead contract renewal negotiations and manage terms that align with both client needs and company objectives.
* Ensure account strategies are aligned with legal, compliance, and financial considerations.


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years experience in selling towards the Enterprise. Handling complex sales & buying processes with the largest companies in the world.
* 5+ years of experience in strategic account management and leadership roles within the SaaS industry.
* Proven success in driving growth and retention across enterprise-level accounts.
* Strong knowledge of Value based selling and frameworks like MEDDPICC etc
* Strong background in leading and developing high-performing teams.
* Excellent relationship-building skills with the ability to engage at all organizational levels.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to leverage data to inform strategic decisions.
* Strong communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.
* Fluent in English (German is a plus)


**What This Role Offers**
* The opportunity to lead and shape strategic account initiatives in one of Europe’s most dynamic SaaS companies.
* A collaborative, forward-thinking culture focused on innovation and long-term success.
* Continuous professional development opportunities in a fast-paced, scale-up environment.
* A competitive compensation and benefits package tailored to your success and growth.


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Network Technician
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Har du goda kunskaper inom nätverks- & brandväggslösningar från Cisco, Fortinet och/eller Aruba? Vill du använda din kompetens för att göra skillnad för framtidens nätverksinfrastruktur?
   

  

 Jag heter Greg Szuh och jag ansvarar för grupperingen Managed Network. Här har vi samlat tekniska specialister, arkitekter och tjänsteägare för området nätverk och vi är navet av Telia Cygates driftaffär för nätverk. Just nu söker vi en medarbetare inom Nätverk/Säkerhet som har vilja och engagemang att utvecklas tillsammans med oss.
   

  

**Din nästa utmaning?**
 Du kommer att arbeta som Nätverkstekniker för en central grupp som jobbar med utgångspunkt från våra central levererade tjänster inom Managed services.
   

  

 I din roll kommer du arbeta operativt med lösningar med fokus på normal drift och förvaltning, samt projekt såsom on och offboarding av kunder och tjänster. Arbetsmoment såsom konfiguration, uppsättning och felsökning av olika nätverkslösningar (samt tillhörande säkerhetslösningar) tillhör vardagen.
   

  

 Du arbetar både på egen hand och i team, och fungerar som en central kontaktpunkt inom nätverksgrupperingen mot andra avdelningar. När vi arbetar med kund spänner leveransen ofta över flera tjänsteområden, såsom säkerhet, Cloud, automation, virtualisering och compute/storage. Om du på sikt vill certifiera dig inom ett eller flera områden så är det något vi stödjer.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Som person motiveras du av att arbeta nära tekniken och kommer särskilt till din rätt när du får utmana med nya tankar och idéer. Du involverar och håller kunder som kollegor informerade genom att kommunicera på ett tydligt och enkelt sätt, och söker aktivt feedback för att förbättra ditt arbete och vår leverans.
   

  

**Din erfarenhet:**
* Du har troligtvis 5 år eller mer arbetslivserfarenhet inom nätverk/säkerhet.
* Du innehar troligtvis Cisco-certifiering på Professional-nivå eller har motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Mycket goda kunskaper inom nät- och nätsäkerhets produkter/tjänster inom enterprisemiljöer, såsom routing/switching, brandväggar.
* Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska
* Arbetat enligt ITIL-ramverk
* Rollen kräver svenskt medborgarskap


**Extra meriterande är om arbetat med något av nedanstående:**
* God kunskap kring nätverkssegmentering och dot1x
* God kunskap kring Cisco FTD/FMC
* God kunskap kring NSX-T


**Home of Experts**
 Telia Cygate har länge varit kända som en IT-partner som har nätverk och säkerhet i sitt DNA. Sedan 2006 är vi en del av Telia Company, vilket ger oss en stabil grund att stå på för att hjälpa våra kunder att utforska möjligheterna med digitalisering och molntjänster på ett tryggt sätt.
   

  

 Men det handlar inte bara om vad vi gör, utan minst lika mycket om hur vi gör det: Med ett leende och alltid med kundens bästa för ögonen. Vi tar med oss kompetens och glädje till alla möten, för vi vet att det är idéerna och mångfalden som bidrar till de mest hållbara lösningarna. Tillsammans gör vi det enkelt och roligt att vara människa i teknikens värld.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Vi lovar att du kommer att börja en spännande resa hos oss samtidigt som du har mycket roligt på vägen. Placeringsort är flexibelt. Om du har några frågor så får du gärna kontakta mig Greg Szuh på 072–7266534 eller gergely.szuh@cygate.se eller på Linkedin.
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroller är en del av vår rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of your next big opportunity!**

title: Data Scientist - Subscription Data Enablement
description:
**Are you our new Data Scientist?**
 Subscription Data Enablement is a team in Schibsted Media, Subscription - Growth. The team has a focus on building first-class commercial data capabilities, democratizing data & insight and building AI/ML models to create personalized commercial experiences for subscribers on all brands. With a focus on data-driven decision making, we want to drive engagement and increase loyalty within our customer base. You will be a part of a team that consists of Analysts, Data Engineers, and Data Scientists who are constantly driving value with data.
   

  

 Your responsibilities :
   

  

* Use advanced analytics, statistics, and machine learning to extract insights from structured and unstructured data in order to understand commercial performance and subscriber loyalty
* Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models to address business challenges such as personalization, prediction, next best action and offer models and optimization
* Build and maintain end-to-end ML pipelines, including data preprocessing, feature engineering, model-training and evaluation
* Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate key insights effectively, ensuring that data-driven storytelling supports decision-making across commercial teams.
* Collaborate with commercial teams in growth and customer base management to ensure that models and insights are used effectively for decision making and personalisation of customer the customer lifecycle
* Work in cross functional teams to deploy and optimize commercial AI models to improve commercial effects and automate processes related to digital sales and customer communication driving engagement and reducing churn
* Work with ML and data engineers to build scalable and efficient data pipelines for model training and data processing


**What's in it for you**
 In return, Subscriptions can offer you a hybrid, informal, and extremely pleasant working environment in one of the most exciting and forward-looking companies in the Nordic region. You will be a part of one of the biggest data communities in Norway & Sweden, which values the importance of knowledge sharing and has a strong focus on personal development. As part of Schibsted Media, you will also receive competitive employee terms and benefits as well as good career opportunities within the Schibsted Group.
   

  

**About Schibsted Media**
 Schibsted Media is one of the leading digital media companies in the Nordics. Our publications are renowned for their exceptional journalism, high editorial independence and strong digital development. Our brands, such as VG, Aftonbladet, Aftenposten, Bergens Tidende, Svenska Dagbladet, E24 and Omni keep people informed and updated on important issues in society. In addition we have several digital niche products like Podme, Wellobe, Vektklubb, Fri Flyt and Klart. In total, our brands have over 700 million monthly visits. News Media had a revenue of 7,8 bn NOK and 2,700 employees in 2024.
   

  

 Subscription is a new business unit in Schibsted Media that holds the ownership of all development and commercial revenue connected to subscription business. This includes end to end responsibility for the subscription products, customer journeys, commercial personalisation and subscription platform development, in addition to responsibility for user revenue growth in Schibsted Media by ensuring capitalization of our end users. We operate in Norway, Sweden and Finland and work closely with Schibsted Media Technology and editorial teams.
   

  

 Please apply for this position by sharing your application and CV with us.
   

  

 Work location: Oslo or Stockholm (hybrid)
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
 We are looking for a Data Scientist who thrives on using data to drive decision-making, automation, and analytics. You enjoy uncovering insights, building reports, and telling compelling data stories that influence business strategy. In addition to working on customer analytics, you will contribute to our AI model foundation and infrastructure, helping to scale and operationalize AI solutions across our brands for personalisation and automation. If you're passionate about leveraging data to create impact and enjoy working in a collaborative, commercial-driven environment, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

 The role is an excellent match if the following describes you:
   

  

* Proficiency in Python, R, or similar languages for data analysis and ML
* Expertise in machine learning/AI frameworks, applied ML and advanced analytical techniques
* Strong SQL skills for querying, cleaning, and transforming large datasets in platforms like Snowflake
* Deep understanding of statistical methods, hypothesis testing, and experimental design
* Experience with analytics tools like Tableau/PowerBI and cloud ecosystems for data storage, model deployment, and orchestration
* Strong analytical and business acumen, coupled with problem-solving skills and a results-driven mindset.

title: Disaster Recovery Solution Architect
description:
We are looking for a
 **Disaster Recovery Solution Architect.** 




  





  





 As a Disaster Recovery Solution Architect, you will play a pivotal role both within the core IT Infrastructure team and in a collaborative virtual team with other colleagues across the organization. You will be crucial in advancing our disaster recovery capabilities, ensuring our critical systems are resilient, recoverable, and aligned with business continuity strategies.
 



  





 We highly value a robust understanding of both business needs and technical resilience. You should be technically skilled, proactive in planning for the unexpected, and an excellent communicator of complex technical ideas. English skills are essential, and proficiency in Swedish is a plus.
 



  





**You should apply if:** 




  




* You are passionate about designing scalable, resilient, and secure disaster recovery solutions that align with business requirements and industry best practices.



  




* You possess a solid understanding of principles and technologies involved in creating DR strategies for both cloud services (AWS, Azure) and on-premises infrastructure.



  




* You are adept at making critical decisions under pressure and know how to engage necessary stakeholders to ensure alignment and transparency.



  




* You excel at conducting risk assessments, developing recovery strategies, and implementing robust, tested DR solutions.



  




* Collaboration is one of your strengths; you thrive working with cross-functional teams - including Infrastructure, Cloud, Security, and Application teams - to design and validate recovery plans.



  




* You are dedicated to conducting disaster recovery testing, failover simulations, and continuous improvement to safeguard the organization against downtime and data loss.



  




* You have several years of experience in infrastructure architecture including hybrid cloud backup environments.



  




* You have experience of technologies for concepts of Immutable backups, Ransomware safe backups and S3 hybrid backup storage.



  





 For more information, please contact Product Manager Michael Linde +358 457 3433731or HR Manager Monika Sigmark +358 40 717 8456.
 



  





 Please apply no later than 31.05.2025

title: Technician for the Cyber Security team
description:
The cyber security team at Tre, is responsible for operating and maintaining the team's systems within IT Security in Sweden and Denmark. We are essential to Tre's endeavor to consistently deliver our customers and employees the highest quality, performance, and availability.
   

  

**A Little More About The Role**
 The cyber security team is involved in many securities-related projects, always striving to find the best solutions for Tre. Much of your responsibilities will be to work on and develop our monitoring tools, our SIEM Elastic. Together with the system manager, you have an important role in further developing the tools to find, track, and analyze any security-relevant events. For example, you will code scripts to create the right conditions for us to extract valuable information from the systems. In close cooperation with other nearby teams, you ensure their logs are adapted to our log policy. We work in a private cloud, Openshift.
   

  

**You can look forward to**
* an exciting role with great opportunities to influence and contribute with your skills
* working at a company that delivers critical infrastructure where your contribution directly contributes to societal benefit
* be part of Sweden's best workplaces according to Great Place To Work and that we are a proud partner of Women in Tech and Tjejer Kodar


 ,
   

  

**Who you** 
**are**
 To thrive in the role you must have an almost nerdy interest in technology. You enjoy working with technical problems and solutions, thinking of new things, and developing new and challenging old work methods. It is natural for you to seek information and learn actively.
   

  

 To us, being driven means you take those extra steps, are curious, and are committed to taking things from start to finish. The most important thing for us is your commitment and interest in technology and your ambitious approach to learning and leading your development forward with a firm grip! As there are many contact points in Sweden and Denmark, you are communicative. You need good written and spoken English knowledge as we work in an international environment.
   

  

 To succeed, you need experience with log analysis tools, preferably the Elastic stack, but other tools are also interesting. We see it as a bonus if you are used to working with Ansible and can script in Bash or Python. You have a few years of experience in technical roles and are now ready to advance in the technical field.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
 We are accepting applications via this job ad, and interviews are ongoing. A personal letter is not required, but we would like you to answer the questions we ask in connection with your application. We use tests to ensure objective assessments in the selection of candidates. The position may be filled before the application deadline. Background checks are carried out on the final candidate.

title: Software Engineer, Storage
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 As a Software Engineer on the evroc Storage team, you will help lay the foundations of highly performant and scalable cloud storage solutions operating at mission-critical levels of availability and durability. You will be involved in all phases of the product lifecycle including design, architecture, development, deployment and maintenance.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Design, develop and maintain evroc’s cloud storage offerings including S3 object storage, block storage and shared file systems.
* Build components using first principles from the ground up to unlock optimization opportunities at every layer of the stack.
* Optimize existing cloud storage solutions for performance ensuring low latency and high throughput, high reliability and cost effectiveness.
* Work with appropriate stakeholders to determine user requirements. Leverage a variety of feedback channels to incorporate insights into future designs or solution fixes.
* Seamlessly integrate and upkeep open-source components within our evolving tech stack. Team up with fellow engineers to craft tailored solutions meeting our unique challenges.
* Lead the charge in defining and achieving our technical benchmarks.


**Skills We Value**
* Proficiency in distributed systems and Linux systems engineering.
* Coding in programming languages such as C, C++, Golang or Rust.
* Typically 5+ years of experience in building and enhancing clustered storage solutions such as Ceph, Gluster, HDFS, Lustre or MinIO or cloud storage such as AWS S3, EBS, GCP’s Blob/Block/File Storage.
* Extensive experience within the Kubernetes ecosystem developing and running highly available services. Helm, Kustomize, Knative, Rook and controller runtime knowledge is a plus.
* Deep understanding of databases, file systems and storage protocols. (Bonus) experience in Solid-State Drive (SSD)/NAND or Hard Disk Drive (HDD) based storage technologies, interfaces (e.g., NVMe, SATA/SAS), and security standards (TCG).
* Knowledge of performance tuning and optimization techniques.
* Active engagement or contributions to the open-source community.
* Collaborative, curious, and pragmatic Software Engineer who wants to be part of an innovative team.


 Please note you do not need to have experience with all of the technologies listed above to apply. If your background is in storage technologies and distributed systems, and you are passionate about building a better cloud, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
Är du en lagspelare som vill ta steget upp till landslaget? Just nu söker vi en lösningsarkitekt till Atea Sverige. Det är önskvärt om du bor nära ett av våra kontor, det kan till exempel vara
 **Malmö, Göteborg, Stockholm, Borlänge** 
**eller Umeå** 
 .
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som präglas av medarbetare som brinner för att bygga Sverige med it, medarbetare som tar personligt ansvar och sätter laget före jaget. Du kommer jobba tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor som är väldigt engagerade och beslutsamma i att tillsammans, bygga Sverige med IT!
   

  

**Din roll**
 I tjänsten som lösningsarkitekt kommer du att arbeta med många olika kunder och branscher - i Sverige och Norden. Du kommer att arbeta med hela affärsprocessen, från kvalificering till färdig tjänsteleverans. Dina arbetsuppgifter består primärt av att inspirera vårt säljteam med att använda Cloud-lösningar baserade på vår globala tjänsteportfölj och du företräder även rollen att identifiera behov och krav som utmanar vår leveransorganisation.
   

  

 Du kommer ta ram rätt lösning till våra kunder och vara ytterst ansvarig för att arkitekturen både håller kundens förväntansnivå samt levereras med kvalitet. Som verktyg har du tillgång till en bred portfölj av tjänster och en kompetent driftorganisation och du arbetar med managed services för både Public Cloud, Private Cloud och on-prem. Resor kan ingå i tjänsten.
   

  

 Du erbjuds en utvecklande roll där du arbetar tillsammans med hela Atea Sveriges sälj- och konsultorganisation och bidrar till att skapa den förflyttning mot cloud som just nu pågår på marknaden. Du lever efter Ateas värderingar och brinner för att skapa skillnad tillsammans med mer än 2 500 härliga kollegor varje dag.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Som person har du ett kundfokus i allt du gör och tar lätt till dig nya arbetsuppgifter. Du räds inte att företräda ny teknologi i oprövade sammanhang och du har en förmåga att sätta dig in i, förstå och förmedla kundvärdet. Du är ansvarstagande och drivs av att få saker gjorda och du trivs med att stå på scen och förmedla vårt budskap.
   

  

**För att lyckas i tjänsten som lösningsarkitekt tror vi du har följande:**
* Tidigare har arbetat som till exempel teknisk account manager, solution arkitekt, solution manager eller som applikationsarkitekt eller liknande och besitter därmed en bred teknisk bakgrund
* Har teknisk kunskap inom Cloud och IT-infrastruktur
* Välutvecklat affärsmannaskap och ett sinne för försäljning
* Är flytande i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Har möjlighet att resa i tjänsten när det behövs


**Om Atea Managed Services**
 På Atea Managed Services är vi experter på IT-drift. Oavsett om våra kunder vill outsourca delar av eller hela IT-driften, är vi deras föredragna driftspartner. Vi hjälper till att frigöra resurser och öka den övergripande effektiviteten i deras IT-organisationer. Detta gör vi genom att leverera kostnadseffektiva driftstjänster med högsta kvalitet, oavsett kundens plattformsbehov. Detta kan innebära i kundens eget datacenter, på offentliga molnplattformar eller i vårt eget Atea Cloud. Atea Managed Services finns i fem länder och mer än 1 500 anställda arbetar inom affärsområdet. Vi har driftspersonal i tjänst dygnet runt
   

  

**Kontakt & mer information**
 Har du frågor om tjänstens innehåll eller hur det är att arbeta på Atea är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Urban Järved, Manager for Solution Management, via urban.jarved@atea.se +46 72 712 76 88. Jag hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför alla samtal och eventuella förslag från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag.
   

  

 Som en del i Ateas rekryteringsprocess ingår bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat. Atea vill vara The Place To Be och därför värdesätter vi de kvalitéer som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att du får en arbetsplats där du kan #GetTheFutureYouWant. Här blir du en del av en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över. Inom Cloud and Custom Applications (C&CA) på Capgemini arbetar du med de senaste teknologierna inom Cloud, Integration, AI och mjukvaruutveckling. Vi utvecklar skräddarsydda applikationer och hanterar komplexa integrationer för att maximera teknikens potential – med målet att skapa en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid. Följ med oss och samarbeta med världens ledande organisationer för att realisera teknikens fulla värde genom innovativa lösningar och molntransformation.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Test Automation Engineer kommer du att arbeta tillsammans med kunder i spännande och betydelsefulla projekt som formar framtidens digitala transformation.
   

  

*I denna position kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:*
* Designa och implementera testautomationslösningar för att säkerställa mjukvarukvalitet och tillförlitlighet
* Fungera som en betrodd rådgivare och vägleda kunder om testautomationsstrategier och bästa praxis
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att utveckla effektiva och skalbara lösningar
* Utveckla användarcentrerade testautomationslösningar som förbättrar slutanvändarens upplevelse och säkerställer tillförlitlighet, användbarhet och effektivitet i automatiserade tester


**Din profil**
* 4+ års erfarenhet i en relevant roll (t.ex. Test Automation, QA-Engineer eller Software Engineer med testautomationsansvar)
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Praktisk erfarenhet av testautomationsverktyg och ramverk (t.ex. Selenium, JUnit, TestNG, Cypress, Playwright). Kunskap om testhanterings- och felhanteringsverktyg (Jira, HP ALM)
* Färdighet i skript- och programmeringsspråk (t.ex. Java, Python, C#, Javascript)


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
* På Capgemini är arbete mer än bara ett jobb – det är en plats att trivas, växa och göra verklig skillnad. Med starkt fokus på balans mellan arbete och privatliv, välbefinnande och inkludering, kommer du att vara en del av en global gemenskap av 340 000 kollegor.
* Här är du i förarsätet för din karriär – #GetTheFutureYouWant är vårt åtagande att ge dig möjlighet att forma din framtid. Från AI och moln till digital ingenjörskonst, kommer du att arbeta med banbrytande projekt som transformerar företag och skapar en mer hållbar och inkluderande värld.
* Livet på Capgemini är givande, spännande och fyllt med möjligheter att lära, utmana dig själv och samarbeta med briljanta sinnen. Redo att #GetTheFutureYouWant? Välkommen! Låt oss göra det tillsammans.


**Ansökan**
 Redo att starta ett nytt kapitel i din karriär? Vi kan knappt vänta på att höra från dig! Ansök idag – vi hanterar ansökningar löpande. Under processen får du chansen att besöka vårt kontor, prata med rekryterande chef och självklart ställa alla dina nyfikna frågor till vår rekryterare. Vi lovar att göra din resa mot jobbet så smidig och givande som möjligt. Är du den vi söker? Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!
   

  

*Observera att identitets- och bakgrundskontroller kan genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.*
**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Test/Validation Engineer – Automotive
description:
### **Assignment: Test/Validation Engineer – Automotive**


Do you have a strong interest in testing, measurement technology, and hands-on engineering? We are now looking for a **Test/Validation Engineer** for an assignment within the **automotive industry**. The role includes coordination and execution of both winter and summer testing, sensor installation, data collection, and analysis – all in close collaboration with experienced development teams.

#### **About the Assignment**


You will be part of a team responsible for planning, executing, and analyzing tests in both lab and field environments. The work includes configuring test setups, managing diagnostics, and using specialized software tools. **There will also be opportunities to travel abroad for test campaigns**, depending on the project phase.

#### **Responsibilities:**

* Coordinate and support seasonal test campaigns (winter and summer).
* Perform physical testing and install measurement equipment and sensors.
* Collect, validate, and analyze test data.
* Work with diagnostics and software updates in test objects.
* Collaborate closely with test engineers, technicians, and workshop personnel.
* Document test results and contribute to continuous improvement.

#### **Your Profile:**

* **At least 1–2 years of hands-on experience in test/validation work;** **automotive experience is a plus, but not required.**
* Comfortable working with diagnostics and instrumentation.
* Familiarity with commonly used tools such as:


	+ **ETAS INCA** (data acquisition and calibration)
	+ **Vector CANoe** (CAN communication analysis)
	+ **X-com** (diagnostics)
	+ **Gadget** (vehicle software update tool)
* Experience with data analysis in MATLAB or similar is an advantage.
* **B driver’s license is required – C license is a strong plus.**
* You are proactive, structured, and solution-oriented, with a hands-on mindset.

#### **Location:**


Based in **Södertälje**, with **occasional travel within Sweden and abroad** for test campaigns.

#### **️ Start Date:**

**August 2025**

title: Cooling & Lubrication Design Engineer - Wave Energy
description:
Working at CorPower Ocean you will be part of a world-class team, determined to make big impact. We are on a mission to bring reliable and competitive wave energy to the world. We offer a high degree of autonomy, combined with great personal responsibility. CorPower Ocean is a global leader in wave energy, with a technology that has shown game-changing performance. Your work will contribute to the global transition to renewable energy by unlocking one of the largest untapped sources of clean energy on earth.


**Role**


CorPower’s Mechanical team is looking for a cooling and lubrication design engineer with experience in industrial equipment design to take a leading role in the development and optimisation of our innovative wave energy converters.


The role will be working closely with the Powertrain product team and the Mechanical group, also involving a large amount of interaction with our entire organisation, requiring good collaboration skills.


**Responsibil**ities


* Design and optimise the cooling system, primarily for the electrical drivetrain
* Design and optimise the lubrication system for the gearbox, pneumatic cylinders and seal glands.
* Perform thermal and fluid flow analysis, including component selection for both dry testing and operational conditions.
* Participate in and present at cross-disciplinary design reviews
* Develop and maintain technical documentation for internal use & 3rd party verification and certification
* Perform failure mode, effects and criticality analysis
* Manage your systems and components to meet performance, schedule and budget targets
* Investigate new solutions to improve performance, reliability and/or manufacturability
* Interface with requirement, supply chain, manufacturing and field-testing teams
* Support assembly, testing, and pilot installations in the field

**Skills and qualifications**


* You have a minimum of 5 years of relevant industry experience in mechanical system design, including 2+ years in cooling and lubrication, preferably in heavy machinery, marine, or renewable energy sectors.
* You have a strong understanding of fluid mechanics, heat transfer and tribology.
* You have a proven track record in full product development cycles from design, build, test and, operation.
* You have a broad technical knowledge and genuine interest in the different aspects of machinery and mechanical design. Knowledge of hydraulics, pneumatics, rotating machinery/transmission, heat transfer, lubrication, tribology, routing and/or electricity generation equipment is qualifying. We value, hands-on, practical workshop-based hydraulics experience.
* You will use Creo CAD, Windchill PLM, ePlan & Simscape Fluid – experience in these tools is beneficial. Expertise in similar software plus a willingness to get up to speed quickly also qualifies.
* You may have a B.Sc or a M.Sc. degree in mechanical engineering or related disciplines, but your personality, experience and interest in the field is the most important.
* You are proficient in English, both spoken and written.

**As a person:**


* You are striving for excellence, put quality into everything you do
* You are self-motivated and constantly seek the most efficient ways to work
* You always search for simple and elegant solutions to difficult problems
* You love to learn new things, and take pride in constantly developing your skills
* You are persistent, knowing it takes stamina to reach pioneering goals
* You see your tasks through to completion
* You are comfortable in presenting your solutions internally and externally
* You are data driven and strive to always back your points with solid analysis

CorPower Ocean has a highly diversified team with many nationalities and backgrounds, all working towards the same goal. This is something we are very proud of. We are not perfect yet, but we hope you share our aim to achieve higher equality.

title: HW development engineer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Is electronics your passion?



Do you have a specific area of expertise and like to work as team to reach the overall goals of a project? You now have the chance to work at a Swedish IoT specialist with some of the most interesting IoT and wireless projects around.



You will be part of our HW team that today delivers everything from satellite communication devices to VR headsets, gateways as well as FPGA-based control systems. Advanced and complex IOT gateways, together with their set of sensors and protocols.



Some examples of work would be:


* Taking part of designing discrete CPU/MCU systems with surrounding memories, based on popular platforms from big brands such as NXP, Qualcomm etc...
* Designing sensors based upon a customized MCU  

*(e.g.* *Nordic Semi, Renesas* *, ST Microelectronics MediaTek, etc)*
* Assessing requirements upon the use cases and whether or not this will suffice.
* enabling testing and approval of products at test houses such as Intertek and the like.
* Working closely with System, RF and SW disciplines to define a product, develop, test and prepare for manufacturnig and final hand-off to customer or production partner.


Come join us - be a part of the WSI family!



**About Sigma Connectivity WSI**



Sigma Connectivity WSI – supports companies in developing and industrializing their products within Internet of Things and advanced radio.



Since 2002 we have been making things Wireless by WSI™.



The team has long experience of delivering complex projects and mobile products. We provide a flexible resource that takes a product from idea to volume production. Our experienced in-house team ensures quality every step of the way. Since autumn 2020, we are owned by and a part of the Sigma Connectivity Group, a global tech house with its headquarters in Lund, Sweden.



### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



**Must have**



* master of science or equivalent experience
* experience in hardware designs of embedded systems with advanced micro controllers/CPUs with high speed interfaces such as DDR memories, Ethernet, USB, HDMI etc.
* experience in DC/DC and LDO based designs for embedded systems where power consumption must be very low, e.g. in battery powered devices.
* Good knowledge of how to make a design that will meet the relevant type approval and certification requirements.
* Good knowledge of simulation tools such as SPICE. We need a person that really appreciates and understands the need of proper simulation in the design phase.
* Experienced in writing technical documentation in English is important.


**Good to have**



Experience in the following areas:


* Experience in Altium for schematic diagram is a great plus.
* any kind of RF related experience
* any kind of experience in handling software  

(dev kits, arduino, rpi, python, or the like..)
* Bluetooth Low Energy, Zigbee, Z-Wave, UWB, or other wireless communication
* Used to work closely with software development
  

(collaborate in schematic review schematics etc.)


The person needs to be a real team player that can listen to other people’s ideas and even be a role model and tutor for younger engineers. He or she will typically be the lead designer regarding the HW portion of a project. It is, however, not a project management role.


### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



We are looking for you with a dedicated interest in hardware development in embedded systems.



You have the ability to take initiatives and work independently and at the same time being a team member, coach, and grow people around you.



You are fluent in English, written and spoken.



You have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in engineering. Alternatively, you have gained similar knowledge from work experience, in the fields of embedded systems, electronics, or mechatronics.



We put great emphasis on your attitude and eagerness to learn!


### **WE OFFER**


* An international working environment
* Opportunity to develop cutting edge technology for market leaders and some of the most demanding customers
* Extensive hardware and software knowledge and all the equipment to build and test complete products and solutions
* Working on a project basis, promoting competence development
* Being part of a wonderful and experienced team where you will never work alone.
* The Sigma Connectivity company culture.


Sigma Connectivity WSI is a unique consultant company offering:


* Focus on connectivity, and the possibility to work for some of the most demanding connectivity customers available, with highly motivated and skilled developers and testers in the team.
* Access to cutting-edge technology through our close cooperation with platform vendors and 3rd party companies.
* A culture based on sharing experiences and knowledge. We will encourage you to develop and grow your competence and skills with new challenges.
* Many great colleagues, passionate about all the cool devices we build, all being inventors committed to having fun while getting things done.
* An environment with hardware and software knowledge as well as all the equipment to build and test complete products in-house.
* Team activities with WSI colleagues, a yearly event with all team members of Sigma Connectivity.
* An including culture, where we support each other. By joining the Sigma Connectivity WSI family you will indeed never be alone!


We work both with a tech-house service executing the customers’ assignments in-house, as well as, an engineering service where our work resides in the customer's location. Our experienced team ensures quality every step of the way.



This position is residing in the tech-house, where we work mostly with projects that are developed in-house. In other words, work is undertaken in our office in Kista where you have access to the full knowledge of the team.


### **MORE INFORMATION**



For more information please contact



Lars Wattsgård,  

+46 709381386  

Lars.Wattsgard@sigmaconnectivity.se



* #### **POSITION**


HW development engineer
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Connectivity
* #### **LOCATION**


Stockholm, Kista, Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Hardware Electronics
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2025-05-06
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2025-09-15
* #### **CONTACT**


Lars Wattsgård, Lars.Wattsgard@sigmaconnectivity.se, +46709381386
