title: QA Engineer/Test Automation Specialist
description:
Vill du arbeta med QA och Testautomatisering inom Försäkringsområdet? Då är det här jobbet för dig!
Hos oss på Swedbank har du en möjlighet att:Designa, bygga, testa, utföra och underhålla automatiska regressionstester med hjälp av verktyget Selenium (Java).
Designa, bygga, testa, utföra och underhålla prestandatester med hjälp av verktyget JMeter.
Tillsammans med Business Analysts/Business/Acceptanstestare införskaffa kunskap och input vad gäller Use Case-flöden, testdata mm samt dokumentera och underhålla testfall i Jira/Zephyr och/eller Excel.
Rapportera defekter, driva initiala utredningar samt kommunicera med interna intressenter och vår leverantörs QA-team
Lära dig Swedbanks utvecklings- och testprocess samt vara en del av vårt QA Community of professionals mm.Vara med från tidiga faser och hjälpa initiativen, guida dem i testautomatiseringsfrågor såsom ”Vad” och ”Hur” och skapa effektiva Testautomatiseringslösningar.
Tillsammans med teamet och övriga Swedbank Försäkring utveckla framtidens försäkringsaffär och skapa stort värde för våra kunder och vår verksamhet. Vi arbetar tätt tillsammans inom hela företaget och vårt team är en stor del av företagets kärnverksamhet. Vi har många spännande utmaningar framför oss, vilket bl a inkluderar nya affärer, digitalisering och integrationer med befintliga system.
  


I denna roll behöver du:Praktisk erfarenhet från mjukvaru-/applikationstester, gärna från bank- eller försäkringsdomänen.Vara väl insatt i Agila utvecklingsprocesser och testmetoder.God erfarenhet från Testautomatisering av GUI och APIer med Java och/eller Python som programmeringsspråkErfarenhet av att arbeta med Selenium (Java), Maven, Gradle, Git, TestNG, SonarCube och Jenkins.Tidigare erfarenhet eller intresse för lärande av prestandatester med JMeter.Erfarenhet av verktyg som Playwright, Selenide, Postman, K6 och SoapUI är meriterande.Kunskap och erfarenhet inom datadriven testning och Page Object Models är ett stort plus.Andra områden som är bra att ha erfarenhet från eller ha intresse av att lära sig är testmiljöer och testdatahantering, övergripande förståelse för arkitekturen och systemlösningen som stödjer kundupplevelsen/interaktionen, containers och Micro services och andra integrationsmönster såsom MQ/Kafka, SSEK etc.Tycka om att vara involverad i flera uppdrag/applikationer samtidigt.
En mycket god kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga, då du kommer att ha kontakter med många olika intressenter till exempel Produktägare, Business specialister, slutanvändare och leverantörer.
Vara driven, ta egna initiativ och ha förmågan att driva arbetet tillsammans med teamet eller själv om så behövs.Ett strukturerat arbetssätt och en stark önskan att ständigt förbättra.Ha ett kreativt tankesätt med en "Allt är möjligt" attityd och vara flexibel.En lagspelare med ett genuint intresse av att lära nytt och att hjälpa andra att lyckas.Behärska svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.
En akademisk examen inom ett relevant område eller likvärdig utbildning/erfarenhet.Certifieringar som ISTQB är meriterande.Att ha erfarenhet inom området pension och försäkring är ett stort plus liksom erfarenhet av försäkringssystemet Lumera Core.
  


Hos oss kan du uppleva:Personlig och professionell utveckling genom självledarskap och kontinuerlig utveckling.
Meningsfullt arbete som positivt påverkar vår arbetsplats, våra kunder och samhället.
En öppen och samarbetsinriktad kultur som uppmuntrar tvärfunktionellt teamarbete och erbjuder nätverksmöjligheter.
En stöttande och inkluderande miljö som främjar en balanserad och hållbar arbetslivssituation, med flexibla arbetsförhållanden när det passar rollen.
Förmåner såsom vårt erbjudanden för bankprodukter för anställda, tjänstepensionsplan, aktiebaserade belöningsprogram Eken, och frivillig gruppförsäkring.

"Bli en del av vårt team och...
var med på den spännande resan vi har framför oss. Du får möjligheten att arbeta mitt i hjärtat av försäkringsaffären och tillsammans med kompetenta och hängivna kollegor ta fram lösningar som används av hela Swedbank Försäkring och i alla våra kanaler.
Vår värdeström, Release & Delivery Management, är en viktig del av Swedbank Försäkring och genom att arbeta med oss får du det bästa av att vara en del av både det lilla företaget och samtidigt den stora koncernen. Swedbank Försäkring är ett helägt dotterbolag till Swedbank, vi är ca 220 anställda och med tillgångar på över 400 miljarder SEK gör det oss till en stor försäkringspartner i Sverige.” Lena Arvidsson, din framtida chef  

Vi ser fram emot din an senast den 2025-05-25.
Placeringsort: Sundbyberg  

Rekryterande chef: Lena Arvidsson  

  

Vi kan komma att påbörja urvalet under ningstiden och välkomnar din an så snart som möjligt. *Vi har gjort vårt medieval för rekrytering och undanber oss därför kontakt med annonssäljare eller säljare av andra rekryteringstjänster.*  

Swedbank är en inkluderande arbetsgivare och diskriminerar ingen utifrån kön, ålder, sexuell läggning eller sexuell identitet, etnicitet, religion eller funktionsnedsättning - alla är välkomna.
  
**Job area**
IT and data
**Role**
Software Engineering
**Locations**
Stockholm Region
**Remote status**
Hybrid

title: Method and Tools Engineer
description:
We are searching for Method and Tools Engineer in Gothenburg, Sweden.
  
**Work:** 100%
  
**Start:** Immediate
  
**Position type:** Permanent
  
**Salary:** based on experience
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Share and apply best practices across projects to ensure alignment with global standards.
  
Analyze fleet operations and maintenance data to support performance improvements.
  
Develop and maintain software tools for fleet data management, including dashboards and reports using Tableau and VB.NET.
  
Create custom business intelligence solutions with interactive dashboards and visualizations tailored for fleet management.
  
Support the rollout of reliability processes, tools, and training programs.
  
Lead initiatives to improve asset performance and enhance Reliability, Availability, and Maintainability (RAM).
  
Provide first-level support for Train Health Management tools and collaborate with central data teams on real-time data integration.
  
  

**Experience Profile:**  

Master’s degree in engineering.
  
Proficient in Tableau, VB.NET, Python, and R for data analysis and visualization.
  
Skilled in building interactive, user-friendly dashboards that communicate insights clearly.
  
Understand best practices in data visualization and presentation.
  
Knowledgeable in Reliability, Availability, and Maintainability (RAM) principles across product life cycles.
  
Familiar with software architecture and systems integration with IT tools.
  
Experienced in statistical analysis and data modeling to support decision-making.
  
Strong analytical thinker with the ability to interpret large datasets and spot trends or outliers.
  
Capable of cleaning and transforming raw data for analysis.
  
Have a good understanding of railway operations and engineering project workflows.
  
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
Shape the Future of Powertrain Technology as a Software Responsible .
  
Join the high-performing Software & Electronics group and play a crucial role in the exciting development of next-generation powertrain controls. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to world-class solutions, ranging from advanced hybrid engine management systems to cutting-edge fully electric powertrains, encompassing Electrical Drive Units, inverters, and transmissions.
  
Client is seeking a dedicated Development Engineer to take ownership of understanding customer requirements, collaborating with their suppliers and internal team experts to devise efficient and innovative solutions, and ultimately designing those solutions. You will tackle challenging engineering tasks that will fuel your technical and personal growth within their dynamic environment. You will be entrusted with the responsibility for either one of their critical ECUs or inverters within one or more of their ongoing, groundbreaking projects.
  
the possibilities are boundless for collaborative individuals eager to make a real impact. They are actively re-imagining motion for a brighter, more sustainable future, striving to minimize our environmental footprint and designing the powertrain solutions of tomorrow, for both automotive and broader applications.
  
We pride ourselves on being a team of caring and collaborative individuals with a global perspective, a strong passion for innovation, and an unwavering drive for excellence. If you are ready to embark on this journey with us, we encourage you to apply!
  
  

**What you will do:**  

As a Software Responsible, you will be the driving force behind the development of the Base Software for our ECUs or inverters throughout all project phases. You will be an integral part of a cross-functional team, working closely with Software and Hardware engineers, as well as the Software Architect and System Designer within group.
  
You will serve as the primary technical point of contact for their suppliers regarding the product(s) you are responsible for. This includes ensuring that the technology, cost, and timing align with the defined project targets. A strong technical understanding of the requirements within your area of responsibility is essential, enabling you to engage in constructive dialogues with both internal and external customers and our suppliers.
  
  

**What you need to succeed:**  

A Master's or Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering, or a similar relevant field.
  
Proven experience in Base Software development for one or more of our product areas: inverter and/or ECM, TCM, etc. Knowledge of Autosar, application Software, and integration is highly valuable.
  
The cross-functional nature of this role offers significant opportunities to expand your expertise in subsystem areas and grow your professional network.
  
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken, are essential. Proficiency in Swedish is also highly desired for effective collaboration and communication within the team.
  
**you embody our core values:** caring, collaboration, a global mindset, a passion for innovation, and a drive to create excellence.
  
  

champions diversity and firmly believes that the diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of our people are our greatest strength.
  
**Important Note for Consultants:** Please be aware that consultant require working in a remote desktop environment, and consultants are expected to provide and use their own equipment (computer and phone, when necessary).

title: Aerodynamic Simulation Engineer - CFD
description:
An exciting opportunity is now open for someone who shares our strong customer focus, is a team player and has a passion for success. If you share these qualities, then this can be the right place for you! Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.


At Volvo Group Trucks Technology, we're pioneers in automotive innovation. We set new standards for performance and efficiency, and we're dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where every voice is valued. Our team collaborates from the highest leadership levels to the hands-on work in the field, ensuring that everyone's unique perspective contributes to our success

**Who are we?**
---------------

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination.


At the Group Driving Performance & Aero, we hold the responsibility for the core feature of Energy Economy, Driving Range, CO2/GHG Emissions, Drivability, Average Speed and Aerodynamic AirDrag testing. Our work spans feature management, complete vehicle testing for aero, soiling, energy efficiency, and range. Additionally, we specialize in developing and executing state-of-the-art complete vehicle simulations, utilizing cutting-edge software in the loop and hardware in the loop technologies.

  

  

We embrace change and agility, staying responsive to emerging challenges and opportunities. We offer mentorship and growth opportunities, creating an environment where you can learn from experienced professionals while contributing to cutting-edge projects shaping the future of the automotive industry.


Join us and be part of a dynamic team where diversity, creativity, and innovation drive our success. We actively encourage engineers of all backgrounds to apply and be instrumental in shaping the future of automotive technology.

**What you will do**
--------------------


Main area of responsibility lies within CFD simulations for Airdrag certification, Aerodynamic evaluations and Aerodynamic tests for trucks, ensuring optimal vehicle performance and efficiency, seeking to meet Certification processes.

  

* Develop and deliver CFD models and results, proposing optimal simulation and analysis approaches, contributing to the overall energy management mapping of complete vehicle applications by utilizing the in-house processes for aerodynamic simulations.
* Utilize CFD tools and techniques to draw conclusions and make recommendations, ensuring analyses meet design targets and standards, in order to meet Airdrag Certification Processes.
* Contribute to continuous improvement of methods and tools, acting as a technical specialist in the field of Aerodynamics and Airdrag.
* Evaluate project content and estimate timelines, actively participating in the development and enhancement of methods and tools.
**Who are you?**
----------------


To excel in this role, you should possess some of the following qualifications, achieved by few years of working experience in the automotive business or similar.

  

* Passion for Innovation: Bring your enthusiasm for innovation and your fresh perspective to our team. Your creativity will be a driving force in pushing the boundaries of automotive technology.
* Useful Hands-On Testing Experience: Your expertise in testing will be useful in driving innovation. Share your practical insights, gained through hands-on experience, to enrich our projects and shape the future of automotive technology.
* A Master's degree is highly desirable.
* CAE Simulation Experience: Experience with CAE tools such as CREO, Catia and ANSA is preferred and highly valued. Experience with CFD tools like StarCCM+ is valuable. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, MATLAB, or C++ is also desirable. Additionally, knowing agile workflow is a plus.
* Fast Learner and Problem Solver: We value your ability to quickly adapt and find innovative solutions. Your intuitive approach to complex challenges will set you apart.
* Commitment to Constant Improvement: If you have a passion for continuous method development and procedural improvement, you'll thrive in our dynamic environment.
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


Are you eager to contribute your skills and innovative ideas? We are looking forward to hearing from you. Apply today!  

For further information please contact Rodrigo Estella, Driving Performance & Aero Group Manager, rodrigo.estella@volvo.com. The last application date is the 19th of May.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Experienced charging verification engineer
description:
**About Us**


At GTT Electromobility, we're leading the way in the development of cutting-edge electric vehicles. Our mission is to drive the future of transportation with sustainable, high-performance solutions. Join our passionate and dynamic team to play a key role in shaping the future of electric mobility.

 **Role Overview**  

Are you interested in system verification and passionate about ensuring the highest standards of quality and reliability? We're looking for an experienced System Verification Engineer to join our Electronics SW Verification group and contribute to the next generation of electric vehicles. In this role, you’ll be at the heart of ensuring that our systems perform flawlessly in real-world scenarios, directly impacting the success of our innovative products.

 **Your Key Responsibilities:**  

As an Experienced System Verification Engineer, you will:

* Plan, prepare, and lead verification activities
* Develop test methods and test cases based on requirements
* Ensure good communication for the test findings and identifying potential risks

  

What We’re Looking For:  

* 1 year of experience in verification, validation, and testing of safety-critical systems within the automotive industry.
* A good understanding of automotive software development processes and safety standards.
 **Technical Skills:**

* Experience in functional verification
* Experience in Electromobility is a plus.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills

 **What we can offer**


At GTT Electromobility, you’ll have the opportunity to work on the cutting edge of electric vehicle technology, directly shaping the future of transportation. You’ll be part of a supportive, diverse, and forward-thinking team that values your input and expertise. Your contributions will have a direct impact on the quality and success of world-class electromobility systems, ensuring your work makes a difference. Additionally, we offer ample opportunities for personal and professional growth, allowing you to develop your skills and advance within a rapidly growing industry.

 **Ready to Drive the Future?**  

If you’re passionate about electric vehicles and ready to make a real impact in the industry, we want to hear from you! Apply today to become part of a team that’s revolutionizing transportation.


As a large, global company, we can also offer multiple career paths for further growth and development. This can either be more senior roles within the same technical area, expansion into new technical areas or switching to management roles.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group.** Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

title: Service Engineer- Brake
description:
**Discover your potential. Pursue your passion.**
Link Engineering Company (LINK) is a premier designer and manufacturer of precision test equipment, we specialize in developing customized solutions for Automotive, Aviation, Off-Highway, Rail and Civil Engineering industries. We are headquartered in Plymouth, Michigan, and maintain testing laboratories, manufacturing, and support facilities around the globe.
Established in 1935, we have been a family-owned company for generations, we treat our customers and employees as if they are part of our family. We set our employees up for success, as they are given constant opportunities to learn and develop new skills. As many of our team members have been with LINK for a generation or more, the LINK team is equipped with a wealth of knowledge, providing decades of hands-on experience and out-of-the-box thinking to OEMs and suppliers everywhere.  

  

We are looking for a Service Engineer/Technicianresponsible for the activities related to Field Service ( Repair,Software Support, Calibration and Preventive Maintenance), Parts ( Sales and Repair) and Equipment Commissioning for our customers based in Europe.  

**ACTIVITY**
* Independent commissioning, maintenance and calibration of brake testers and other test bench systems
* Fault analyses and repairs of all LINK systems and devices
* Support in the further development of our products through experience reports to product and service management


**PROFIL**
* Technician/master craftsman, engineering degree specializing in electrical engineering/mechatronics/mechanical engineering;
* Experience in calibration (Decelerometer, Accelerometer, Vmax Data Logger, Humidity sensors)
* Preferred previous experience in commissioning, maintenance, and repair of equipment test machine
* Knowledge of mechanical, hydraulic, electrical and software components
* Knowledge of MS Office
* Strong customer-oriented attitude
* Good knowledge of English language


  

**Soft skills**
* Customer and service-oriented appearance and corresponding work attitude;
* High level of stress resistance;
* Strong willingness to cooperate and ability to work in an international team;
* Willingness to travel (70%), mainly Europe


**WE OFFER**
* Career prospects in an international and dynamic company with a well-known tradition of quality and competence
* Varied and technically complex work content with high added value.
* International customers operating in Europe
* Professional and economic growth combined with acquired skills
* Technical training
* Good working atmosphere
* Attractive salary with flexible working hours and high job security
* Permanent employment contract
company_addresses: 41100 Plymouth Rd Suite 300, Plymouth, MI, United States, Michigan

title: Network Communication Design Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match. Volvo Electromobility develops electric propulsion systems and components—such as batteries, electric motors, and charging solutions—for trucks, buses, and construction equipment. We are now looking for new colleagues to join the Function Design group within the Electric Propulsion Management System (EPSM) section.

 **Who are we?**

  

The EPSM section is responsible for embedded software development, including release and integration, which bridges the electric management system with the mechanical propulsion system. This involves the design, implementation, verification, and quality assurance of advanced traction voltage and propulsion functions for electric vehicles. Our team includes Senior Embedded Software Engineers and Function Owners who take a holistic approach to balancing feature development with hardware constraints.

 **What you will do**

  

In this role, you will contribute to the system design team with a focus on internal communication networks. Responsibilities include:

  

* Developing toolchains and processes for updating and maintaining communication networks.
* Supporting the configuration of signaling and communication systems.
* Coordinating network updates with a forward-looking approach.
* Ensuring quality through process adherence and continuous improvement.
* Securing system reliability by enforcing standards and optimizing network bus load.
* Addressing diverse product needs using platform-based solutions that ensure long-term maintainability.

 **Qualifications**

  

* MSc in Electronics Engineering, Embedded Systems, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent.
* Experience in automotive embedded systems development.
* Proficiency in software development and scripting (e.g., Python).
* Hands-on experience with CAN communication system configuration.
* Strong holistic thinking, communication, and networking skills.
* A collaborative team player

 **Ready for the next step?**

  

Submit your application no later than May 14th. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. title: SIL Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Who are we?**


The VMM SIL team is dedicated to the development and verification of simulation models for Vehicle Motion Management (VMM). Our primary focus is on creating and maintaining Software-in-the-Loop (SIL) environments that facilitate the testing and validation of various vehicle control systems. We collaborate closely with the Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) team to ensure comprehensive coverage of functional requirements and fault injection testing. Our work involves developing test cases, analyzing test results, and maintaining the infrastructure to support accurate and efficient verification processes. By leveraging advanced simulation models, we aim to enhance the quality and reliability of vehicle motion control systems.

**About the role:**  

We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Senior V45 Software in the Loop Engineer to lead our test development efforts using AutomationDesk, a tool from dSPACE. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing advanced virtual environments for closed-loop verification and overseeing the automation pipeline using Jenkins.


The ideal candidate will demonstrate excellent leadership and communication skills, fostering collaboration and effectively guiding teams toward shared goals. They will possess strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, enabling them to address complex challenges with sound judgment. The role requires the ability to manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously, ensuring efficient workflow and timely delivery. A commitment to continuous learning and improvement is essential, reflecting a proactive approach to personal and professional development.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead the development and maintenance of test scripts using AutomationDesk for closed-loop verification.
* Design and manage complex virtual environments for testing.
* Oversee the implementation and maintenance of automation pipelines using Jenkins.
* Mentor and guide junior engineers in best practices and technical skills.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project success in an agile environment.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives within the team.
**Qualifications:**

* Extensive experience in test development using AutomationDesk.
* Advanced knowledge of Python programming.
* In-depth understanding of vehicle dynamics and control systems.
* Proven experience with Jenkins for automation pipeline development.
* Strong leadership and mentoring skills.
* Ability to work effectively in an agile team.

For further questions, please contact our Talent Acquisition Partner, Batool Malik at batool.malik@volvo.com

 **Last application date: 11th May 2025**

title: Lead Engineer Chassis Special Vehicles Defense Engineering
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**This is us, your new colleague**
----------------------------------


You now have a great opportunity to join the Special Vehicles Defense Engineering Team, which is dedicated to develop unique and customized solutions to meet the future needs of Defense vehicles.  

We take an active part in making Volvo Trucks the world leader with the heavy duty truck range FH, FM, FMX in sustainable defense logistical transport missions, and we need you to join our team and contribute to our challenging assignments.

 **This is us, your new colleague**

  

We are an experienced engineering team from different areas cross-functionally in chassis, cab, electrical hardware and software. Within the Special Vehicles department we also have chief project managers and vehicle and geometrical architects, which means we can take on really challenging development tasks together.  

Our way of working is based on that we continuously develop and implement innovative ways of working to secure high performance in time to market, quality, and reduced development costs for all our products.  

Our culture is based on trust, accountability, business mindset and we all share the same belief that everything is possible if we do it together.

**Role description**
--------------------


You will be part of a team responsible for the chassis engineering activities within Special Vehicles Defense Engineering. As a core member in our team, we offer you the opportunity to work in a collaborative atmosphere and a culture of can-do attitude. For this position your main responsibilities will be:

  

* Lead and take part in the chassis design activities from concept to industrialization for Defense vehicles products and deliver technical solutions agreed with our customers
* As the Defense business is tender driven meaning that you need to be able to quickly adapt and sometimes deliver solutions with short lead times.
* Lead development tasks in cooperation with both internal experts and external partners
* Drive the technical dialogue with engineering, manufacturing, purchasing, suppliers, partners and most importantly our customers
* Develop and share acquired competence and provide technical advice
* Contribute to continuous improvement activities regarding way of working, business development, innovation and together build the team spirit
**Education, Experience, Knowledge and Skills**
-----------------------------------------------


For success in this role, we expect you to have:

  

* University degree in Mechanical Engineering or similar technical field of study  

automotive sector
* Extensive experience with 3D CAD-tools, such as Creo or Catia, and PDM-systems is needed to be efficient in this role
* Experience from the Defense sector or Governmental sales is needed to be successful in this role
* Work experience in relevant field for a minimum of 7 years
* Extensive knowledge of design engineering work within the chassis area of trucks, or similar areas within the

  

You are curious and thrive to take the lead with courage and integrity and feel comfortable working autonomously. You have the ability to build trust and to manage networking across the engineering-, manufacturing-, purchasing and sales and marketing organizations.

  

We find that well balanced teams increase group dynamics, creativity, and our overall efficiency. We are therefore actively working to establish teams that will take maximum advantage of the strength inherent to differences in knowledge, experience, age, gender, and nationality, among others.  

If you have an open mindset to new innovative ways of working and get energized by working close to the customer and constantly evolving to meet their needs, you might be our next colleague.

**Are we a perfect match?**
---------------------------


We promise you some truly exciting technical challenges and the opportunity to join a team of skilled colleagues. We are eager to learn from you and you will get fantastic opportunities to learn and develop with us. So, if you are a person who is flexible, who sees challenges as something positive and is ready to act? Then we hope to hear from you.  

As this role is connected to the Defense business we have to perform a background and security control.

title: Senior Electrical Hardware Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

  

Are you ready to be part of the biggest technology shift in the transport industry? Do you want to contribute to sustainable transport solutions while tackling exciting new challenges in electrical systems development? We’re looking for a Senior Electrical Hardware Engineer to join our product development team for Electrical Distribution Systems at Volvo Group Trucks Technology.

**What you will do**
--------------------

  

You’ll help drive the world toward a cleaner future. Working in Electromobility gives you the benefits of a large international organization combined with the innovation-driven culture of a startup. You’ll collaborate closely across departments — sales, purchasing, labs, software, and more — and take full ownership of your work, from concept to industrialization, and through to aftermarket support.

  

Your responsibilities will include:

* Developing and delivering high-voltage electrical distribution hardware (e.g., HV connectors, cables, fuses, sensors)
* Supporting both new and existing platform applications, aligned with our technology roadmap
* Troubleshooting current products and improving system performance
* Using development tools and processes such as JIRA, KOLA, PDM, and SE Tool
* Working within a broad internal and external network
* Providing technical support and feedback to global customers

 **Your future team**  

  

We are part of the Distribution and Charging teams, part of the Power Conversion group, with focus on transferring energy from the grid to the vehicle and distributing it efficiently from the battery to the driveline. We develop hardware for a wide range of applications — from trucks and buses to construction equipment and marine. We believe in the power of teamwork and shared purpose. Our agile work model means every team owns their planning and delivery, drawing on a mix of skills and perspectives to build great solutions. Diversity in knowledge, experience, age, gender, and background strengthens our innovation. Electromobility is one of the most dynamic fields in the heavy-duty transport industry — and your career will grow with it. At Volvo, our core values — Customer Success, Trust, Passion, Change, and Performance — guide everything we do.

**Who are you?**
----------------

  

You're a curious, collaborative team player with a passion for developing electrical driveline hardware. You enjoy solving today’s challenges while thinking ahead to future solutions. Experience in the electric vehicle field is a plus.

  

We believe you have:

* A Master’s degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Mechatronics Engineering (or equivalent)
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* A structured, proactive way of working with multiple stakeholders
* 6+ years of Product Development experience, preferably in the automotive industry
* Familiarity with Volvo tools and processes (KOLA, PDM, PIL)
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------

  

Apply now, and let’s shape the future of transport together.

  

For questions, feel free to reach out to:


Tiago Araujo  

tiago.araujo.4@volvo.com  

Acting Line Manager, Electrical Distribution Components

  

Last application date is 8th of May.

title: Solution Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

 **Who are you?**

  

As a Solution Engineer, the role involves interfacing with customers to identify their needs and delivering solutions that align with business requirements. This is achieved by leveraging a range of technologies, products, and platforms. Collaboration with integration software architects and engineers is essential to ensure the delivery of suitable solutions and expert guidance.

  

The position requires managing various aspects of the delivery process from end to end. Additionally, research and strategic advisory on optimal digital and IT solutions play a crucial role in supporting digital transformation initiatives. This expertise is fundamental to ensuring that transformation processes are both efficient and effective.

 **What you will do**

  

As part of the API & Integrations team you will contribute to the transformation of our company. You will:

* Gather, review and analyze information and feedback on our digital products and commercial API business
* In collaboration with stakeholders across our business (incl. commercial, legal, governance and finance) gather and document requirements
* Develop internal and external documentation
* Take on the role of scrum master in projects and initiatives, delivering to both internal and external stakeholders such as dealers and customers
* Actively contribute as part of an agile team to sprint planning, prioritization and retrospectives
* Conduct and follow up on testing of APIs and back-end solutions
* Manage and perform API development quality assurance and governance
* Communicate findings and suggestions to team members and other stakeholders

  

You will work closely with stakeholders across the Volvo Group to be in line with changing business needs. You will create the right environment for your team members to deliver value to the organization.

 **Competences and Responsibilities**

  

* Familiarity with IBM middleware and integration platforms (WebSphere, MQ and API Connect), or comparable platforms
* Familiarity with designing and developing REST APIs using Open API specifications standards
* Proven experience in business and systems analysis, including information modeling and tooling
* Proven experience in documenting requirements and testing
* Proven experience in generating system and process documentation
* Leads team efforts in continuous learning and improvement

 **Other skills:**

  

* Strong proficiency in IT Business Analysis and agile methodologies
* Understand principles of data storage and messaging solutions
* Good team player - must be able to work with people at different levels in a global team

 **Ready for the next move?**

  

 Are you excited to bring your skills and disruptive ideas to the table? We can’t wait to hear from you. Apply today!

title: Product Cybersecurity Architect
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**About us**
------------


Our team, 'Cybersecurity Infrastructure Capabilities' is in the heart of a great transformation. We are a central team within the Volvo GTT consisting of Cybersecurity Architects and Experts. We work with developing cybersecurity infrastructure requirements (also called CS System Specification), supporting teams and continuously improving the product cybersecurity management system (PCSMS). In addition to providing high-level attack analysis and vehicle TARA analysis to support the development of work products in accordance with state-of-the-art standards such as ISO/SAE 21434 and UNECE R155, we also operate in multitenant HPC environments.

  

We are also coordinating the CS work across the whole organization at Group Trucks Technology (GTT).

**What you will do**
--------------------


Our mission is to develop and maintain Cybersecurity solutions for our Vehicle platform & infrastructure, both conceptual and Architectural wise. Enable products, managing & governing End-to-End Integrity of cybersecurity solutions in Volvo Group Products. Provide cybersecurity architectural concept and release Cybersecurity infrastructure requirements/ specifications to ensure end-to-end implementation involving various stakeholders.

  

The main responsibility is to ensure Cybersecurity type approval for R155, coordinate the work with technical services and type approval authority.

  

We are therefore looking for Cybersecurity Architects with expertise in various Cybersecurity solutions/concepts who will act as CS Solution Architects.

  

As **CS Solution Architect** you will focus on technical aspects of security solutions and lead the work with conceptual CS solutions and Vehicle architectural topology. You will write high level cybersecurity attribute requirements and provide guidelines for allocation of requirements on ECU level. You will also have the opportunity to work with the latest cybersecurity solutions according to the state of the art, and collaborate with experts within this domain.

**Who are you?**
----------------


You have a broad technical know-how combined with very good people skills and a strong belief in agile methods. You have a good ability to collaborate across teams in a large, complex organization.

 **Qualifications:**

* BSc. or MSc. in Computer Science, Electronics or equivalent
* Experience in at least one of these areas: IT Software/systems, Connectivity or Secure Embedded Software architectural design or cybersecurity concept design.
* Knowledge of connected communication technologies (CAN, Ethernet, Wireless)
* Previous experience of working as CS engineer or CS architect with focus on embedded engineering.
* Deep knowledge on Cybersecurity Concepts & Solutions e.g., Public Key Infrastructure, etc
* Knowledge of TARA execution for complex systems, Security Risk Management and Threat Modelling.
* Knowledge within cybersecurity requirements & system/software engineering.
* Previous experience in secure coding practices and cryptographic algorithms in embedded systems.
* Knowledge of Certificate Life cycle Management, Certificate Authority Management, In-vehicle PKI Implementation is meritorious.
* Experience in agile methods is meritorious
* Experience of working in multitenant (HPC) environments.
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


Curious and have some questions? We have multiple positions open so send in your application and don’t hesitate to reach out to us if you have any questions!

  

For questions about the process, contact Erik Lindberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, at erik.lindberg.3@volvo.com  

Hiring manager: Mahshad Mahally, Director Cybersecurity & Functional Safety.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility with the security of a traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new independent and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a
 **Machine Learning Engineer** 
 at Coody, you’ll dive into exciting and challenging AI projects to build and optimize machine learning models for production use cases, ensuring they are highly efficient and scalable. You’ll also design and build machine learning infrastructure, often in cloud environments, to support large-scale deployments for our customers. Here’s what your day-to-day will look like:
   

  

* Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning products
* Build and maintain infrastructure and tooling as a platform for data scientists
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into production systems
* Monitor and maintain the performance and reliability of ML models post-deployment
* Stay current with the latest advancements in machine learning and related technologies
* Collaborate with clients, support colleagues, contribute to knowledge sharing


****Who you are****
 We’re looking for Machine Learning Engineers with at least
 **3-4 years of experience** 
 and a proven track record of delivering real results. If you’ve got the following, you’re probably a great fit:
   

  

* A track-record of delivering machine learning models in production
* Cloud experience (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud, Kubernetes)
* Experience with distributed data tools (e.g., Spark, Dask, PySpark, Apache Beam)
* Expertise in Python and modern ML/AI libraries (PyTorch/TensorFlow, Transformers, LangChain, LangGraph, Vertex AI)
* Strong understanding of ML infrastructure: deployment, monitoring, debugging, optimization
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or something related
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Gameplay Programmer - Crusader Kings 3
description:
*Are you passionate about strategy games? Do you have a solid C++ background? At Paradox Development Studio, we're offering an exciting opportunity for an experienced Gameplay Programmer to join our dedicated team working on our grand strategy masterpiece, Crusader Kings 3.*
 At Paradox, we are a vibrant mix of game developers and publishers, known worldwide for our strategy games. We're passionate about our gamers, with an active player base of over five million each month across the globe. We bring our games to life, creating immersive experiences for our ever-growing community.
   

  

 We're offering you a chance to contribute to Crusader Kings 3, a game that lets players shape the destinies of noble dynasties across centuries of history. Your input will directly impact the game mechanics and systems, bringing to life the intricate dynamics of medieval politics, warfare, and family relationships on a grand scale.
   

  

**The Skills We’re Looking For**
* Proficiency in C++, with the ability to develop and maintain well-engineered code, focusing on stability and performance.
* Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, with the aptitude to take full ownership of features from understanding the design to implementing the code.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken, to effectively collaborate in our international team.
* Strong communication and teamwork skills, capable of contributing positively to team dynamics and achieving project goals.


 Working at Paradox means being part of a team that values creativity and quality, where you can make a difference and shape the world of strategy gaming. We embrace our nerdy culture, regularly interact with our fans through forums and events, and end each Friday with a social hour to unwind and connect.
   

  

 If you're ready to take ownership of your work and grow as a game developer, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and embark on an exciting journey with Paradox and the Crusader Kings team!
   

  

**Practical Information**
 Scope: Full-time, permanent employment (6 months probation)
   

  

 Reports to: Technical Director
   

  

 Location: Magnus Ladulåsgatan 4, Stockholm
   

  

*We will not relocate for this position!*
 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Backend Engineer - Personalization
description:
On the Personalization Team, we seek to understand the audio world better than anyone else so that we can make great recommendations to every individual person and keep the world listening. Every day, hundreds of millions of people all over the world use the products we build, from Podcast Feeds to Discovery Weekly to DJ. We're a team of technologists, product insight experts, designers, and product managers in Boston, New York, Stockholm, and London.
   

  

 Spotify is looking for a Backend Engineer to join the Search team. Our mission is to help users efficiently find and discover content. We are a highly collaborative team of engineers from multiple disciplines who are passionate about new challenges, product innovation, and building highly scalable distributed systems. We have experience in using new technologies to quickly prototype experiences as well as in building systems that serve content at scale for hundreds of millions of users.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Design, develop, and deliver robust and scalable backend systems and APIs.
* Collaborate with other engineers, product owners, and designers to identify and solve challenging problems and build new product features.
* Write clean, maintainable, well-documented code, adhering to coding best practices.
* Participate in the improvement of our software development standards and practices.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging backend technologies and best practices.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have experience writing distributed, high-volume Java services and know how to deploy and keep them running in production.
* You feel comfortable reading and writing Python code.
* You have a good understanding of data structures and algorithms and understand how to apply them to design pragmatic solutions.
* You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and can communicate your ideas to technical and non-technical audiences.
* You love working in an environment where you constantly experiment and iterate quickly.
* You believe data is the most powerful tool for informed decision-making.
* You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code.
* You have practical experience with Kubernetes.
* You have practical experience managing and operating scalable search engines like ElasticSearch or Vespa.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the EMEA region as long as we have a work location. \*excluding France for now due to on-call restrictions.
* This team operates within the Central Eastern time zone for collaboration.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Servicenow Developer
description:
Hi all,
   

  

 We are hunting for ServiceNow Developer to our reputed client in Stockholm.
   

  

 About Us:
   

  

 ITIVE AB is seeking a highly skilled Service Now Developer to join our client team in Stockholm . As a Service Now Developer, you will be responsible for the design, development, and implementation of Service Now solutions for our clients. This is a full-time position with opportunities for growth and career advancement.
   

  

**Skills requirements:**
* Strong experience in hands-on development in ServiceNow
* Strong experience in ITSM module implementation and customizations.

* Collaboration ability with architects, lead developer and the team members.
* Ability to lead technical discussions if needed and mentor junior developers
